text:
Atmosphere - 10/5
Coffee - 5/5
Service - 5/5

On my next stop with my summer coffee shop adventures, I came across Espresso Yourself. If you don't look closely, you are sure to pass it up because it is tucked away in a quiet neighborhood.

Atmosphere: This was one of my favorite things that I noticed about the coffee shop. It is full of warm, positive messages from patrons as well as positive slogans hanging on the walls. A nice selection of couches and artsy tables to choose from. It felt like walking into a home which made the environment wonderful to work in. I felt a sense of calmness while sitting down which was something I hadn't felt in a long time when getting to work.

Coffee - I have a tendency to just get my go-to favorite of a caramel latte with extra caramel, but I decided to go with the special which was the Honey Vanilla Lavender. You could taste each flavor individually which I appreciated it and the lavender wasn't overpowering.

A bonus: It came in an adorable mug that you would find in your kitchen which made the experience homier. I love it when coffee shops veer away from the basic clean cut cups of just solid colors

Service: Everyone was helpful and kind and assisted me with navigating through the menu. Patience is something I appreciate it when I arrive at a new place. It makes the experience all the better. Also, they have a point system that stays in house which makes me happy because I won't lose it as I have with other places lol

Overall, I may have found my new place to work and write. The environment and the coffee is something to experience. If you are over near the macklind area, go over to Espresso Yourself. It's worth it :)
name: Espresso Yourself Coffee & Cafe
categories: Caterers, Event Planning & Services, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Coffee & Tea

text: They have made my family's birthday cakes for quite some time. Great products and wonderful customer service!!
name: Bello's Bakery

text:
Cute cafe in the middle of Southampton Neighborhood right off Macklind Ave. Quirky decor, natural light, and light jazz music makes it a wonderful place to sip your coffee slowly. Speaking of coffee, they have a good coffee menu and even have smoothies and a small treat selection. I got the Skippy-Do-Da which is a signature latte flavored peanut butter, honey, and dark chocolate.  I love the complex flavors. It was $4.75 for 16oz which is on the cusp of pricey, but reasonable for a signature beverage. 

I also purchased some salted caramels (from Nosh STL) sold at the counter...couldn't resist. It was hard not to also purchase the dark chocolate covered espresso beans...like really hard. 

We will be back for sure. Welcome to the neighborhood!
name: Espresso Yourself Coffee & Cafe
categories: Caterers, Event Planning & Services, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Coffee & Tea

text:
Cozy little coffee shop with free WiFi, a couple of cool drink concoctions, a few food/pastry options, and very friendly staff. I went with a friend on a Sunday morning, and it was pretty empty. 

I liked the decor a lot. It felt cool but not like they were trying too hard. They had both indoor and outdoor seating. The indoor seating consisted of a few tables and a few booths/benches by tables, and the outdoor seating was very dog friendly and had some water bowls for dogs.  

They have a bunch of different flavored late options as well as kombucha, smoothies, and "soda coffee" (something that I had never seen before). The soda coffee is either seltzer or kombucha with a shot of espresso. I tried out the kombucha soda coffee and it tasted a little odd, but pretty much what I wold have expected. I enjoyed the experience, but I will probably not order it again. 

They do not have many food options, and, in addition, I tried to order the breakfast bowl and the organic granola bar, but they were out of both. I ended up going with a blueberry muffin instead. They initially forgot my blueberry muffin, but apologized and gave it to me as soon as I reminded them. The blueberry muffin was very delicious! It was super soft and incredibly flavorful. 

The manager came out and introduced herself to me and my friend and was very welcoming as well!
name: Espresso Yourself Coffee & Cafe
categories: Caterers, Event Planning & Services, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Coffee & Tea

text: Great coffee and quiche. Really nice menu with lots of options. Cool, relaxed vibe and kid friendly. Dogs welcome on the outside patio too!! Great addition to the SoHa neighborhood. We will definitely be making it a regular spot!
name: Espresso Yourself Coffee & Cafe
categories: Caterers, Event Planning & Services, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Coffee & Tea

text:
Things I like:

- Kombucha on tap!
- Lots of natural light
- Clean, eclectic look
- Mixed decor (tables, chairs, etc)
- PLANTS!
- Music selection
- Non-plastic straws
- Readily available ice water
- Real spoons for stirring (not plastic)
- PLANTS!

My "Warm and Fuzzy" was delicious. My hot date's smoothie was good too. One thing that I especially loved is the music. Not only was is a good selection, but it was a reasonable volume. No need to shout at your coffee date here! The outdoor seating is cute too. 

Things I don't like:

- No Splenda or other zero calorie sweeteners (other than Stevia, gross)
- More quick food/snack options, maybe something not sweet
name: Espresso Yourself Coffee & Cafe
categories: Caterers, Event Planning & Services, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Coffee & Tea

text: Horrible service! Stopped here after church, with myself, and two kiddos. I can imagine when I walked in, the staff probably thought here's a mess waiting to happen (due to the two kiddos age 19 months, and 6). Some highlights were not enough napkins, and our waitress asked if we wanted more rolls about half way through our meal, I said yes, and we never received more. Just throwing this out there too:  the kiddos were very well behaved, we stacked our dishes, and made the table easy to clean prior to leaving, and as it should be, I tipped for what the full bill would have been (kids meals  free on Sundays). This location is better for me, but I will gladly go out of my way to the Arnold location in the future.

categories: Caterers, Event Planning & Services, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Coffee & Tea

text:
It makes me so happy to support small businesses in my neighborhood...b even more so when the staff are so friendly and kind! 

I thoroughly enjoy every time I go here and usually just chug my drink before snapping a picture! Today was chilly and damp outside so I actually got a hot drink instead of my typical cold brew. Terrific amount of foam on my latte, milk steamed to perfection, and the depth of the espresso roast is bold and smooth. Great way to start a weekend! 

If you haven't been here...treat yourself and try the bananas foster! You won't be sorry. Cheers!
name: Espresso Yourself Coffee & Cafe
categories: Caterers, Event Planning & Services, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Coffee & Tea

text: Visited this bakery over the summer and was so impressed with, not only the delicious cookies and brownies but two younger girls who were so friendly and helpful.  I was not planning on buying brownies but the one girl said they were her favorite so I tried them and she was right.  They are delicious.  The owner also greeted me and was so nice.  I went in today and was not met by two unhappy women behind the counter.  I felt like I was inconveniencing them by trying to order a box of pastries.  Not a smile, nor even looked in the eye once.  The owner walked by and was very pleasant but the two counter people were extremely unfriendly.  The baked goods are wonderful but the atmosphere in the store is depressing.
name: Bello's Bakery
categories: Food, Mediterranean, Breakfast & Brunch, Desserts, Restaurants, German, Greek, Bakeries

text:
Okay, so no photos because I only ever get coffee there, but I do see regularly.

If you look up most lists of coffee shops in St Louis (which I have), you will not see this. And I have no clue why. I mean one, it is an awesome name. And two, if I tried to make up an image of a neighborhood coffee shop in my head, this is what I'd come up with.

The vibe here, again, is friendly. There is seating inside and outside, and you'll often see someone who must've stopped by while walking their dog or going for a daily walk just chilling with a drink at an outside table.

Based upon their great array of specialty lattes, I would say that their focus is more on the casual, not particularly pretentious coffee drinkers. Which to me is fine, since St Louis has plenty of the more pretentious coffee shops.

The only knock on this place is that because it is in a neighborhood, parking is limited and on the street. Usually if I stop by early, it's not an issue. But it is something to keep in mind.

Overall, I definitely recommend this place. You might find somewhere with better coffee or better food, but it's just a pleasant place to hang out in. Definitely a hidden gem.
name: Espresso Yourself Coffee & Cafe
categories: Caterers, Event Planning & Services, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Coffee & Tea

text: We stumbled upon Bello's while looking for fresh Rye bread. He had a fresh loaf straight out of the oven and it did not disappoint. This was the best rye bread I've ever had. Since then we've made this our local bakery. Bello (I think that's his name) himself is always so friendly, making us feel at home every time we are in the shop. I've never had a pastry I didn't like here but my favorite has to be the Baklava that special sauce he puts on top is simply amazing!
name: Bello's Bakery
categories: Food, Mediterranean, Breakfast & Brunch, Desserts, Restaurants, German, Greek, Bakeries

text: WOW! First pumpkin spice latte of the season with turmeric?!?! What?! Amazing... so so so good. Such a charming little space too. As a barista myself I'm very picky, and these ladies know what their doing! Highly Recommend
name: Espresso Yourself Coffee & Cafe
categories: Caterers, Event Planning & Services, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Coffee & Tea

text: New to the neighborhood and they were open today so we stopped by for a morning coffee and breakfast. I got the Sweet as can Bee with almond milk and my husband got the Delight Mint but he picked whole milk (he got nervous when asked for some reason). Both were really delicious and it was a hefty amount. We also got the breakfast burrito and split it. It was kind of pricey but it was tasty. We are from Texas so $6.50 for a breakfast burrito seems steep. The salsa was homemade and chunky and really flavorful like the kind we used to get at A Second Cup. Overall a great place and we will try it again!
name: Espresso Yourself Coffee & Cafe
categories: Caterers, Event Planning & Services, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Coffee & Tea

text: Just ate  Thanksgiving cookies. Excellent balance. Not full of sugar just right. What a great old school  tradition.

text: I still cannot believe it. Upon walking in the woman behind the counter was UNBELIEVABLY rude. No smile, no hello, and a HORRIBLE attitude. I'm almost 40 years old, have lived all over the country, overseas, traveled the world, and can honestly say I've NEVER experienced such complete rudeness when trying to purchase something from someone. I grew up in this neighborhood, frequented this place prior to it being Bellos, and recently moved back with my husband and children. I was excited to come back in and have cookies made for my son's birthday, but couldn't even follow through with the order because I was so ASTONISHED by this woman's attitude. I do want to be clear that this woman had long black hair, piercings and tattoos (Though you can't always see them, I too have piercings and tattoos so let me be clear that this was NOT the issue). I'm clarifying because I would imagine that there are some very courteous and professional people employed at this establishment who are not deserving of this review. But you are only as strong as your weakest link, and I could not go in good conscious without posting something. To top it off, she actually took my phone out of my hand to take back to the kitchen after she told me she didn't know if they could make a Lego cookie. She said nothing else after saying she didn't know if they could make the cookie, lips harshly pursed while looking off to the side (yes, that is actually an accurate account)! So I asked if she could ask the bakers. ( I was already very offended at this point). She offered another rude expression, shook her head at me and grabbed MY phone without even asking me if she could take it for a minute, which I would have gladly allowed her to do. I'm absolutely blown away! She can't possibly be like this to everyone! To conclude here, upon leaving I said that I would not be purchasing the cookies, that she had been very rude and that she seemed to be a very unhappy person. She smiled the most smirky smile I will probably ever see in person until my kids are teenagers, and so I walked out. I felt nothing but sadness upon walking out of there and will not be coming back. Thank goodness we have several good bakeries in this neighborhood because I will no longer be frequenting this place.
name: Bello's Bakery
categories: Food, Mediterranean, Breakfast & Brunch, Desserts, Restaurants, German, Greek, Bakeries

text: My chicken in the Caesar Salad was cold and hard. Like the left over chicken you leave in the fridge as left overs for two days... The lettuce itself was soggy ....come on .Salad had dressing on it but why not include a cup of Caesar ? Other than that this salad would be great if the chicken wasn't cold and hard..
name: The Pasta House Co

text:
This is NOT Italian, and why the hell did I eat here when the hill is like 20 minutes away? ICK
I heard the pasta con broccoli was the way to go so my daughter and I shared it. Well, let me rephrase that, I had one bite and was done. The sauce was so thick (supposedly Alfredo) yet, my son who got fettucini Alfredo was a much whiter sauce that was thin and much more appealing looking.  It seems my sauce was probably sitting in the heating table until it was almost gone, so it had cooked down way too much and they must have prepared a fresh one upon realizing there was not enough for the dishes, as it was also dry and no extra sauce on the bottom of the bowl to be found. 
My daughter also did not eat and we left a whole plate of food. 
I got an email for signing up for their announcements to claim 6 piece toasted ravioli for free. This was so bad, the edges were hard and tough to chew as if microwaved. The marinara sauce too sweet for my liking.

The salad came and was drenched with dressing. Pieces of the salad were GREY in color, I'm not even sure how that happens...I thought there was something stuck to my  lettuce, but, no, just gooey grey lettuce.
They do bring rolls to the table, but, nothing worth having.
The servers were nice, I did not complain as I know this is a chain and it is what it is. I just won't be back. 
Maybe this is popular because locals are raised in this, and they don't know better....
name: The Pasta House Co

text:
We have a group of friends that get together once a month to dine at places around the Fenton-High Ridge area.  
Last night we planned to go to Smoking Barrels in Fenton but when we arrived they were closed. (only open Thur-Sat?)
We needed a place at the last minute for our large group. I called High Ridge Pasta House and Taylor answer the phone like a pro. 
She checked with Chris, the manager, and he said come on in.
15 minutes later we were seated at a table, all together, with our server ready and waiting. Our server was awesome and the food was great.
name: The Pasta House Co

text:
Consider this your home away from home. Walking into this cafe, I felt like I was walking into the living room of a family member. I love the cozy, mismatched furniture and the homey decorations, and they had the place decked out for the holiday season, too. 

They've got awesome specials, including seasonal rotations, but I had a french press to see how their coffee was on its own - I was not disappointed. They served it to me in a real mug so that I could settle in and spend time with my friends while I enjoyed the brew. 

My favorite thing about this place is how intentional everything is - they partner with local organizations and businesses (like Seeds of Happiness and animal rescue groups, they leave used coffee grounds outside so people can take them for free and use for a variety of purposes, they offer crayons and coloring pages for kids, and they even have events like open mic night or painting classes. 

Basically, if you want to have a good cup of coffee, and feel really good about where your money is going, swing by this place. 

Tips: they do have food (pasties, breakfast burritos, chicken wraps, etc.), there is outdoor seating, there is a water bowl for dogs out front, and there is free WiFi.
name: Espresso Yourself Coffee & Cafe
categories: Caterers, Event Planning & Services, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Coffee & Tea

text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place. Have gone about a dozen times at this point. Really cute place, with an awesome patio, and an even better drink menu. I recommend the cloud 9 on ice. The staff is all super nice. Definitely one of my go to spots for coffee!

text:
This stretch of Manchester road is spoiled for Bakeries. Within a quarter mile you have Bello's Bakery, The Daily Bread, and Nathaniel Reeds. I stopped in a Bello's one morning when my pregnant wife had a hankering for donuts. 

The shop has counters with donuts and baked goods and there are some fresh breads on display. I can only speak to the donuts, but we enjoyed everything we got. Also I have to mention that the donuts are just GIGANTIC. One long john here would be equal to about 1.5 anywhere else. The donuts hit the spot and the prices were reasonable. I'd recommend the bakery to anyone in need of a sugar fix in the morning.
name: Bello's Bakery
categories: Food, Mediterranean, Breakfast & Brunch, Desserts, Restaurants, German, Greek, Bakeries

text: We've eaten here forever. One of our favorites. We love the pizza and several of the pasta dishes. We always get the signature salad. They have worked hard to stay open and serve the neighborhood during the pandemic. Unfortunately, when we ate there this weekend,  I was sorry to see how the kitchen was operating. NO ONE had on a mask. The owner was there, helping to box up to go orders. His mask was on his chin. The two cooks a man and a blonde woman had no masks or gloves on. Every server wore a mask. They know the rules. Sorry but we won't be back until the virus is over.
name: The Pasta House Co

text:
Right off of Macklind, across from Big River Running, you will find this cute coffee shop. The interior is cute decorating with lots of tables of various sizes. We took the table at the front corner next to the electric fireplace-- so cozy!

I had a cappuccino with oat milk (one of thew STL cafes to have oat milk!). My husband ordered the Edith Grey tea. I don't remember the name, but they buy all their teas from a woman-owned tea place.

Why only 4 stars instead of 5? Well, the drinks were only average. I have had much tastier coffee and teas elsewhere in the city. But the staff were super friendly and the ambiance is so cozy!
name: Espresso Yourself Coffee & Cafe
categories: Caterers, Event Planning & Services, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Coffee & Tea

text: Mixed review.  Over priced coffee ($4.00 for a regular drip iced coffee) and the woman stares at her phone while I'm standing in front of her at the counter waiting to order. On a positive note, another staff came out and offered my dogs treats and water and was super friendly.  I'll be back for sure and since this is right down the block from me, I want them to do well.

categories: Caterers, Event Planning & Services, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Coffee & Tea

text: This is my favorite bakery in St. Louis! I've been coming here since I was a kid, and continue to come by whenever I'm in the area. Their iced cookies are the best around, and the other cookies and baked goods are fantastic as well. I ordered custom iced cookies for my wedding in 2016 and they turned out wonderful. Mr. Bello has done a wonderful job taking over the bakery in the last few years. Highly recommend!
name: Bello's Bakery
categories: Food, Mediterranean, Breakfast & Brunch, Desserts, Restaurants, German, Greek, Bakeries

text:
Wonderful atmosphere with even better coffee. The design of the space is super funky and fun. It is a great place to escape for a bit and have a coffee, chat with a friend, or even just to get out of the house. 

It's also is connected to sisters sandwich shop which my husband and I popped right over to to grab a bite. The sandwiches were delicious and the services as both places was great! I found out later that the two shops are owned and operated by sisters. 

The two shops are situation in a great location that is walking distance from our house and is right off of macklind. 

Highly recommend.
name: Espresso Yourself Coffee & Cafe
categories: Caterers, Event Planning & Services, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Coffee & Tea

text:
What I love about this place is the fact that they are doing the right thing. They are social distancing. They have correct barriers they are protecting their staff and they are protecting their patrons. The pasta was fantastic my husband had lasagna and loved it! I had linguine and white clam sauce that was to die for! Erica is our favorite server here we love her!  
Kudos to Pasta house for caring for Everyone!

text: I stumbled upon Espresso Yourself when I was looking through my Experience Booklet. I used to live in that neighborhood and I'm disappointed I never knew! Service was friendly as soon as you walk in the door. They have a lot of fun flavor options for lattes and I really liked the Skippidity Do Da. It was really surprising! Peanut butter and coffee? It's delicious but the lattes are definitely on the little too sweet side. I love that they offer oat milk and also coffee cubes! I will definitely be back to try some more fun creations.

text: My family and I love this coffee shop. It is our favorite place to go on the weekend and get some coffee for the adults and a smiley cookie for the kiddo.
name: Espresso Yourself Coffee & Cafe

text: Espresso Yourself is a great coffee shop for many reasons. It has ample seating inside and out, it is open past 2 on Sundays, there are many food choices, and the staff is friendly! They also have a rewards program, which is always a good incentive to go back. My drink of choice is chai, and I didn't really enjoy that part of the experience, unfortunately. It was really sweet and tasted like it was powder with water. However, because this was my first time there, and there are so many other redeeming qualities, I will definitely be back. It is also a nice gem close to the SW Garden neighborhood, and there is a Friends door, so how can I not go back?!
name: Espresso Yourself Coffee & Cafe
categories: Caterers, Event Planning & Services, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Coffee & Tea

text: This was my first visit and likely my last. I bought assorted cookies and what a disappointment. The cookies were thin, hard and had the same basic flavor (no different than store bought ones.) I expected much better quality, better flavor and variety from a bakery.

text: I absolutely love the vibe of this coffee shop! The variety of drinks they offer definitely made my coffee choice a tough decision but I was very happy with my choice of the Ari's Light(white chocolate, honey, lavender). I went on a Saturday and they had an amazing live duo band playing on the patio. I wish I could have stayed all day!! Now the food leaves something to be desired but this is a coffee shop so you never know what you are going to get. My scone was okay. I also got a sandwich at the connected Sisters Sandwich shop which left a lot to be desired, especially with the price. The bread was bland, took over the sandwich so you couldn't taste the meat and seemed like it may have been old. The flavoring of my chicken salad was good but I ended up taking it home and putting it in a tortilla so I could enjoy the flavor.  So overall, go here for a fun yet relaxing atmosphere or drink on a neighborhood patio.
name: Espresso Yourself Coffee & Cafe
categories: Caterers, Event Planning & Services, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Coffee & Tea

text: My wife & I went there late afternoon Monday on 08/02/21.  We had a fantastic friendly waitress who was attentive and brought our food out quickly.  We ordered house salads, I ordered the Tutto Mare & she had the Spaghetti Bolognese and plenty of rolls upon request.  Everything was delicious with generous portion sizes.  Of course, we couldn't eat it all and had to get two take home boxes.  I had to save room for their Tiramisu which is excellent!!!  The leftovers were just as good as when we were served.  We will definitely be back!
name: The Pasta House Co

text:
Darling and artsy neighborhood coffee shop in the trendy South Hampton neighborhood along Macklind, but worth the drive over even if you aren't a local! The staff is so friendly and I enjoyed hearing them greet customers by name. There are a variety of comfortable seating spaces and tables inside and out.

They have all the coffee classics you would want plus innovative specials. I ordered the "warm and fuzzy" which was a Chai pumpkin latte. It was flavorful and not too sweet or overpowering that it masked the coffee flavor. To eat I had the tomato bagel melt. It was more of a snack size so perfect if your hungry but don't want to be stuffed.

I had been here a while ago when they were newer and left feeling indifferent...not sure why. I'm so glad I came back! Bonus points for the Beatles Playlist they had on.
name: Espresso Yourself Coffee & Cafe
categories: Caterers, Event Planning & Services, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Coffee & Tea

text:

Olivia was our server and she did a great job. Of course, we got to see our favorite waitress Erika . 
They have amazing staff here.
name: The Pasta House Co

text:
The former Clayton's Bakery set a standard for delicious baked goods.  Now run by one of the Clayton Bakery Bakers.  Mr. Beni Bello purchased the business and changed the name to Bello's Bakery.  He has been professionally baking for 24 years.

Rustic Coffee Cakes, Stoles, Iced Cookies, and Breads are my favorite items at Bello's.  The Iced Cookies are a favorite to make children smile from ear to ear.  I have also had Birthday Cakes from Bello's that everyone has enjoyed.  If you order a Birthday Cake, ask about icing and filling options.  It is best to place an order after the morning rush, when you can ask questions.

If you are driving East on Manchester, Bello's is an easy stop.  There is parking in front of the bakery as well as on the side.
name: Bello's Bakery
categories: Food, Mediterranean, Breakfast & Brunch, Desserts, Restaurants, German, Greek, Bakeries

text:
I originally ate here a couple weeks ago. Decided not to "yelp" it until I went to the "sister" location next door. They are both run by the same women and they even have an open door between the two locations. It's just that the other serves lunch. 
Yesterday I took a couple people to try it.  One was my friend that went with me a couple weeks ago and the other was a newbie. 
We had every intention in going into the sandwich shop. Honestly we did. But the newbie wanted an espresso and after looking at the menu I couldn't shake my thoughts of the breakfast burrito that I got last week. So we apologized to the staff waiting to take our order and went through the opening to the other side.  My friend who went with me last week got the same thing from the week prior...burrito and iced tea - she said it's the best tea in the city. The newbie followed her lead and got the burrito and a double espresso. He loved both.  I really wanted to try something different. I wanted this review to talk about something other than a breakfast burrito but I couldn't do it.  I did however get an iced Chai tea latte with a shot of espresso. 
A little backstory before I tell you how I really feel about this burrito and my beverage. There was this place on Hampton that I went to weekly for breakfast. He had the best breakfast burrito and homemade salsa in Saint Louis.  It was the perfect heat (even for me...I'm a wuss) and he served it with potatoes and it was a delightfully filling meal. Sadly, he isn't open anymore but I'll continue to rate any breakfast burrito against his. 
All that being said this breakfast burrito is chock full of egg with the perfect amount of bacon. I'm guessing the bacon is chopped because there aren't any tough bites where you have to rip a piece of bacon in half. You know what I'm saying? The salsa isn't made in house but I was told it's made somewhere in town. So not some Old El Paso stuff.  It again looked like it wasn't enough food but it honestly was the right amount. As for my beverage... this is why it's a 4 for me (it would probably be a 5 for my pals but hey, I'm writing this) - last week I had the black tea and while I always put sweetener in it I had to put more cuz it was a little too bitter for me.  Not bitter as in old but bitter bitter.  (That should clear it up.  Haha) Yesterday's Chai tea latte with the shot of espresso was also bitter. I know what you are thinking but when I get this at other locations it's not bitter. The good thing about it is that I didn't slurp it all down real fast like I usually do I really took my time with it.  So it lasted through my breakfast. Which was nice because even though it was really warm out there was a great breeze on the outside patio. 
I'll let you know if I ever get to the sandwich shop. Not sure if that's gonna happen any time soon since I'm already thinking about that breakfast burrito.
name: Espresso Yourself Coffee & Cafe
categories: Caterers, Event Planning & Services, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Coffee & Tea

text:
After multiple visits and countless laps around this place, I think it has officially become my favorite place to get groceries, and, effectively, one of my go to lunch spots.  

My first trip here was quite the introduction, as I walked into a store wide event with booths set up in multiple aisles featuring tastings of a number of different beer brands, none of which I had ever heard of.  I'm no beer guy by any means, but it was nice to have a chance to try some brands I may never have tried before, and hosting events like this will make me at least pay attention.  

Most of the rest of my time here has been a lunch stop, where the salad bar has been a weekly stop for me.  Along with the salad bar, there is a decent sized selection of hot foods, pre-made sandwiches, soups, and desserts.  Despite all the options for the food, I think my favorite feature of this particular Schnucks is the mini checkout counter for the entire lunch area.  Forget taking that salad to the main registers for checkout, just pay at the lunch checkout and be on your way.  It's a fantastic feature that I use every time!  

Aside from great events, and an awesome lunch selection, this Schnucks stocks the most beer variety of any grocery store I have ever visited.  The rest of the store is clean, neat, and organized beyond expectation, and it has been a great shopping experience for me at each visit.
name: Schnucks Lindenwood

text:
This store reminds me a little of my beloved Wegmans in NY. The produce department is large and in charge with beautiful fruits, veggies, and plenty of organic options.

They have prepared food departments where you can get sushi, sandwiches, subs and pizza. The meat department carries a decent variety of antibiotic-free meats with no added hormones. The floral department is near the entrance of the store so you can grab some flowers for Lovey and make a quick exit.

Good variety of brand name almond milks which are reasonably priced. There is a small selection of GF items but there may be more throughout the store.

There is a bank located inside the store, Redbox, lotto machines, a huge wine department that promotes wine drinking with a larger discount (15%) for purchasing 6 or more bottles on Wednesday vs other days of the week (10%).

It still isn't a Wegmans which ranks 5 stars on my scale. It's probably 4+ stars, rounded up to 5.
name: Schnucks Lindenwood

text:
The new Schnucks is close to my house, so I have been going there as opposed to 'my Dierbergs' which is a few miles farther.
Prices are reasonable. The store caters to the university student, which I like. It always seems clean, although I did see a mouse run across the entryway and into the wood bundles once.
The checkers are slow. Twice I have been behind people who were using checks, stamps, or cards to subsidize their grocery bill. Both times the checkers could not figure out how to credit the charges. Management came to help, but they struggled as well. In both instances the customer was embarrassed and frustrated. One even turned to me and apologized for holding up the line. I feel like the manager should have acknowledged the customers in line- or opened another register.
Also, there are not enough cart corrals near the store.
name: Schnucks Lindenwood

text: This place gets three stars for convenience of location, good variety, and nice layout. HOWEVER on no less than 3 separate occasions i've gotten home to realize at least one or two things i purchased were past their expiration date. This location is terrible about rotating out their products so beware. You would think i'd learn by now, but i usually go get groceries after ive worked a 12 hr midnight shift and i dont always remember to check everything, especially if im tired and in a hurry. I also had an incident where the cashier bagged some of my groceries while i bagged the rest. She forgot to hand me the hamburger i purchased for dinner from behind her station and didnt notice because i was also bagging. So also make sure you leave with all your bags.

text:
I used to be loyal to Schnucks and I was so excited for this new store to open closer to home so I could start shopping there more frequently again. However, I just returned home from the fourth trip in a row in which this Schnucks was of multiple basic ingredients in the produce department. I ended up walking out and driving over to Dierbergs on Zumbehl where I found everything I needed in half the time it takes me to pick my way through the new poorly laid out Schnucks. 

The store layout is not at all intuitive - this is probably done to encourage you to browse and buy more than you intended but I like to get in and out of the grocery store as quickly as possible and find it frustrating that I still cannot find the basics without going on a scavenger hunt every time I'm in the store. 

The staff is really nice and I love the craft beer selection in the liquor department but I simply do not have the time to make extra stops every time I grocery shop because Schnucks can't keep basics in stock.
name: Schnucks Lindenwood

text:
Just want a sandwich and chips? Valenti's on Main Street is a place to check out.

A nice assortment of deli meats, cheeses and breads in an old style family shop is sure to hit the spot.

Self serve drink area and attractive dining area is just right for a quick bite in historic Saint Charles, Missouri. The menu is hand written on a blackboard. Service staff is very friendly, thanking me several times during our lunch. The place was packed, but no one had to wait very long to order. 

Try the Rueben or Santa Fe sandwich. All are served with a Hershey's Kiss to end with a sweet taste. A small assortment of Italian spices and imported can goods compliments the decor for a Hill type feeling.

I can't really get excited going to Subway or chain type sandwich place. Something is appealing going to a family owned lunch restaurant. On cold days grab a cup of soup here then window shop on Main Street.
name: Valenti's Delicatessen and Market

Do not, I repeat do NOT go to their pharmacy! They have no idea what they are doing. They told me at least 3 times that my order was not in their computer which I thought was odd, then I called my doctor and they told me, they did send it, I was wondering did they send it to the wrong place or something? No, my stuff was ready, the stupid girl "Mackenzie" did not know where to look apparently in their computer system? I guess she's new? But don't tell me my order is not there when in fact it IS. Finally after the 5th time of her looking for it, I finally got it.  Then when she, the "pharmacy tech" swiped my debit card and it came back declined but the funds are fine. I don't know what she did when she swiped it, but now my bank has to send me a new card for whatever she did to my debit. she asked me FOR my pin number. um, no. I am calling the manager tomorrow, Repeat!..don't use their pharmacy! what a mess. I have to change pharmacy now. Cuz, NEVER again!!
but the rest of the store is perfectly nice and pretty and all good.

text:
Overall if you are in this area and you prefer not to go to a Wal-Mart and do not mind paying more for your groceries, then this place is alright to go to.  They tend to have what you're looking for in stock.  They have a decent produce area but nothing special.  They do have a salad bar and also a good lunch-to-go area that's easy to grab a sandwich, chips, and a soda to go or eat there.  Also, they do accept Apple Pay which is a nice feature that not a lot of stores have active yet.

From going here several times now I can say the customer service here is average on a good day.  You do pay a little more for your items here for the service of bagging; on several occasions I have had to bag my own groceries even when it hasn't been busy. The people at customer service have been somewhat rude when I have had a question or have had issues with the self-checkout area. 

Since this store is within a half-mile of my house, I tend to find myself going here more often now than driving somewhere else, however if I'm not busy and do not mind driving to another grocery store then I tend to go somewhere else for cheaper groceries.
name: Schnucks Lindenwood

text:
I can't believe I haven't written a review for this store yet. It's now the closest Schnucks to my house and also the closest grocery store to my house (although IGA might be a tad closer, it's a lot smaller.)

Was pretty excited for the opening of this store. While I find Dierbergs to be acceptable, their prices are also pretty outrageous sometimes (at times entering the Whole Foods/Paycheck realm of insanity) so I am glad I can drive a shorter distance to get cheaper food at the same quality or better. 
But there are still items they simply do not carry at this store, e.g. Soy Vay. I was crushed when I saw they didn't have it. But instead of going to Dierbergs, I just bought a three pack on amazon, hell yea! You can request that the begin carrying a certain product at the front, though I did this right when they first opened (I wanna say August 2014?) and they never called me about it, so I wonder if they just couldn't get it thru the distributor or what? Either way, not the end of the world, just a point I wanted to note.

I like the sushi counter because there's this one really friendly dude who has my favorite combos memorized and he sees me coming and knows what's up. I usually grab that, and a bottle of wine, or two, or three.... their wine prices still can't beat TJ's unless there's a sale, but whatevs. Until they open a TJ's in St. Chuck, I don't mind coming here. Nice, new, and clean.

Unfortunately, every time I go to check out, there's ALWAYS a person in front of me paying with a check. I was like....wtf. Bro, do you even credit card? It wouldn't be a pain or anything normally, but in the particular instances in which I had the misfortune of getting sandwiched into a lane with said check writer in front of me, the individual made an error, or the cashier made an error, which led to the whole thing becoming a 5-10 minute ordeal. At which point all of my crap was already on the conveyor and I just shrugged and stood there reading trashy magazines and forcing myself to not start eating kit kats. :P Really not a Schnucks problem as much of a weirdo St. Chuck people thing. lol. 

Oh yeah and they have tiramisu gelato. Fuck yes!
name: Schnucks Lindenwood

text:
Stopped in today based on other Yelp reviews and we were very glad that we did. It's a cute little deli located along a cool colonial street filled with restaurants and specialty shops.
We both ordered a Rueben , mine with pastrami and the other with corned beef. Both came out of the kitchen piled high with meat on very well toasted and delicious marble rye.
The meat on both was tender,moist and delicious. I actually preferred the corned beef over the pastrami but it was a close call. We both enjoyed the extra tangy sauerkraut that topped sandwiches.
We both had potato salad on the side and really like the flavor and texture.
We finished with fresh made cannolis that were nice and crisp and seemed to have a hint of almond inside.
For around $25. We got two terrific sandwiches and drinks and that's a bargain so such quality. We look forward to going back soon.
name: Valenti's Delicatessen and Market

text:
I shop at this Schnucks at least once each week--  sometimes other days, too, if I find I need to pick up extras.

I've found the customer service to be fine, the layout is fine, and their rotation of product is mostly fine.  There have been a few times I've found expired product on shelves waiting to be bought.

My biggest complaint is that they don't consistently remove sale price tabs under products.  I think I'm buying a product for a price that's cheaper than what rings up at the register.  Of course, if I remember to review the receipt before leaving, I can wait, and talk to someone at customer service.  They have to investigate, but will refund the difference.  I make the point because this is an ongoing problem.  It happens ALOT.

Otherwise, this store is fine.  I will continue going there.
name: Schnucks Lindenwood

text:
Every meal ends with a kiss from the staff! A Hersey's chocolate kiss!

Next time you're on Main Street in historic St. Charles, get a Deli sandwich or salad at Valenti's Delicatessen and Market Place. This is a locally owned Deli if you are tired of the big chains.

I had a tasty New Yorker, pastrami piled high on toasted marble rye. It really hit the spot...I we would only recommend a pickle slice should be included.

Checkered tablecloths and a great view of Mainstreet. Self serve soda fountain will my favorite, diet Dr. Pepper.  Two Hershey:s chocolate kisses to finish your meal.

Perfecto!
name: Valenti's Delicatessen and Market

text: I was lucky enough to score reservations for their premiere weekend, and was not disappointed! They have somehow elevated what I already considered one of the most beautiful brunch spots in St Louis. But the decor is nothing compared to the food! The win "best of" from me on two counts - the most amazing blueberry pancakes I have ever had. Somehow crispy on the outside but fluffy and light inside. And the Eggs Benedict. I have no words. I didn't even know what hollandaise sauce could be in the right hands. I highly recommend a brunch visit - and don't forget to take home a new plant baby from Bowood Farms while you are there!
name: Bowood by Niche

text:
Absolutely incredible!  

Brought a group of 12 for lunch on a Saturday.  A group that size on Saturday often throws off smaller restaurants.  Not Valenti's!  

I had called ahead and requested space for the group.  They were very accommodating on the phone.  When I arrived 20 minutes early, they had already placed tables together and were ready for us.

The owner/manager stopped by our table and chatted with us.  Made us feel very welcome.  

One friend had the Lobster Reuben.  He said he would return just for that.  I had the Valenti's special sandwich.  So big I could only eat half.  Also had a side of their pasta salad.  Very unusual and DELICIOUS!  Not a single complaint (not even a tiny one) from any of my friends.  Every meal included a chocolate Hershey's Kiss.

Thank you so much for a relaxing and enjoyable lunch.  We'll be back.
name: Valenti's Delicatessen and Market

text:
The Good: Egg Sandwich, Eggs Benedict,Cacio e pepe eggs - all were delicious!

The Not-So-Good: Bowood was out of ALL of their bakery items, as well as matcha from the coffee bar.

Ambiance: The place was open and airy and filled greenery! Super cute place 

Service: The server we had was very friendly and pleasant, however everything was really S..L..O..W. Our total time in the restaurant for a table of 5 was almost 3 hours.

Overall: My experience today was OK, nothing special to rave over. I've been patiently waiting for Bowood to open and had higher expectations. Hopefully they can turn it around. I'm hoping it was just all the hiccups when opening a new place. I'd be willing to give them another chance.
name: Bowood by Niche

text: Wasn't sure when I first read the menu and saw the picture because they were all normal breakfast items but these were all really good items from start to finish. Hubs got the eggs benny and that Hollandaise was really flavorful and the greens and the dressing were on point. We had the mimosa and nomosa and the espresso martini and they nailed it with the drinks. I had the basic breakfast but it was anything butt. The sausage was clearly homemade and the eggs were a beautiful scrambled. The apple butter and hot sauce and butter were all excellent for the delicious toast. Really a cute place and it takes about 30 minutes for food so prepare yourself. At nine months pregnant I probably should have eaten a snack before but I was supremely full afterwards.
name: Bowood by Niche

attributes.BusinessParking: {u'valet': False, u'garage': None, u'street': True, u'lot': None, u'validated': None}

categories: Restaurants, Food, Sandwiches, Desserts, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
I had to wait an ungodly amount of time to dine here but I would do it all over again because it was so delightful! 

Definitely make a reservation or else you're looking at a loooong wait. Once you are there you can browse the adjoining houseplant shop or wander around the beautiful nearby neighborhoods. We were visiting from out of town and decided to dine here in a whim on a Saturday morning. It was prime time and we got stuck in this cycle of being beat out by reservations - but our quoted hour-ish wait was an hour 45!! We walked around for the first hour and while waiting the final 45 minutes the hostess gave us a cookie out of pity, ha! Nice gesture, it just is what it is. Make a reservation if you can!

Upon dining the wait didn't matter. The brunch was classical and hearty, but also unique. Portions were enough be to satisfied but also wanting to come back for more. 

Drinks included full coffee bar, traditional brunch drinks (fresh squeezed oj mimosas) as well as a variety of brunch themed cocktails. All delicious! 

We had the eggs Benedict which was served on toast with prosciutto and a creamy hollandaise. The egg sandwich was perfectly cooked and balanced. The hash browns gave me upscale McDonald's vibes (which lets be honest has delicious hash browns).  

Service was prompt and once seated everything seemed to flow pretty good for it being prime time.
name: Bowood by Niche

text:
This is a terrific deli/cafe for a quick stop of sandwich, salad, or soup. My half and half order--roast beef sandwich and house salad--was just the right size lunch portion at a good value. 
Fresh wheat bread really elevated the sandwich. And, homemade croutons accented a mixed greens salad with St. Louis style sweet, but not too sweet, Italian dressing. 
Sidewalk dining and limited indoor seating.
name: Valenti's Delicatessen and Market

text: The place was bumping on a Saturday morning and the staff was super friendly. Although the menu isn't extensive, each item is thoughtfully curated using fresh, quality ingredients. Their sauce game was on point. Each sandwich featured something tasty to elevate it to the next level (ie pepper jelly, green goddess dressing, caramelized onion aioli). Fries were super crispy also. Definitely get the house made hot sauce. Don't forget the pastries! We had the honey bun and the poptart and they were both stellar.

text:
Boyfriend and I planned a bike ride around Katy Trails and decided to stop around Main St for lunch. After perusing around the shops, we decided to try this place out. 

I'm aware I'm not in Maine, but ordered the Lobster Reuben which felt a bit risky in the Midwest, especially for the price. To my surprise, the Lobster Reuben was pretty good! The sauerkraut and creamy lobster combination was perfect. Also the lobster meat was pretty reasonable for the price you pay. My boyfriend deemed that I ordered better that day, even though his Italian Beef was delicious as well. Each sandwich came with a side item. We got the Cole slaw and the potato salad since it seems like they make it in-house.

I might have to deduct points of the hidden bacon in the potato salad. I wished the cashier warned about the bacon. I'm not a bacon fan and never will be. However the staff was super-friendly and very timely. Don't underestimate these girls. They get sh*t done. Also, they'll gladly answer any questions you might have. 

Overall, I highly recommend checking this place out. I see myself coming back again to try other things on your menu.
name: Valenti's Delicatessen and Market

text: AMAZING BRUNCH!!! This was such a great experience for brunch. The food is really remarkable. We ordered the pancakes, eggs benedict, and quiche. So glad we ordered the pancakes because they were so fluffy and full of flavor! The quiche had tons of great taste between the butternut squash and the cheese. The bread used for the eggs benedict was perfect for the brown butter hollandaise sauce. The espresso martini was really unique too. They used a liquor china-china in it giving it a really fun unique twist on the traditional espresso martini. Be sure to add Bowood to your brunch schedule.
name: Bowood by Niche

text:
We have been busy trying to find local "new to us" spots to eat this summer. We have had hits and misses.

This place - Valenti's Delicatessen was maybe one of the biggest hits of the summer so far.  The sandwiches are outstanding. Huge portions, you definitely walk away full,  no question. 
I got their Signature House Made Italian Beef on this trip and it was HUGE. It was absolutely delicious, incredibly filling and a true favorite.  Loved the garlic spread on it, as well as the addition of the pepperoncinis.  OMG! 
My friend ordered a Turkey Hoagie and adored it as well. Seriously one of the absolute BEST deli's in the county. We will be back a lot, I know that for sure!
We got a kids Ham Sandwich served on wheat, and our three year old devoured it. Honestly just a fun and great deli for an easy lunch!
name: Valenti's Delicatessen and Market

text:
I picked this spot for birthday brunch with my family, but second guessed myself because the menu didn't actually look very exceptional to me. But I am SO glad we stuck with it because the food was prepared in such an extraordinarily delicious way, there wasn't anything normal about this meal!
I had eggs Benedict which is something I love and order often. Saying this eggs benedict is above average or delicious isn't actually enough. You really just need to try it. I'm not sure if it was the brown butter hollandaise, or that the eggs were poached in something really delicious, or if the bread was homwmade and fresh and proscuitto was great quality, but I loved every single bite. Like reallyyy delicious. My husband had me try his pickle and I don't even like pickles unless theyre amazing and this was like the best pickle. I know you think I'm exaggerating but I am really not. Even my son who is 15 and had bacon, eggs, potatoes and toast said the butter was the best he ever had lol. 
This restaurant stands up to many brunches we've had in New Orleans and just might be the best one we've had in STL.
name: Bowood by Niche

text: Went in for brunch at 10 am on a Thursday. Waiter took forever to greet us. When I had questions he didn't know the answer to, I got an "I can ask the kitchen if you want...." Then never checked on us after our food arrived. Plus, no refill on the coffee. Husband's Eggs Benedict was flavorless, which is pretty remarkable considering the rich ingredients. Waited 10 min for s&p before finally flagging down a busboy. Parfait portion was unacceptable at $12. I imagine it was five tablespoons of food. Left hungry. All style, absolutely no substance.

text: Were planning on walking the Katy trail and stopped here to pick up sandwiches to take with us for lunch.  When the owner heard we were walking the trail, he offered us an ice pack to take with us. It was in the 80's so the ice pack was great. We ordered the Santa Fe turkey and avocado sandwiches, one on rye, one on the recommended wheat. Both were fantastic. They offered a nice cucumber salad side that was a light and healthy delicious option.  We also found 2 Hershey's kisses for a treat.

text:
Lots of stars for my main dish, eggs benedict. The other stuff, not so much. 

To accentuate the positive: perfectly poached, very flavorful egg. Obviously a happy chicken. Excellent bread. Sauce was delicate and rich, not the usually over-the-top cloying hollandaise you get with most eggs benedict these days. Potatoes were also super yum. 

In my wife's case, they brought her someone else's meal, so it wasn't quite what she'd asked for. I still thought it was pretty good. She wasn't so taken by it. Was supposed to be vegetarian too, and yet there was a little tiny mysterious piece chip of bacon there too. 

My latte was terrible! Watery and sad. 

When the check came, it too was someone else's. Funny time. Guess they're still working out the kinks. 

But all in all: friendly atmosphere, excellent food (imho). Will certainly be back.
name: Bowood by Niche

text: I loved it when it was Cafe Osage, and I'd still recommend it to a friend in it's new glory as Bowood by Niche. The extension of the bar gives the interior a beautiful new atmosphere, and the food is still delicious as ever under Koda's watchful eye. Four stars because you'll definitely still shell out some serious cash if you want all the fixins (which, if you're me, includes coffee and a mimosa), but you'll leave full and happy.

text: So happy to see this space back open and still serving garden to table produce! Everything was amazing, but we both agreed this was the most delicious Bloody Mary we've ever had! We tried a little bit of everything: Egg Sandwich, Eggs Benedict, breakfast potatoes, Pumpkin French Toast and the apple Poptart. I'm convinced you can do no wrong with anything you order at Bowood! The only thing as beautiful as our meal was the illuminating courtyard filled with greenery and holiday gifts! Plan your next brunch ahead of time because reservations fill up quick.
name: Bowood by Niche

attributes.BusinessParking: {u'valet': False, u'garage': None, u'street': True, u'lot': None, u'validated': None}

categories: Restaurants, Food, Sandwiches, Desserts, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Alex A took care of us so well here. We had a blast and the food was great. Possibly the best pancakes I've ever had! Crispy on the edges and not soggy with syrup. Very attentive servers and kind! Thank you so much. Highly recommend the burger. My friend was vegetarian but had a bite of the burger and her eyes lit up with delight ! Great fries and thank you for the bday wishes for my friend !
name: Bowood by Niche

attributes.BusinessParking: {u'valet': False, u'garage': None, u'street': True, u'lot': None, u'validated': None}

categories: Restaurants, Food, Sandwiches, Desserts, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I love coming here. It feels like a fancy very special breakfast spot and yet it's affordable and ingredients are just simple but fresh and perfectly done. Their cortado is perfect and cocktails are great too. I can't leave without checking out their awesome shop and lovely garden house
name: Bowood by Niche

text: Atmosphere was beautiful and service was terrific. Ordered the cacio e Pepe eggs. The eggs were very rich and the salad alongside was a necessary compliment. Minus one star as a gluten-free eater. I asked to sub in gluten-free toast and was given a toasted gluten-free burger bun which was disappointing. Several menu items would probably be delicious with a decent gluten-free bread substitution but I probably won't order any of those items knowing what the gluten-free bread option is.
name: Bowood by Niche

text: What a fun discovery! Picasso's was packed full of hipsters so we went next door and found a great family owned place with personal service and great food. The loaded waffle is ridiculously good and you can ask to meet the young man who invented it.
name: Valenti's Delicatessen and Market

text: One of the best new brunch restaurants that has opened up in St. Louis! Came for their opening week and I'm so glad I did. Reservation only so you have to go to their website to set on up. As of now mostly every weekend is booked until close to the end of the month but during the week they might have some spots left. I was suggested to get the espresso martini and I'm not a big coffee fan but it was good, strong coffee but good. Also got the chili fried tofu with fries and this was amazing. The green goddess dressing parred well with the nice and crispy tofu. For dessert I wanted the pop tart but they ran out of those for the day(will be back for it) so I got the apple coffee cake and this was pretty good as well. I was suggested to get the Chili Fried Tofu or the Eggs Benedict since these are the two best dishes so next time I'll get the Benedict to try!
name: Bowood by Niche

text: Ever since I knew niche food group now owns the original CafÃ© Osage and turned it into bowood by niche, I have been eagerly waiting for it to open. The space is so uplifting and bright and relaxing with a lot of natural light and sleek design. The food not only tastes good but also feels very healthy! I especially love their semolina toast and arugula salads that comes with both our plates. The toast is the perfect kind of bread, soft texture with crunchy crust filled with sesame, so delicious! As a arugula lover, I really can't resist when I see the dishes come with arugula salad! To be honest though, the food are slightly on the expensive side and the wait for the food was a little long. I suppose it's because they just open for not too long. But overall, I really enjoyed the experience! Be sure to make reservation to secure your table!
name: Bowood by Niche

attributes.BusinessParking: {u'valet': False, u'garage': None, u'street': True, u'lot': None, u'validated': None}

categories: Restaurants, Food, Sandwiches, Desserts, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Excellent breakfast choice( I haven't had lunch there) Had to wait on a Saturday ( so far per the manager ) their busiest day.Had a coffee while waiting. The front desk person ( Savannah)was diligent on letting us know when our table would be ready. Staff handled the patron traffic well. Our server was excellent. Had Blueberry pancakes , which I enjoyed My son had the egg sandwich , which he loved Overall a superior experience I want to try lunch soon  I like that they are open Thursday thru Monday ( Mondays are difficult to find restaurants open) This is a winner food wise and Bowood associate wise imho
name: Bowood by Niche

text:
This is our 2nd and definitely not our last visit. I got the Gyro with a side of Asian Slaw. I'm still full 4 hours later! They also have a lot of other side options and I'm definitely going with Horseradish pickles. Food took MAYBE 5 minutes , they have a lobster Reuben that's calling me to come back tomorrow. 

My son got the Hotdog with only relish . He ate it in 60 seconds, so I'll take that as a win.
name: Valenti's Delicatessen and Market

text: First off, I want to say I'm a huge fan of Gerald Craft and all of his restaurants. However, my experience today at Bowood by Niche was underwhelming and disappointing to say the least. The food was room temperature across the board. The Bloody Mary was basically just tomato juice. There was absolutely nothing close to the level expected from Craft's restaurants. The "service" was also disappointing. We were seated 15min after our reservation and didn't get drinks for another 30min. I could of excused all of that had a server or hostess made eye contact and apologized for the delay. It felt like serving our table of 2 was a burden. I am sad to say that I won't be returning to this restaurant because I love this location. I will, however, return to all the other Craft associated restaurants.
name: Bowood by Niche

text: I wasn't too sure when we walked into the place because you go up to the counter to order but let me just say that they have excellent food! My husband I split the Lobster Reuben and it was one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. Heaping amounts of lobster for only $9.99! We each had a cup of soup which was excellent, as well. Our whole family enjoyed the food thoroughly. Will definitely be back!
name: Valenti's Delicatessen and Market

text: Wonderful brunch yesterday at Bowood by Niche! Had been missing Sardella's cacio e pepe eggs and Bowood's were just delicious. Couldn't resist adding fries and bacon. And the cocktails were perfect. The place is just beautiful, the service exquisite. It makes for a delightful experience!

text: I'm not even a big sandwich person but I'm glad I gave this place a try. I've ordered the Italian beef sandwich twice and it's absolutely delicious. The potato salad is almost like a loaded baked potato-it has bacon and scallions and I think some sour cream. It's delicious. The sandwich is juicy, melty and the pepperoncinis add a slight sour spicy kick. I love that they leave Hershey's kisses in the bags too. Only issue I had was that I tried calling ahead and the line was busy several times and the mailbox was full. I arrived about 10 minutes later and there were no customers at all. I originally assumed they were so inundated with customers that they couldn't answer the phone. Odd.
name: Valenti's Delicatessen and Market

text: So happy to have a cafe back at one of my favorite buildings in the city! We made reservations for Monday morning (also SO thankful to have a solid choice for breakfast on Mondays!) and we enjoyed everything we ordered. Pancakes with blueberries, eggs Benedict, and delicious apple coffee cake were ordered! Ate the coffee cake too fast to get a photo, oops. Definitely try it out!!
name: Bowood by Niche

text: St. Charles County doesn't have many local delis. I'm glad I have discovered this one. They have two locations. Main Street in St. Charles and one on Mexico Rd. in St. Peters. I've been to both and this one on Main St. is more of a cafe or bistro style deli. The St. Peters location is more of a meat market and catering storefront, although it does have a few tables off to the side for customers to eat there. This Main Street location is clean, casual and cozy, has fast service, a friendly staff, and great deli food. The sandwiches are SO much better than what you can get at places like Panera.
name: Valenti's Delicatessen and Market

text: Oh my goodness. Who doesn't need a lobster rueben sandwich for lunch? Went unwillingly to St Charles city hall recently to pay my first time personal property tax and was told I'd be summoned by text in 75minutes. I headed a few blocks away to Valenti's on Main Street for a quick lunch. To my surprise they had something Id never heard of; a lobster rueben sandwich. I love lobster so I gave it a shot. I also ordered the sauce on the side because if Im paying for lobster, I want to taste lobster, not the sauce. It was amazing. The sauce was not overwhelming like I thought it would be. I was able to dip it without any loss of flavor. The french onion soup was ok. A little disappointed there was no crouton, just cheese and onion inside my cup. The flow of customers was steady, but the space by the window was quite comfy. Almost missed my tax appointment.
name: Valenti's Delicatessen and Market

text:
This was a nice little grocery store. I stopped here on the way home to see if I could find some of the local favorites that I'd fallen in love with. They don't have the biggest selection but they have a lot of great items. The best part is the alcohol selection. They certainly have quite the variety of libations. 

Overall the store was clean, organized and well stocked. I would absolutely frequent this store again!
name: Schnucks Lindenwood
