text: The service good but here is what I don't like, this is a franchise place meaning there are Starbucks all over the country. I should be able to go to one Starbucks in Phoenix and it taste the same in Missouri but that wasn't the case. The store was dirty and the restroom was dirty. I get it when it gets busy that it can cause a mess but when you walk in and people are just hanging around and the store is dirty that's a problem. The macchiato was not good and pretty much tasted like milk. For a 5 dollar coffee I expect for it to taste better. Was not happy with this Starbucks
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text: I want to give a shout-out to this location and the great people working today. I recently found out I am lactose intolerant and I am still learning to ask for milk alternatives. I forgot to ask for my drink with a milk alternative and they were super nice about it and helped me get one without milk. Extra points here!
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text:
Sidenote: The best cup of coffee I've had in CWE is at Pi Pizza. 

I think Starbucks excels at consistency of product. This location is no different in that the coffee is the same taste as any place else. That said, this is a great location to grab a quick cup and go. ...however, parking is tricky near Maryland and Euclid so this is easier said than done. 

I rate this as 2 out of 5 stars comparing it to other Starbucks shops in the area. It is small and cramped and has one unisex bathroom which creates waiting for the bathroom an expectation. On a positive note, the bathroom has always been clean. Maybe the guy in front of you feels obligated not to be a sloppy mess knowing a cute girl might be waiting for her turn. 

The business itself does really well given the traffic in CWE and their Apple -esque ability to make people feel special while holding the logo on their cup (myself included as I type away at my Macbook writing this review...). 

A coffee shop as a whole and I might give it 3 or 4 stars. The staff is great (as great as all Starbucks staff) and you know what you are getting when you walk in the door. But when it comes down to going to a Starbucks, I'd rather go to one elsewhere.
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text:
This is not a "come hunker down and study for hours" type of location. It's very tiny and seating is limited. In fact, it's not even a good location if you want to hang with friends and catch up. This is really more of a "thank god there's a Starbucks in the neighborhood" location. However, I am thankful as it's quite convenient to my STL life. 

Staff is incredibly friendly. More so than most locations - I have great conversations here. My orders are always perfect. And I love their tip jar, it's a poll of sorts, and always fun. Parking in the CWE is a pain, but there is street parking available, you might need to circle a bit.
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text:
i was staying a local hotel and came here for a breakfast during one of days in stl. 

i got a hot turkey sandwich which was ok and a chai which was ok as well

i am dinging this place on cleanliness and on their counterservice both of which could use some help. the set up for the sandwiches was also a bit confusing and not like the other starbucks ive ever been to

parking is hard to come by in this part of town and i would imagine those that come here usually find it somewhere. i happened to walk to get here so it was a non issue for me

overall, it was not the best SB ive been to but it was ok
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text: As far as any Starbucks location goes - this is probably my favorite. The staff here are incredibly friendly and boy, are they fast! The store is usually fairly busy and parking isn't usually available unless you get there early in the day, which is fine if you work 9-5. The space is somewhat cramped, but better than it was prior to their renovation. Again - it's a Starbucks, but it has the best staff of any others I've visited in the past and better than others I visit out of convenience.
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text:
Nice folks- small place- parking street.
Clean restrooms and in very nice area- across from The Chess Club
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text:
This is an above average Starbucks mostly for its location and its indoor and outdoor seating area. Parking can be tricky around here especially at night and weekends. This is a popular area.

This coffee shop can get crowded but I have never had to wait very long in a line here nor have I waited long for my drinks. 

Enjoying Starbucks outside at this location usually provides some great people watching.
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text:
Definitely one of my favorite Starbucks places because it is quite nicer than the others.  It's close by to a lot of other food places like  FroYo, Coffee Cartel, and others.

The staff/service is great, really friendly.  The bathrooms are always clean.  The place is busy at times so it is hard to find seating.  There is outside seating as well but I'm not about to sweat while drinking my drink outside.  But overall, no complaints!

Thank you, Starbucks!
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text:
Went there this morning to meet a client - great location in heart of Central West End. Very attentive, quick service. yes its very cramped, but real estate is tight in that area.

#1 Reason I love them today is that I left my briefcase after my meeting. Major problem. I had to Doctor clients files in there with all of their financial information. Almost had a fucking heart attack. Raced back there after and they had it in a locked room waiting for me!!!!!!!!!!! End of business cannot come quicker today! Thank you Starbucks staff for saving me butt.
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text:
It's a Starbuck's... nothing good or bad to say.....

It had the usual overpriced and high caloric  drinks... however good they maybe.

Not much to say here.  It's a typical college type place.  Everyone there was young and on their phone .
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text: It's a Starbucks so you pretty much know what you are getting regardless of the particular location.  This location itself is pretty nice if you ask me.  Plenty of room inside and outside for those of you who like to sit and enjoy your beverages.  Reliable Wi-fi like most Starbucks and overall a groovy kind of atmosphere.
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text: Great drinks and coffees made to order. Breakfast sandwiches are good too and they are made fresh everyday. Salads and lunch sandwiches are also available anytime during the day. Recommend the lemonade with raspberry it's really good.
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text: Starbucks is a chain sure but the coffee always tastes good. The barista spells my name right on my cup every time I come in.
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text: I love coming to study here. The drawback is that a lot of the time it is packed with Wash U students so it's hard to find a spot to sit. The greenhouse is super quaint and I love sitting in there on a winter day right next to the heater. Drinks are good, bathrooms are clean. Parking is rough in this area but you just have to put your walking shoes on. Fun people watching place
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text:
Love this place. It's clean, bright, and newly renovated. Baristas are friendly and experienced. If you don't know about SB rewards already, you should get it because free unlimited refills of coffee, iced coffee, hot tea, iced tea, or shaken iced tea lemonades with any drink purchase (can be anything, even a frapp). I literally tried every single tea flavor for free...oops.

My favorite drinks are their green tea frapp, peach green tea lemonade, and the loose leaf green tea (I'm kinda crazy for green tea)!
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text:
This place is super cute as it has a greenhouse like part of the building that sticks out. They do all of the promotions and the baristas know what they are doing since I am the queen of complicated orders. Bonus, they spell my name right.

They do all the classic drinks correctly so I don't think it would be beneficial to review drinks like Pike place or the refreshers. Instead I will write about my personal favorites and my personal secrete drinks that I order, if you want to be extra like me.

Matcha Green Tea latte- Almond Milk, low ice, 3 pumps of sugar free vanilla, and an extra scoop of matcha- 80 calories for a grande!

Grande Ice blonde coffee in a venti cup- fill it to the brim with your own choice of dairy.

Americano with a splash of almond milk and 3 pumps of sugar free hazelnut.

Green tea infused with Mango

Petite Scones- SO GOOD are 3 for $3!
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text:
Nice location, newly remodeled with a pretty chic feel.  Leather sofa, window seats and outdoor patio with umbrellas to shelter you from sun and rain.

surrounded by other awesome spots like  the Chest Club, FroYo, Gamblin Whiskey, Lester's and Brennan's cigar bar.

No drive thru but it really doesn't need one with all its glory.
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text:
This place is tiny inside and by tiny I mean claustrophobia-inducing. But the saving grace is the lovely sidewalk seating. And, of course, there's free wi-fi.

I enjoyed an iced latte here Sunday morning while reading the news on my phone and it was a nice setting. The egg white, turkey bacon and white cheddar breakfast sandwich was better than I expected it to be - it was just enough to fill me up without making me feel too full.
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text:
It's Starbucks, but anything in CWE has to carry its own swagger, and this little spot, despite being near Coffee Cartel, manages to squeeze together plenty of seating in a small spot and has some great service.

It's also conveniently across from the Chess Club and right next to the Chess Hall of Fame.
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text: Great place to grab a cup of corporate coffee and read a book or work.  The seating is pretty good for the area, the interior is always clean, and the outside is great for people watching.  I prefer going in on the evenings when it's not too crowded, though the lines can pick up on weekend afternoons. The only annoyance I've had with this location is the WiFi's glitchiness.  It's bothersome when going to the shop soley to work over the internet and finding it not working for no reason.  Again, that's minor.  The staff have always been friendly to me and they get my drinks fairly fast.  It's Starbucks, so there's no surprises with their fares and no use discussing them.
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text: It's tight quarters, but it's a good Starbucks with fast service and a great location. There are always students studying here. Something about the design makes it feel more "urban." It's unique!
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text: I completely forgot to ask for my drink with coconut milk instead of dairy, and they gave me a new, bigger drink for free when I went and told them. Very kind! The tables are sticky when it's busy but you'd get that anywhere.
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text: Cute, clean Starb in the CWE. Love the outdoor patio seating - great for people watching and catching up on Vogue. Only downside seems to be the limited indoor seating, which may prove to be a problem as the weather cools down. Even my pumpkin spice latte won't keep me warm enough!
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text:
It's a nice friendly Starbucks. 
The drinks were made in a timely manner and the people were kind. I don't really order anything fancy or customized so I can't speak to that regards. However, the mango dragon fruit I got was delicious as always. 

The interior has pretty good seating capacity and it offers some outdoor seating as well. The place wasn't that noisy but did provide some noise for a good background noise.
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text: This is by far my favorite location. So close to home and the staff make it an effort to recognize and get to know you so on your next visit they know what you are getting. I love how clean, vibrant and relaxing the store is.
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text:
When Coffee Cartel smells overwhelmingly like bleach and cleaning supplies you go to Starbucks down the street. Sorry, CC...not this time. 

This Starbucks is noticeably nicer than most. Probably because it's in the CWE but it was also noticeably cleaner. They have a small outdoor patio which is a great area to sit in if you have the time. 

Overall, Starbucks coffee to me is pretty "meh." There are many other local joints whose coffee I prefer but sometimes convenience is king...or not smelling bad in this case. Upon my visit I learned that Starbucks does sandwiches now that you can warm up. Yes, I'm behind but I seriously rarely go to visit this chain. They weren't bad for being pre-made! Anyways, I won't be back anytime soon but this location is A-OK in my books.
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text:
I think this is the last time I'm coming to this location. Every day this week I ordered a Blonde Vanilla Latte and every time I receive a plain latte. Today I decided to call in and ask for a refund. The woman who answered the phone said to come back and they'll fix it. Unfortunately I'm well on my way to the office. So I ask how about tomorrow? She said that fine but when I asked who I should ask for she seemed bothered by the question and said "I don't know who is going to be here tomorrow" and then started to talk to another customer and hung up on me. 

Sorry I'm not going to participate in the lack of customer response. I've been going to that Starbucks every day , I mean every day, for the past 2 years. Every morning and I never complain but I can't take paying 6 dollars everyday for something I didn't order and didn't want on a consistent basis. I'll try the Clayton location for now on. 

Keisha
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text:
Let it be known that I'm a Starbucks super fan.  We stopped in with our out of town relatives to see if they still had STL Christmas mug ornaments in stock (my SIL collects them).  We weren't even planning on grabbing a fancy shmancy hand crafted beverage.

We'd only been looking at the ornament selection for a moment or two when an employee informed us they were closing in 3 minutes and not in a friendly kind of way.  We quickly made our choice and headed toward the register.  We stood there for a few moments without being acknowledged and, obviously, not welcomed so we left without buying anything.

One star because the shop is nice and one star because it's Starbucks, but your employees could up their customer service game even if it is close to closing time.
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text: We stopped in on the way to the market and were pleasantly surprised.  The owner was very friendly and the baked goods were delicious.  I also highly recommend the smoked salsa.  We will definitely be back!
name: Mauki's Bakery & Country Store

text: Homemade. Homemade... and delicious.  Came in for breakfast on a Sunday randomly and will be coming back for sure.

text:
After seeing a few reviews and pics, I moved this to the top of the brunch list.  The biscuits and gravy I've been dreaming about the last week were perfection. The huge biscuit is smothered in sausage gravy. The bacon was also super flavorful and the massive waffles were perfectly fluffy with a crispy edge. Portions are large and I believe it's all made from scratch, which makes such a difference. 

Looking forward to checking out their bakery (12 lb cinnamon rolls and chunky chocolate chip cookies looked great) and their lunch offerings. Support local!
name: Mauki's Bakery & Country Store

text: Supposed to be open until 8pm. Came by at 7:18 and door was locked. Guy sitting outside noticed our frustration and said that this store randomly decides to close early quite frequently.

text: I get that this is Starbucks... you'll either love them or hate them probably .  What I like about this location is the cool ambiance. text: Bring your appetite! Amazing homemade breakfast in the heart of Soulard. Come over before or after your visit to Soulard Farmer's Market.

text:
I love the location and its outdoor seating area of this Starbucks. Turn your outdoor chair around so that it faces the sidewalk and pretend you're at a Parisian cafe watching the world go by.  On a cold or rainy day, they have a very nice indoor area to sit in. 

They have breakfast sandwiches, salads, snacks of many types. My husband always buys his whole bean coffee here. We love to come down with our dog to get a coffee, frappicino (sp) and a snack to people watch. They also have tea for the tea drinkers.  Bottled water, orange juice and other beverages are available for purchase. 

Would I come back here. You know I will. I'll see you in the funny pages.
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text: Delicious breakfast and lunch.  Order the pulled pork, you won't be disappointed! The fluffiest pancakes I've eaten in a while, but somehow not doughy. Literally like an inch thick each, airy, hot.  They also have a great selection of bakery items, dessert breads, cinnamon rolls and cannolis. Everything was delicious and ready for pickup when I arrived. Patrons doing a great job of social distancing and staff were wearing masks too. It was alot less crowded than Protagonist so a great way to get a flavorful breakfast and avoid crowds.
name: Mauki's Bakery & Country Store

text: We LOVED our time at Mauki's! This was such a delicious, wholesome breakfast and hospitable dining experience. The kind of breakfast where you feel like you're home, enjoying family favorites with the passed down recipes you'll never stop looking forward to and made by people that put love into the food they make! This is a great sit-down spot for small parties, like meeting with a few friends or taking the grandparents out for breakfast. It's comfort food that sits softer in your stomach but tastes delicious. The staff was so kind, attentive and quick to offer an added service without our request (more coffee on your way out?, warmed cinnamon roll?, extra plate?), which was super appreciated. This shop is blessing Soulard and the St. Louis community! We are excited to bring more people to Mauki's, and even referred some passerbys on our way out to our car. Definitely recommend - comments for each food we had in the photos!
name: Mauki's Bakery & Country Store

attributes.BusinessParking: {u'valet': False, u'garage': None, u'street': True, u'lot': False, u'validated': None}

categories: Food, Bakeries, Donuts, Breakfast & Brunch, Comfort Food, Restaurants

text:
When you step in this place it reminds me of my old hometown. One of my great aunt's 2 story house where she always had tea and homemade bread for you even if she didn't know you were coming.  Country music playing, tin ceiling, home baked items in a display case and a friendly greeting as you walked in the door. 
We found this place by accident. We had gone to Soulard Market to get some plants and was just checking out the buildings around it and decided to stop in for breakfast. We were too early but one of the owners was loading up his truck with treats to sell at the market and said they would be opening in about 30 minutes. So we went for a walk. We got back just as they opened at 8am. So glad we waited. 
This place was clean and so inviting. I ordered the Country Classic which is 2 eggs (I had mine scrambled and the only bad thing I can say about them is that there weren't enough...I don't know what they put in them but I assure you those were no ordinary scrambled eggs), sausage (homemade... and not with a strange sage flavor that leaves you tasting the sausage later on in the day), fried potatoes (there were a TON of these but I personally thought they were a little overcooked), then there was the biscuit (a REAL biscuit... not one of those round flaky things,  this solid biscuit was the size of a medium loaf of bread and so tasty). My friend got the same as me but she got grits. (She KNOWS grits and was thrilled with these. I am new to the "grit scene" and plain grits just don't do it for me but these? I could have eaten a bushel of these. 
One of the owners said they used to have a farm in Maryland Heights but sold it yesterday (I believe). His wife was doing the cooking and he came around asking how everything was. 
It's was such a fun environment that one couple that came in started talking to another couple and then I happily chimed in. I believe that when you are having good food in a relaxing environment it makes you feel like you are having breakfast (or whatever) with your family. Good times!! 
I'll definitely be going back soon.
name: Mauki's Bakery & Country Store

attributes.BusinessParking: {u'valet': False, u'garage': None, u'street': True, u'lot': False, u'validated': None}

categories: Food, Bakeries, Donuts, Breakfast & Brunch, Comfort Food, Restaurants

text:
It was a busy day at Soulard Market so we had to park a few blocks away. We passed a new business ( found out later they opened last October)  in a space previously occupied by a bar who's name I can't remember. Mauki's Bakery & Country Store. We decided to stop on the way back to the car when we were finished at the market. We passed Mauki's stall in the market and saw a wide selection of dessert breads that interested us. We headed to the store and were discussing getting breakfast or lunch somewhere as we entered. We were greeted immediately and asked if we were eating. The name doesn't include restaurant and I missed the small Sign outside advertising food. 
After looking at the pies, cookies, breads etc we looked at the menu and decided to dine here. Best decision I've made in a while. We sat down and the cheerful woman who greeted us introduced herself as Chrystal  and handed us menus. Breakfast and lunch choices both looked good. We started with Iced tea and an excellent iced coffee. Then ordered a half order of Biscuits N Gravy. (Warning! The half order is massive! ) and a Hearty Cluck sandwich 
The food arrived in a reasonable amount of time, was visually appealing and tasted great. The biscuits are square cut sheet pan biscuits. The gravy has a generous amount of sausage and is well seasoned. The chicken fried steak is coated in crisp batter and super tender. Great southern cooking. 
This place is a hidden gem. Wonderful food and hospitality.  One of the best breakfast restaurants in the St Louis area.
name: Mauki's Bakery & Country Store

text: I have been stopping by this Starbucks location on the weekends lately as I visit Pharaoh's Donuts across the street. The location doesn't have a drive thru but it's pretty easy for me to past and be able to walk to both businesses quickly on a Sunday morning. Order ahead is fast and easy here. text:
Huge shoutout to the Starbucks in the CWE!! I consistently get amazing service from the barista team when I visit. Every single time, without fail, I am greeted with a friendly smile that always cheers me up. The staff at this location are absolutely outstanding, and I have never once had negative experience.
Mobile ordering is super fast - I highly recommend that you order on the app so you don't have to wait in line. This Starbucks tends to be fairly busy so if you plan on popping in and out, order on the way. 
Something I love about the interior is that pretty much every seating option is situated by an outlet. One of my biggest pet peeves is when coffee shops don't place tables and chairs conscientiously. If you're coming here to work and need an outlet, this is the ideal spot to be!
A unique feature is the "greenhouse" portion of the store, which provides additional workspace with lots of natural light. Definitely my happy spot!
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text:
Behind the location at the Cheshire Inn on western side of Forest Park, this is probably the most unique Starbucks in St. Louis. Service is quick, the staff are personable (even when slammed under the morning rush) and the atmosphere is a little less corporate in feel. There's little mistaking that you're in a Starbucks when you step in the door, but it's also distinctly the Central West End Starbucks.

Skim the reviews (or Google Maps) and you'll find just about all that you need to know for a great visit to this walkable store.

There's no dedicated parking lot or pickup spot, but there a few sturdier places to lock up a bike on the block. (Drivers do have options though. There's a public garage above the Schlafly Library on Euclid and metered parking along the street. Free street parking is often available to the east of the shop on Maryland Ave and there's a paid parking lot across the street too).

There's no drive-thru, but mobile orders are usually accepted. The location isn't that large, but does have a good mix of semi-communal seating, small tables, sidewalk seating and a couple of more comfortable chairs.

If there's really any complaint with the store, it's the minor irritation of its tendency to sell out of products, whether it's Blonde Roast, breakfast sandwiches or Nitro Cold Brew (each of which have been unavailable at least once during my random stops in over the past year). I've never had that affect an app order but, if you have your mind set on a particular item, it's probably best to order ahead.
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

text:
I love this home town cooking breakfast spot!

Everyone that works here is so nice and they love their homemade hot sauce. 

All of us went for the sweet side of breakfast and we weren't disappointed. The waffles were perfect, the pancakes were insane and the French toast was amazing!

Next time, we're going for savory and we're using some of their home made hot sauce. 
The apple jalapeÃ±o was oddly delicious!

text:
With some of the lackluster service at the surrounding restaurants and cafes, I have to give Starbucks props for cranking out the drinks in a timely, efficient, and customer oriented manner. Something that can't be said (at least not all three) of the surrounding restaurants I tried while in St. Louis.

This Starbucks is fairly large for being centrally located in the Central West End, It also has seating in a sun room that is probably only open during the warmer months. Perfect for enjoying the outdoor music and other festivities that always seem to be happening in the neighborhood.

4 stars for service.

text: The owner and staff at this place were so nice! Despite being busy the owner took time to talk to folks. I suggest that when you walk in immediately go to the the display of bakery items - in the case and on the counter. Pick what you want before someone else does!! Ha. I scooped up peach cobbler bread and so happy that I did. It's delicious. I was there with a group of 6-7 friends for breakfast. One guy ordered the biscuits and gravy. OMG talk about huge! It easily could have fed 4 people. I had a little taste and it was great. Their breakfast burritos were also quite large. I myself ordered the french toast with a side of sausage. My french toast was a little too dry for me but my friend who also got it said she loved it. The sausage was excellent! This place is not super crowded convenient for us but we will return!

text:
Full disclosure, I did NOT visit the actual Mauki's Bakery & Country Store... BUT I did visit their stall at the Soulard Farmers Market in Saint Louis! The man working there was extremely helpful, friendly & talkative,  and a real salesman! He talked up Mauki's to all who approached and encouraged each person to visit Mauki's in person to eat there. I left with a menu in hand and the selections looked wonderful on paper.

My time and schedule unfortunately didn't allow for a visit, but I was able to bring home some fresh bread from their Farmer's Market stall - and I was very impressed with the  flavor, freshness, and texture. A few stalls down the way, a worker saw me carrying my tin of Mauki's bread and he shouted out (with a real genuine sense of pride "hey you've got some of my bread there, I baked that!" That's the sort of worker spirit that makes you conclude that there's something truly special going on, & that it's worth checking out.

So the bread I selected was Cranberry Orange. There are many other flavors available. Moist & flavorful, & travelled quite well back to Ohio. Reasonably priced. I'm looking forward to returning to Saint Louis at some point in the future, & hope an in person visit to Mauki's will be possible. Great bread!
name: Mauki's Bakery & Country Store

The fries are perfect! I got the cheese fries...I'm not a huge fan of just placing a slice of american cheese on top of my fries and calling them "cheese fries",but for a 10 cent upcharge, I guess I should have expected that. Next time I'll order then sans the kraft cheeses slice.

text:
Love Cane's. They're the In-N-Out of the Deep South and St. Louis is fortunate to have several outlets.

For me the sign of a quality fast-casual food is just how quickly it works through my body. I can wreck a Caniac Combo (six fingers) with two sauces and two Texas Toasts and a Sweet Tea in a few minutes. Without fail, driving home the stomach starts to gurgle - it's either clench or be clenched all the way home. Once I had to pull over to a Mickey D's to use their rest room, while the men's stalls were all full I had to duck into the lady's room or face the consequences of some seriously delicious and addictive chicken.

Viva la Cane's!
name: Raising Cane's Chicken Fingers

text: This place is quickly becoming one of my favorite places to go.  The chicken fingers have this phenomenal breading that is light but also very crispy.  The meat is cooked to perfection and very juicy.  I of course dip them in the Canes sauce which is one of my favorite dipping sauces of all time. The side of crinkle fries that comes with the basket just compliments the meal.  I dip those in the Cane sauce also!  The drink choice to  wash it all down is their fresh brewed sweet tea which I consider right up there with the very best I've had.  The best part about this chicken place is a consistent product.  The food baskets are always piping hot and the food is excellent.  I would highly recommend Raising Canes to everyone!
name: Raising Cane's Chicken Fingers

text:
Well...I was craving a handmade all beef 'one of those your momma used to make hamburgers' today and as I paged through yelp I thought I would give this place a try. Being right down from where I was located I thought it was a better alternative to a sonic or jack n the box (both not good). 

As I pulled up to the first window a rather friendly lady greeted me. Because there are no pictures or any frame of reference for how big or small the burgers are I ordered a double bacon cheeseburger. When I tried to order a milkshake she chuckled and showed me the list of vess soda's available. The driveway is a little tricky because when you go to pull around its like the turning radius is not enough, but I made it...

So My burger and fries shortly came out ($8.90) in a brown paper bag with the grease stains...yum... I made my way down to the seven eleven got a big gulp and was on my way back. 

While in the car who can resist a few fries so I had a couple...they were so hot and those big kinda steak fries so super good. Could have used a pinch more of salt I thought at the time. 

Ok so when I got to where I was going I opened my brown paper bag...WOW the burger was half the size of my big gulp!!! I mean it was huge...I wish I had taken a picture... But it was made in a Big Mac style bun in between and the patties were just so darn thick. I had to cut it in half and could barely finish my half. I got everything on it so it was extra juicy.

This place is about as good as it gets for burgers in North County. Yes its a little awkward and I'm not sure about the prices but if you are looking for a huge burger that is super fresh then you should def try them out.
name: The White Barn

text: As a lover of Chik-Fil-A it was hard for me to venture out and try another fast food chicken place. However I have a found a new love in Raising Canes! Their service is fast and their employees are friendly. The menu options are limited but what more could you want than good chicken and fries? The chicken is tender with a crispy breading, the fries are never soggy, and it comes with a buttery Texas toast to finish off the meal. But let's talk about the Cane's sauce....I can't get away with not ordering extra which they will charge you for and I will happily pay. The tangy delicious sauce I use with both the chicken and the fries. The caniac meal with six chicken fingers, fries, and a 32oz drink is my husband and my go to meal to share when we're on the go.
name: Raising Cane's Chicken Fingers

text:
Don't Forget To Kiss The Cook :

I don't usually write reviews about fast food restaurants BUT when one of the employees go above and beyond ...it's time to let the boss know you have a Fantastic Employee...
Her name is Amanda ...After finishing our meal we moved the empty baskets with our trash at the edge of the table , one of the girls working there walked by three times and never once asked ... Could I take this away for you? 
Amanda would walk around the restaurant and pick up trash clean tables and talk to customers... She is a very friendly girl ...and treats her job as if she owns the restaurant...
We are not going to mention the girls name who walked by and left the trash we just want her boss to know she is a FANTASTIC EMPLOYEE...

We both agreed the fried chicken is very good and yes we will be back...
THANK YOU Amanda for talking and joking around with us.
You made lunch today a real enjoyment ....

P.S. 
To Amanda's boss ..... She deserves a raise....
( LOL i told her i would say that )

text:
Restaurant and bar inside of the luxurious Last Hotel. The wait staff were extremely nice and friendly and attentive. My friend got scallops and their apple cobbler; I got a margherita pizza and their candy bar dessert. 
The food took a longer time than anticipated to come out and they weren't super-busy. When the scallops came out I was a tad bit disappointed at their presentation because they were...well, burnt. Scallops have a natural buttery taste, even if you don't really use butter while cooking them. These had maybe the slightest hint of butter and the tops were just torched. It's really difficult to not make scallops tasty. My pizza was really good but also pretty dang spicy. A little goes a long way when using red pepper flakes. My nose started to run while eating this, haha. If that's what they're going for, then fantastic but I don't know if they were. 

The desserts, however, were on-point. Both were very flavorful and worth savoring every bite. The presentation of the candy bar was a little weird. There was the dessert and then a swoop of chocolate that did not look, from appearances, look appetizing or attractive. Fortunately the taste overshadowed the plating.

Perhaps the kitchen was just off that night when it came to getting things out in a timely manner. But I've heard the same comments from other folks I know who ate there and they said the same thing. It was an alright experience and I'd like to give it a second shot the next time I am in the hotel.
name: Ultima Cucina

text:
Had heard about The White Barn through an RFT article and had been wanting to check it out. At first glance it's in a bad neighborhood but the food is well worth the scare haha.....

This burger is enormous! The single is a half pound of ground beef is a so hot and juicy it will blow your mind! 

I got mine with everything on it and it was absolutely delicious! The garlic mayo really adds some big flavor to this burger! I don't know if I could have finished a double today (full pound of beef) but I will be trying it next time I come out here! 

I would definitely recommend cruising by this place if you are ever out here! Great home style burger and hot as hell steak fries! 

Note: they do not serve lettuce and tomato with their burgers.

text:
Drove over for the White Barn burger experience -- and what an experience it was.  It reminded me of the ol' Dairy Barn experience -- you stay in your car while ordering your food while the staff cook it and bring it out to you.

At WB, you order on one side of the building and pick it up on the other side of the building.  I was glad to hear they source their meat and fixings locally!  Anyway, it was worth the wait.  A truly hand-formed patty that was juicy, huge, and very tasty.  It was a little messy, since I had ketchup, mustard, mayo -- the works on this thing.  I got a single, and I'm glad I did.  The double looked like it was a pound of meat!

Easily one of the best burgers I've had in St. Louis...and I'll be back!  Just goes to show you how amazing out-of-the-way places can truly be!
name: The White Barn

text:
I'm always impressed by the management and staff at the Maplewood Raising Cane's. This is my husband's most frequently-visited Cane's location, and each time we (or he) goes they are always friendly, and the food is hot and fresh. 

If there ever is a forgotten item, it's easy to call up and let them know. They are always happy to fix it, and often will comp you your next meal. Such wonderful customer service!

If you order their Naked Tenders, you'll be asked to wait in a parking spot since they are made fresh. It's never too long of a wait, and quite a few times the staff has thrown in an extra tender or two for the wait. Thoughtful and always appreciated! 

Thanks so much, Maplewood Raising Cane's staff, for your excellent service! You all are great and appreciated!
name: Raising Cane's Chicken Fingers

text:
After a rather disappointing meal at another restaurant the previous evening, we decided to check out the restaurant right in our hotel - boy, I'm glad we did. Beautifully decorated with great natural light and clever details (like the coasters made of shoe heels - a nod to the former factory). 

The food was excellent - we started with buffalo chicken bites, and had honey mustard chicken sandwich and a burger for our entrees. The service was also top notch - attentive without being annoying. 

Next time I'm in St Louis, I'd come back in a heartbeat.
name: Ultima Cucina

Such an impressive place to sit down and enjoy a meal!
Our waiter was also the bartender, but so attentive the entire time we were there. He served my fiancÃ© his drink on the house because it was the local brew only made for the hotel and he chose it! He also brought us out their house made chips for us to "try" and didn't charge us for them either! The food was great, I got the shrimp Po'boy and fries and my fiancÃ© got the Turkey Panini and fries. The fries were great and my sandwich was delectable! It's a large portion so you will definitely not be hungry afterwards!

text: I stopped in here for a small lunch on a Sunday afternoon. We were promptly seated and treated very respectfully. The menu is small but full of all the New American cuisine you could desire. We ordered a steak sandwich and the burrata bruschetta. The meal came out quick, but we received a burger instead of the steak sandwich. I'm happy to say that the burger was perfectly cooked. It's loaded with fresh tomatoes, red onion, lettuce, and pickles and to top it off there was homemade pickled relish! The burrata was served with a light balsamic reduction and cooked pears. Our server brought us out the steak sandwich, after realizing the order was mixed up. It was fantastic! It came medium rare with delicious melted cheese. Both the burger and the sandwich came with a very generous helping of french fries. All in all, the Last Restaurant has a friendly menu and is a great place for a quick bite!
name: Ultima Cucina

text:
American restaurant located inside of the Last Hotel. 

The hotel and the restaurant are both very stylish, as both are decked out with lots of vintage decor. The restaurant is towards the back of the lobby area. 

The building opened in 1909 as a shoe factory, and there are lots of references to its history through the space. Examples include coasters made from the heels of shoes and vintage shoe-shine chairs. The building's name is a reference in itself, as "The Last" is a tool used to make shoes. Additionally, the lobby has a pool table that is from 1909!

The hotel also has a rooftop bar and wading pool that are both open to the public.

As for the restaurant...

As mentioned before it is gorgeous, with a very open seating area and an open kitchen as well. 

The staff is incredibly friendly and attentive 

There are free biscuits with butter that you see on display as soon as you walk in. Their were two options of biscuits when I was there, one sweet and the other savory. Both were delicious.

I got the "egg plate", which was supposed to be bacon, eggs, and toast, but they replaced the bacon with sausage because they ran out of bacon. It was very tasty and the perfect size. 

The cherry on top was that their to go box was compostable and they included to-go utensils. They also gave me a coffee to go, and it was delicious!
name: Ultima Cucina

text:
Not a bad place to grab a decent meal, but definitely overpriced in my opinion.

We made a reservation here while in town with my fiance and his daughter, hoping to show her a somewhat upscale dining experience while also ensuring there were things she could eat. 

Finding the restaurant is somewhat difficult as there is no clear signage to where you are. We knew the restaurant was in the hotel, but assumed there were several dining options in there and weren't positive we were at the place we had made the reservation because there was nothing indicating the name of it.

Luckily, we were in the right place. They had run out of dinner menus, but we were quickly seated while we waited for them. The drinks were good, but they took quite a while each time we ordered a new round, including the glass of wine I ordered, which I thought was strange.

We started with the chicken bites, which my fiance loved. My stepdaughter thought they were a bit spicy for her taste. We also had the baked goat cheese, which I loved.

My stepdaughter and I split a caesar salad, which was just fine, and then I had the chicken alfredo. This was disappointing. I was looking to splurge on vacation and the alfredo sauce was pretty lacking in flavor, and the chicken portion was quite small. She had a pepperoni pizza which was quite charred and didn't have a ton of flavor, but she said it tasted "fancy" so there's that. But, she only ate one slice so then we had to have a talk about spending $20 to only eat a couple of bites of pizza. Fun times.

Not bad in a pinch, but definitely not worth the $$$
name: Ultima Cucina

text:
About the wait: As others have noted you'll wait in the drive-thru longer here than fast food places. That's because this isn't fast food. My guess is food is cooked as it's ordered. 
I think there were four cars ahead of me when I got in the drive-thru line. It was 14 minutes before I picked up my order. 
What I received was a messy but honkin' big piece of lightly seasoned, fried ground beef cooked medium well. It may have been a pound of meat.  I would have liked a bit more seasoning but it was well worth the price. 
Speaking of which: $7 and some change included the burger; big, puffy, hand cut fries (which also could have used seasoning); and, a can of Vess soda (reppin' St. Louis!). That, my friends, is high value.

text: Fast, friendly, and super attentive to people's needs. I always ask for my chicken fingers naked (no breading just fried) and even though it takes longer to make, none of the employees even fuss or make a scene. Anytime I forget lemons in my unsweet tea, someone always runs out and brings them to my car for me. They always ask me if I need any extra ketchup or dressings. Honestly go above and beyond of what I've ever experienced with any fast food restaurant. Whoever is hiring for there team is cultivating a really hard working team. My favorite place to go now anytime I'm im a rush
name: Raising Cane's Chicken Fingers

text:
It's drive through only and be prepared to wait. Hard menu to read being a first timer. Shady area but right next to police station so don't be alarmed. One drive up window to place order and then drive around the building to the next window to get your food and pay. Building is so small you can barely make the turn around it. A good 15 minute wait. Food was good though and like they say "worth the weight". 

Burgers are huge 1/2 pounders so singles are enough for most. Not at all greasy but full of flavor Had mine with bacon onion and pickle. No sauce mon! 

Ordered cheese fries and they actually melt sliced cheese right over the top.. in 2 different layers! Impressive. Gotta eat those guys hot though! They serve them in their own brown bag! 

And as a bonus you get your pick of local Vess soda. Cream for me please. It's an experience and worth the off the beaten path, run down look of the place. All that old grease has flavor after all!
name: The White Barn

text:
One of the best dining experiences I've had this year. The staff was excellent and excited about the food, and after eating at Last Kitchen twice now, I can understand why.
ANYTHING chicken is LEGIT. I ordered a Lil Gem Salad with Chicken, and....oh my god. The chicken is tender and juicy. The chicken skin nachos are a party in your mouth - a welcome break from the popular pork rinds. We ordered a sausage board....the giardinera is FANtastic and the sausages are the gd bomb. I'm not exaggerating in the least.
Mesha was eager to answer all our questions, quick on service, and was absolutely delightful.
Rome came out of the kitchen to talk food with us and explain his methods. He can just keep doing what he's doing in the kitchen because it's unbelievable what amazing flavor he can get out of something as simple as a chicken. Fabulous. 

We're already planning on coming back! We'll probably be regulars!!

Almost forgot (and shouldn't have): The cocktails are great. Try the Last Last Ameretto Sour. It's not that at-a-wedding-reception crap. It's waaaaaaay better. And the Last Last Word was pretty excellent! I'll be getting after work drinks!
name: Ultima Cucina

categories: Burgers, Restaurants

text:
The only reason I'm giving it 2 is the manager tried to save our meal but unfortunately it fell short.  Christmas Day 2019 and we made an open table reservation here for 10:30am as we had a plane to catch in the early afternoon.  There were 5 of us, and in fact we called to make sure they were open for brunch.  No mention of a breakfast buffet only!  Ok, we get to the Last Kitchen right at our reservation time and greeted by the hostess.  She says to give her a minute and they are only serving their breakfast buffet now.  We were kind of disappointed, but it was one of those we can get over it fast kind of issue.
The hostess tells us to not even sit down but to go ahead through the buffet and by then our table would be ready.  4 of us decided to wait for the table to be ready so that we could put our coats down etc.  The one who went through had no food on her plate except a couple of potatoes and some fruit.  She whispered to us there was no food left in the chafer dishes.  
So we all go up to get food and lo and behold-nothing!  Not even potatoes anymore.  I look around and there are 2 chef coated guys standing there staring at us and when we said there was no food, they just looked at us funny.  
I took my empty plate back to the table and went over to the front desk of the hotel.  I asked for the manager and told him the issue.  He said he would get these chafers refilled as soon as possible.  The food kind of trickled out from there and we asked if we can get some eggs made to order since they were out of the only egg dish (fritatta).  after a while they agreed to make some eggs for 2 of us.
We also noticed there was NO bread or bakery items at all?  No danishes, toast, croissants, etc, nothing nada.  
Folks- this is breakfast buffet 101- especially for a hotel kitchen to be so bad at getting food out and then not even having the MINIMUM to have a mediocre one at best and all for the low, low price of $20.00 per person.
Toast was finally brought out when our meal was done.  We ate it anyways because we were hungry!!!! lol
The manager told us he would not charge us for the eggs made to order. Huh??????  Gee thanks
The last kitchen is name appropriate because I wouldn't come back here if it was the LAST Kitchen open in St. Louis.
name: Ultima Cucina

categories: Burgers, Restaurants

text:
The mystique of the White Barn runs deep in this area in St. Louis.  There's barely any reference to it on the omniscient Google beyond a blog post, the Moline Acres Chamber of Commerce, and now this Yelp page.  They do have a Facebook fan page complete with loyal fans.

I mentioned that I was going to try this place out and a coworker responded, "That's the town where they recovered my Jeep riddled in bullets!"  This establishment is what it says - a freaking white barn, where you order at one window and pay/pick up at the next.  

But let's not get caught up in the nitty gritty details.  Let's talk about the burger.  I swear there's some pork in the patty, but I'm not sure.  Apparently "everything on it" does not include lettuce and tomato.  They put some interesting spices in the burger that made it quite tasty, and the suspiciously meatloafiness made me think there was more than just beef in it.  Regardless, I thoroughly enjoyed it.  They also offer sides such as jalapeno poppers and fried okra.  What cracks me up about this place is that they only serve St. Louis native Vess soda.  

I wouldn't go out of my way to try this place out, but I'll definitely stop by again.
name: The White Barn

categories: Cocktail Bars, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces, Event Planning & Services, Steakhouses, American (New), Bars, Nightlife

text:
I've been so excited to eat here and had heard nothing but good things. I also love that the head chef is a woman! We did a staycation night and while the food was wonderful, other parts of our experience could use some work. I'll break it down by meal... 

Snack and Drinks: 
We were hoping to enjoy the rooftop bar once we got settled into our room, but unfortunately they weren't  serving food and I was in desperate need of a snack. Not sure if they only serve food up there in the summer? Online they said nothing about seasonal food. Definitely a bummer, but we headed down to the main bar and ordered the crab dip, which was amazing. I also had a delightful gin cocktail. 

Dinner: 
We made a 7:30 dinner reservation and were seated promptly. It seemed that they were understaffed, as I only ever saw two servers, the host and a food runner. Our server was very nice once she came to the table, but for a restaurant with this price point you'd expect a higher level of service. We ordered cocktails and the fried brussel sprouts as a starter, which came out pretty quickly. I am obsessed with brussel sprouts, but unfortunately these were heavy with a tempura style batter. They were good, but just too much. For entrees I had the steak and my boyfriend had the gumbo and a side of fries. The steak and fingerling potatoes were delicious, and he really liked the gumbo. The fries were very boring, which was surprising for this style of restaurant. I also wish there was some divider between the restaurant and the bar/lobby because it was so loud. Didn't help that there was a wine tasting event in the hotel that night and drunk people were literally everywhere. I also feel like they could do something to soften the dinning area a bit... maybe plants or artwork between the windows? The space just needs a little something. Overall we had a very nice dinner, there were  just small things that could have made the experience better. 

Breakfast:
We were seated right away around 10am on a Sunday. The menu isn't large but has a nice variety. I ordered pancakes and he got biscuits and gravy, which were both delicious. The pancakes are super rich, and the nuts and chocolate chips were a nice addition. They have these super cute coffee cups that I'm pretty sure I read were made for them by a local potter, but they don't have handles and my cup was so hot I could barely touch it. (Later I saw someone near us with what looked like a leather sleeve on his cup but by this point my coffee had cooled enough I didn't bother asking for one). Service was a bit slow, and the three people working seemed a bit scattered considering the restaurant wasn't full. We were never offered coffee refills and we sat for quite while waiting on the check. Nobody wants to feel rushed, but you also don't want to feel forgotten. 

Overall we really enjoyed all the food we had over the course of our stay! Unfortunately they fell short on the service side, which is such a big thing when your price points are a little higher. Hopefully all issues that can be fixed because they have delicious food and cocktails!
name: Ultima Cucina

text: This place was baller!  First and foremost, I have to give a huge shoutout to the hostess.  She hustled all night to fill our water glasses and gave some valuable commentary/advice!  We were seated immediately and served promptly.  I went with my parents and sisters to this place, and when we go out as a family we order a lot of different things and try them all.  That played to our advantage at this restaurant because literally everything was good.  From the chicken bites and toasted ravs that we had for appetizers, to the shrimp po boy, duck pot pie, pizza, and adult buttered noodles that we had for entrees, and then finishing off with the coconut caramel cake, ALL of it tasted so good!  The only reason for the 4 star review was the temperature of the appetizers - they were on the room temperature side and the chicken could've been crispier.  Other than that, we had such a lovely dinner here.  I would recommend to anyone living in or visiting the area.
name: Ultima Cucina

text: Chicken chicken watcha pickin and I'll tell you when I'm picking I'm picking raising canes in Maplewood. Doesn't get much better than this. I always have really good service I love their hot sauce they're super fast at making my food and they always say the right things in the drive-through to me. Just the greeting you get when you pull up is worth it. The creativity in that building is through the roof and it's insane I never know what I'm gonna get. Well actually I do because they only have like five things on the menu. Their bread is always so soft I don't know how the hell they do it. Plus they're open super late so I go after I work out at the gym and it makes me feel like I really didn't just work out because I put the way back on but life is about consistency and I'm just fine with that. They would never let me down and I spent so much money there I literally go there every week. I get this plays five stars and I would give it six if I could. My boyfriend loves the caniac combo. I even always take the survey so I get free canes for a year but I've never gotten it so if the owner is seeing this please give me something.
name: Raising Cane's Chicken Fingers

text:
Wow! I can't believe this place. Probably one of the best burgers I've had in my life. First time here in the area is a little sketchy so I just figured I'd get a cheeseburger to try it out. Wish I would have gotten the fries. Talk about a thick Burger and have all the condiments on it. Slightly on the greasy side which makes it all that much mo better.

I will definitely be back again here tomorrow.
name: The White Barn

text: Doing an Update! The Girl with the Huge Lashes is still there but her attitude was better this time! She actually said Thank You and was kind of pleasant for a change! The Burger was a slight disappointment! It's smaller and barely had the mustard & Ketchup condiments with a few diced onions tossed in In! I started going there in the 70's and the Original Owner was Very Nice and He would form the Hugh patties right before you and his hamburgers were 2nd to none and cheap! The New owner has Blacked out the windows so you can't see in! Why? What are they hiding from Public view? A Burger and side is almost 7 dollars now! They are slowly losing my business with the rising cost and not to stellar Burgers!
name: The White Barn

text: This is what dreams are made of! The picture doesn't do justice to the size of this Bloody Mary! It comes with 8 ounces of vodka of your choosing, a slider, homemade mini donuts and muffins, boneless wings, and so much more. This was our breakfast and lunch! The ambiance of @thelaststl is just as decadent as their Bloody Mary. The loaded Bloody Mary at the Last Hotel and Kitchen is offered at brunch on Saturday's and Sunday's.

text: An absolute gem in downtown St Louis. Finally a restaurant that offers exquisite food, drinks, and service. It looks and acts like a place in a large coastal city, but without that price tag!  You would be a fool to not try this place. If you want a relax and chill time, try the rooftop. If you want to have a great fine dining experience (without the snootiness that you find in most places) and the best service in the city, dine downstairs. The food, presentation, and history is all amazing and wonderful. Ask for Sydney and she will take great care of you. She is without a doubt one of the finest in the industry.  You will not be disappointed.
name: Ultima Cucina

text:
We stopped here after hiking at the nearby fort. The service was friendly and fast. The burgers were juicy, flavorful, and not greasy at all. We had two burgers, a side of okra, and a catfish dinner. Everything was fresh and delicious! The catfish was obviously breaded on site as was the okra. Yum!!
We will definitely be back if we're back in the area!

text:
Solid neighborhood bar. plastic dartboard, friendly patrons, and just a nice place to grab a burger and relax on the street. 
Beers a fairly cheap ($3 - $4) Burgers with fries run about $6 - $8. Not too much on the menu, burgers, wings, bar food, but bar food done well.

Nothing about the place will wow anyone. But if you want to relax with a few friends, or just need a place to watch the Cardinals game, this is as good a place as any.
name: Krueger's Bar

text:
This is not a review of the food because my dining experience did not make it that far.  On a whim, a friend and I went there for dinner.  There was one other group in the entire restaurant.  After taking a look around we chose the filthy table with a cigarette butt because it was the cleanest table available.  After about 10 minutes and three clarifications, the waiter was finally able to get us our 2 sodas.  Trying to get a menu from him proved to be too tall of an order.  After another 10 minutes we just left.  

This restaurant acts as if they are actively trying to discourage patronage.   Luckily there are a 1000 good restaurants in the area so I won't ever have to return here
name: Krueger's Bar

text: I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE ROBERTO'S! I have managed to live and work all over the world and I still always crave Roberto's no matter where I go.  They offer delicious thin crust pizza, yummy salads with a ton of cheese, scrumptious chopped beef with chesse sandwiches, and the best crushed ice in town.  Although, I may be a bit partial to their food seeing as it was my first job at 14.  Give it a try, you will not be dissapointed!

text: Nice, cozy neighborhood bar with friendly bartender and good food. Decided to come here on a tuesday night for food and drinks. The place was pretty much empty except for a few drinkers at the bar. The bartender was very nice and quick with the drinks. We went for some classic appetizer bar food. Chicken wings, chicken tenders, onion rings and a St. Louis staple, toasted raviolis. All were delicious and came out in about 5-7 minutes. Will come back for more!

text:
This is a bar with a limited menu of standard bar food. 
After settling in and a little more research I realized I wasn't at Krieger's Sports Bar and Grill, which once had multiple locations in St. Louis and I thought still did. 
No, I was at Krueger's Bar. There's no "and grill" in the name: The food menu includes  appetizers, a few sandwiches, a couple of burgers, and some salads. 
I ordered the Poor Boy sandwich. 
The hoagie bread was very good: The rest looked like store-bought slices of cheese and deli meats with an iceberg lettuce leaf placed on top. Nothing remarkable. 
I didn't need condiments, which was good because halfway through the sandwich I was asked if I wanted mayonnaise. 
(Except for that the service was quick and attentive.)
The lunch basket included a pickle slice, a pepper, and a bag of Lay's potato chips (option: fries or potato salad). So, basically, I got table service that was very good for pretty much what I could have picked up at a nearby convenience store. 
At 12:30 there were only two other small lunch parties. Four or five regulars came in at 1. 
Patio seating available and there's a shared side parking lot with coin meters.
name: Krueger's Bar

text:
As the other review stated, this pizza is LEGIT.  Absolutely fantastic!  Our Pizza had a delightful fresh crispy thin crust and was lightly sauced (the way my wife likes it).  The italian sausage was a flavorful link sausage which had been it into slices.  The cheese tasted like some sort of blend, predominantly provel; we loved it.  This is St Louis Style Pizza at its best.  

Our lasagna, on the other hand, was forgettable. It was a bit loose and there wasn't much ricotta or other yumminess. It was mostly meat sauce and noodles, with a slice of provel on top. 

I also had the dinner salad with the garlic vinaigrette. The salad was topped with a generous portion of provel and the dressing was great. I recommend it. 

The atmosphere here is strictly low rent - padded metal chairs, Formica tables, and the original tile floor from the 60's, with a half dozen tiny 19 inch TVs on the wall. The staff was very friendly and we got the impression (by eavesdropping) that this place attracts a lot of regulars. Despite the fact that we weren't regulars, we were treated very well.
name: Roberto's Italian Restaurant

text:
I grew up in Florissant so Roberto's has an enduring place in my heart and my stomach. For the record, Flo MO was a great place to grow up. I had a happy childhood and do not need therapy. (at least not today LOL )

I'm sure that I am dating myself but I can vividly recall the days when Mullanphy Garden shopping center was a player. There was a Del Monte supermarket, a Ben Franklin five and dime and a wonderful bakery that my family visited most Sundays after church- if it was in the budget and if all of us kids had been good that week. While I am sad that those retail stalwarts no longer reside here, I am eternally grateful that Roberto's has withstood the test of time.

OK, first we must all agree that we are not talking about authentic Roma or Napoli pie here...let's just get that out of the way up front. Yes, there is a distinctly non-Italian yellowish cheese on the pie. True that bacon is not a traditional pizza topping. These facts are noted for full disclosure but are completely irrelevant IMHO. 

I know that Roberto's has a proper menu but I have experienced very little of it. It is ALL about the bacon pizza bro! GLORIOUS. When I am back in my home town visiting Mom and Dad Roberto's is a must. When I am not back in Flo I have random dreams about the delicious, kooky, non-authentic bacon pizza pie. I could eat this every single day of my life- it is pizza crack for chrissakes !
 
Maybe it is a good thing I don't live in Florissant any more...
name: Roberto's Italian Restaurant

text:
I have eaten here multiple times before I decided to review this joint and I'm giving it 5 stars for multiple reasons. I go with my significant others family, who have been coming here for over 40 years. Having people come to a location for so long is a sign that this place has withstood the times and must have a lot going for it! While the restaurant itself could use a few upgrades, I actually have become fond of the homey and familiar feel I get when I arrive to one of my favorite pizza joints. 

Some people who previously reviewed Robertos must not be familiar with St. Louis style pizza. I remember my first time eating St. Louis style pizza (over 20 years ago) I thought that they got something wrong and their style of pizza was horrific. NOW, I wouldn't have my pizza any other way!! There is no deep dish and no hand tossed. You get your good ole thin crust pizza. My favorite pizza is the shrimp pizza. Don't be fooled, I was very reserved my first time, I wasn't sure that mini shrimp on a pizza would be good. Holy smokes, I crave this pizza all the time and we drive over 30 mins out of our way to enjoy it. I highly recommend it (don't forget to ask for extra shrimp). They also have your classic pizzas, we enjoy the Garbage pizza too (their name for supreme pizza). 
We always start with toasted ravioli and garlic cheese bread. Two things you can't go wrong with either! 

The atmosphere is very casual, they have TVs around with your favorite games on and you should grab a bucket of beer while you watch. Their buckets are a great price, unlike most places I go to these days that charge an insane amount for your basic bucket! 

Staff is always kind, friendly and smiling. Yes they are always busy, but it takes some patience for a great pizza and we never wait to be seated, even though every time we go, it's a full house! Janice is the owner and usually serves us as well. Talk about an amazing woman! She is so kind and makes each time we visit, a great experience. 

I would say, don't knock it until you try it. We don't live anywhere near it and make sure to eat there at least once a month. It would be great to chow on some pizza while you watch the Blues or Cards play! It's the epitome of traditional St. Louis, now go grab some pizza and cold brews!
name: Roberto's Italian Restaurant

text:
We decided to grab a quick lunch after running errands and Krueger's was on the way home.  The only draw back was that we did not grab a quick lunch.  Although we were served our drinks and our order was taken in a timely fashion, the food took its little time getting to us. It wasn't crowded either. But I guess good food takes awhile. 

I ordered a bowl of their chili, a hamburger and onion rings.  I was starting to get hangry when the food arrived. I thought the chili would come out first but instead it came out all together.  I ordered my chili with cheese and onions on top.  The chili was delicious and the only thing I didn't like was that the onions were sliced,not diced. It made it a little hard to be a lady while eating. 

I think the cheeseburger and the onion rings were the best I've had in a long time. The burger was cooked perfectly and the onion rings put me over the top. 

Now if you want to grab a quick bite, don't come here. If you want the best bar food I have had, this is the place for you. You just have to be patient

Would I come back here?  You know I will.
name: Krueger's Bar

text:
Liked the food quite a bit, prices are pricey, takes a while to get your food.  First thing I noticed was that the food costs about double what stereotypical fast food costs, even though this is essentially the same stuff - but I suppose it should be much better.  And I was already there to try it out, so...placed the order and was told it would take 5 to 10 minutes.  And it took about 10 minutes, for 3 chicken sandwiches, 2 orders of fries, and 1 order of chicken fingers.  Seemed like  long time, but then it needed to be since the chicken was cooked up fresh.  I'd rather have it fresh an hot, so not a problem for me.

The chicken on both the sandwich and the fingers was juicy and flavorful, with a well-spiced (but not chili spice),  crispy coating.  They hit the mark there.  Don't know that it was twice as good as fast food, but it was good.  The sandwiches came with 4 bread & butter pickles.  They had a good snap, but not a lot of tartness in that variety.  I think a little bit of tart would have set off well from the chicken.  And the sandwiches came with mayo on them.  Personally, I'd have preferred to put one of their own sauces on the sandwich.

Fries were thinner than a typical crinkle cut, with a good peppery spice on them.  I though the fries were top notch.  And a generous portion too.

You have to get your own sauces from the dispensers, if you want more than just ketchup for your to go orders.  But the person giving me the bag informed me of that, so no problem.  And that way I could take extra, to make sure I didn't run out - and some for later.  We took some Andouille (I think) sauce, which was basically a spicy mayo with a sneaky heat - it was really good for dipping the fries; and took some of their "secret sauce", which was a sweetish, syrup thick sauce - hard for me to define it, but it made a good chicken dip.

So a decent experience overall.  Pretty good food, takes a bit of time but you want it fresh and hot, still not sure if it's 2x as good as fast food for 2x the price.
name: Chicken Out
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants

text: I heard that this bar was really nice. Well, the Buffalo chicken wings were supposed to be really nice. I went today and ordered a house salad and the buffalo wings. However, I felt cheated because my entire bill was 18.00. The service was good, but the cost of the meal was extremely high.

text: Doesnt live up to the Hype, got the Chicken Out sandwich, crispy chicken, fresh and hot, the bun was ok, nothing special and had two little pickles and mayonnaise.  The drink was small, french fries ok, not as good as McDonalds, lol.  I'll give it another try and maybe try to customize next time with cheese, or lettuce and tomato, onion or something.  $13.50 was a little pricey I thought.
name: Chicken Out
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants

text:
The new Chicken Out has arrived in Kirkwood/Warson area in the old Shop n Save spot on Manchester, east of Manchester and west of Woodlawn on north side of street. Weird little
Shopping center with poor signage. Worth finding though. Better and more accessible than the Loop location. Same great food. The fries are slightly more addictive than crack. Delicious. I had the Cheep n Cheese with bacon and my wife had the Chicken Out. She was underwhelmed by the chicken but I thought it was consistent and delicious. Very friendly staff. Clean bathrooms. Quick service for fast casual.
name: Chicken Out
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants

text:
What a great experience! I can't wait to go back!
First downtown traffic made us late for our reservation, so I called and was warmly greeted and accommodated with my reservation being pushed back. 
Upon arrival the look itself is very adult and sexy. Lots of wood and dark colors but still very inviting. 
The owner greeted is and got us seated in a booth. I love the booths as they seem like your own listening section and they come with charger plugs. 
The music from the DJ was at the prefect volume. It filled the room but didn't overpower the ability to speak at a normal level.
Lacey was out server and she was very informative and had a great personality. Great service, all our questions answered, and she let us know about future events to get us back in.
Now to the good and drink....WINNER! 
The small plate selecting is not large but what they do have they do it right! The calamari was actually crispy on the outside and still actually tender and juicy. The aoilo that accompanied it was also outstanding. We then tried the sliders, and were not disappointed. Delicious bread and slaw with juicy flavourful pulled pork that packs a slow roll of heat. 
There for an Elite event so I got to try some drinks that may go on the menu and was happy to get a sneak peak. My hubby was happy with the beer and whiskey selections.
Great date night spot!!!
name: Takashima Record Bar

text: My husband and I stopped in to Navin's today for lunch. We ordered the Jerk sandwich, the Hot Brown, smashed potato salad, Mac and cheese, and a Texas Twinkie. Everything was delicious! My husband and I are bbq lovers. St. Louis has a very competitive bbq scene and this place is now going to be in our bbq rotation. We also got a sample of the pinto beans. I'm typically not a huge fan of traditional baked beans because I find them to be basic and too sweet. The pinto beans at Navin's were probably my favorite side. Complex in flavor and perfectly cooked. I would highly recommend this place. We will definitely be back!

text:
Alright, this is hard. 

Food was 5 stars. The pizza in particular was terrific. All of the other dishes ordered by our group of 8 came exactly correct and exactly fine tasting. Our server was a very aware of our needs and did a great job keeping things straight. The owner came by and did all those nice things.

Now the hard part:
This place has zero, and I mean zero atmosphere. My garage is more conducive to dining out than this place. I know the goal is Food-Service-Fair Pricing. This is achieved. But dang, dress the place up a tad otherwise this will be a carry out and catering only type of place.
name: Roberto's Italian Restaurant

text:
Ordered via app around 1:15, took almost 30 minutes for the order to be ready. Order was mostly correct (except a missing side item).  Sandwiches were very plain, though should have had things on them (Mayo, pickles, etc).  Fries and chicken flavors were fine, not remarkable. "Cheese" sauce was nearly flavorless. "Grilled cheese" was a reversed bun (see pic) that the kids refused to eat. 

Bottom line, slow and pricey, nothing remarkable enough to warrant a second trip.
name: Chicken Out
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants

text:
We were excited to get to tryout Takashima on their first night opened with the new owners. The space is gorgeous, two levels of open body booths that overlook the bar and dj booth. I loved how they had tables for two and tables for a group, this unique spot is a perfect date spot but also amazing for groups of friends getting together to chill and imbibe. The walls are lined with thousands of vinyl records. There's a live DJ there every night spinning and creating a relaxed but upbeat vibe. The DJs will vary night tonight so every night you go will be a new experience.

I ordered the satin doll cocktail which was a spiced pear and elderflower mix. It was delicious and their presentation was spot-on. They have a huge selection of spirits including a wide variety of bourbon and Japanese whiskies which my husband was eager to sample. We also ordered the charcuterie board and beet salad. The beet salad was so outstanding. I'm still thinking about it today. The charcuterie board had very high quality cheese and charcuterie, however we felt like the $22 price tag should have come with a little more substance. All in all I'm thrilled that this location has reopened filling a missing void in the st. Louis bar scene.
name: Takashima Record Bar

text:
In one word, unique.
Went for the elite event; this pub has a different vibe. First of all it is very neat  , yaaay this made me happy. The decor is unique, the owners put a lot of work to get the records, in addition it has some old stereos installed in the cabinets separating the records. They were attentive to details. They also had hangers on the bar which i really liked. This was very considerate of them.
I tried number 3 and number 4 on their new drink menu (names still not listed). Number 3: the taste of chocolate bitter was sort of strong  and the alcohol was bit diluted. 
Overall, i am happy that a bar like Takashima opened in town, i enjoyed the vibe and liked the style. Definitely this will be that bar that ill go to.
name: Takashima Record Bar

The vibes here are immaculate! 
I loved the interior design. I will say we didn't get good cell service and we think it's because we were sitting inside a metal crate lol. 
Our service was excellent and the Dj spinning that night was definitely playing some jams. 

What I ordered: I just got cocktails this night. I started off with the diamond life which was by far my favorite. Perfectly light and summery. At my table we also loved the go for your guns. The reason I could not give them five stars is because of the sweet wynomi. It is probably the worst drink I have ever gotten at a restaurant/bar. Everyone at my table tasted it and we all agreed- it tastes like your grandmas old perfume bottle. I hope for the love of God it is taken off the menÃº. 

A great experience all around! I will be back sometime!

text: Got the pulled pork, brisket, burnt ends and mac and cheese. Also ordered the Collard Greens and Pinto Beans, but they were missing from our order, so not sure.  The mac and cheese was creamy and had the Red Hot Riplets seasoning. The burned ends were also very good.  The pulled pork was dry and didn't really have much of a bark or rub flavor.  The brisket was undercooked and was dry and rubbery. I asked for slices from both flat(lean) and point(fatty) to get a good sample, but the order just had slices from the flat.   I love Navin R. Johnson and I love BBQ so I was excited to see this place open.   Can't really recommend the brisket or pork, hoping it gets better.

text: Another strong operation by the Sugarfire/HiPointe team. Not sure what people are expecting when they say the prices are high...this is not a chain fast food restaurant. It's a local quick-service restaurant with sandwiches in the $7.50-8.50 range. Prices were completely in line for the product and experience, service was fast and friendly when dining in for lunch on Sunday. We waited about 10 mins for our food, and it was piping hot, crispy and fresh. Good variety of housemate sauces. Thin crinkle-cut fries as well as the fried chicken sandwiches and strips are excellent! Everything is clean, decor is bright and cute, so happy they came out to suburbia.
name: Chicken Out
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants

text: This is a really cool spot I wouldn't have known about without the Yelp elite event. Hip decor and mood lighting make this a unique spot in STL, and the DJ carefully curates the playlist with a mind-blowingly large collection. This isn't the place to have a meal, but they do have a few small plates in addition to the extensive liquor, cocktail, wine and beer menu. It's easy to spend more money than you want to when everything is so good!
