text: I seen this place passing by and I wanted to try it out! It's pricey! The chicken sandwich alone is $8+ and then to add a meal almost $5. We got the buff daddy, the chicken out, 2 drinks, a Mac n cheese and a fries. The Mac n cheese was watery and tasted so off, no flavor at all. He said it was the last mac n cheese of the night, not knowing it would be gross. I asked for crispy fries, they weren't crispy at all. The chicken was so dry and hard to chew. Maybe it was old? Maybe reheated? Not sure! The flavor of the buff daddy was good with the slaw which I usually don't care for slaw but it goes good with the chicken sandwich. For the price I'd expect the food to be better and hot! For a family of 4 it would be close to $60 if not more. We left hungry after our meals, not enough food for your money. I honestly think Popeyes chicken sandwich tasted better!!!
name: Chicken Out
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants

text: It's always nice to feel welcomed! I was so excited to see Krueger's reopen in May. Even better is their new menu which will delight every one regardless of food preference. The pretzel bite appetizer is a bite of heaven. Since May, this neighborhood bar has been destination number one for my friends and I. Did I mention the great mixologists behind the bar? They will bring a smile to your face with cocktails that make the days challenge a distant memory.
name: Krueger's Bar

text: I  went there for lunch today.  I know this location just opened, so I might give it another chance. The chicken was dry , the bun was nothing special, and the cheddar sauce was bland.  The fries were lukewarm, but good. The thing that got me was the size of the drink, a can of soda would  not fit in it.  For almost  $15.00, I expect  a soda to last  throughout the meal, and  a  sandwich with some flavor. The chicken place down the street is half the price , the food is good, and the size of the drinks are normal.  I hope things get better.
name: Chicken Out
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants

text: Been there a few times....always fast fresh chicken with a nice choice of sides and dipping sauces.
name: Chicken Out
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants

text: Had been looking forward to this restaurant opening, but was severely disappointed with my visit. First waited 5 minutes for my turn to place my order at the drive through.  When I was able to pull up to the speaker I was asked to hold.  After 3 minutes I started saying "Hello" but never got a response.  After 4 more minutes the person behind me asked if I could pull through so they could leave.  As I pulled up to the pickup window I honked several times but no one came.  I parked and went inside.  Explained the drive thru situation and no one apologized,  but took my order.  I ordered the spicy sandwich.  When I got home the chicken patty was 2/3 the size of the bun.  Very small for a $7.50 sandwich.  When I started to eat it I realized they gave me a regular sandwich and not the spicy sandwich.  So no more and back to driving much further to Chick-Fil-A.
name: Chicken Out
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants

text: One of my favorite places to go to. It's all the rage. The food is great (Kitchen closes at 10), A wide selection of beers on tap, in cans, and bottles. Patio seating with music and television. Even when it's crowded, the vibe is low-key and family friendly/oriented.

text: I used the online ordering and the food was ready to go when I walked in the restaurant.   I ordered the combo burnt ends with Mac and cheese and my wife got pulled pork the potato salad and the collard greens.   The food contained spice with a capsaicin component.   My wife thought the collard greens were too spicy.  I thought so as well.   The pulled pork was acceptable.  I thought the burnt ends were great.   The pork belly burnt ends are like melt in your mouth bacon.  The brisket burnt end were similar to eating rib meat.   The Mac and cheese was creamy with an excellent cheese flavor.   I tried the potato salad, wasn't for me, but everyone has their own tastes.   I definitely plan to order again.

text:
This place is so cool. At first I thought it was going to be just chill vibes bar. But it was so much better. The place itself has beautiful finishes from the large bar to an upstairs balcony. Great place to go for a date night or chill hang out with some friends.

I had the pulled pork sliders. Very good, I recommend these if your like sandwiches with a spicy kick with sweet undertones. The drinks were amazing as well- but do know it's in the middle lane of pricy so you'll be spending a bit more on drinks but the bartenders are actual mixologists who are happy to explain the drinks to you insuring you'll get one you'll love- and they'll be delicious. 

There is an actual DJ spinning records. This is a listening bar too so the music is a bit loud, but that's the point of a listening bar... you listen to the music, haha. All in all great place great staff. I would recommend visiting and listening to the DJ sling some records.
name: Takashima Record Bar

Would I come back here?  You know I will. If you see me there, stop by and say hello.

text:
I was greeted by the hostess/owner who was delightful. She found seats for us at the bar and after a few minutes Nick came over to advise us of our drink choices.  With the volume of the music it would've been nice to see a written description of the drinks. But luckily I made a good selection with the drink the gin drink that had cucumber.  I'm not really a gin person but when I heard cucumber I was sold. My friend had the cognac drink. She liked it OK but it was a bit too sweet and seem to be a better after dinner sipping type of drink. We ordered two of those small plates. I got the calamari and my friend got the pork sliders. 
The pork sliders were too spicy for my taste however the menu does mention that they have a little kick. The calamari was good but I felt like the serving was pretty small especially when you compared it to the pork sliders. For our next round of drinks my friend had another bartender make her up a old fashion that he created. She definitely enjoyed that. Bartender number two, whose name I didn't get, made my 2nd gin cocktail and surprisingly it wasn't as good as the 1st one. I did notice in my first cocktail there was a slice of fresh cucumber and in the second one it was the dried cucumber not sure that that makes the difference but something did! I know that one of the things about this event was that we were supposed to help come up with names for their new cocktails but there wasn't really a good way to convey any of the ideas that we had. 
The atmosphere at 
Takashima Record Bar is sort of a combo of modern meets mysterious. Ha  It is dimly lit or maybe I should say mood lighting. Being a record bar it won't be a surprise that they have albums as decoration through out. The owners paid attention to detail with even the silverware being shiny black. I loved it. 
One thing I don't really get (maybe it's my age) is how a record bar is different than playing music over the speaker system.  It is not like you could go talk to the DJ or make requests. And the whole time I was there the music was the in the same genre. It was good even though I would not have played it at home. 
Overall this is fun place to grab a drink after dinner or work. The staff was attentive and kind. They do have a variety of offerings to meet most anyone's needs. I would suggest that the owners get a bigger sign though so people can find it easier. 
Jason - thanks for the sweet Spotify play list and plastic case! You're the goat.
name: Takashima Record Bar

text:
Not bad.   Long long line in drive thru.  Should have went inside but super courteous.   Friendly service, hot food and all the essentials packed in the bag without having to ask. 

My daughter ordered the spicy hot.  Sooooo good.  Thick, juicy fried piece of chicken.  Crispy coating just perfect.  Sauce was perfection.   Nice presentation.  

I ordered the fit chic.  Not bad and yes I would order again.  They offer grilled or fried.  I believe fried defeats the fit part of the description but lots not get too technical.  The avocado sauce was tasty.  It was a tad dry but still worth the purchase.   After trying the spicy hot it was challenging to stay focused on mine. 

2 sandwiches = $17+.
name: Chicken Out
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants

text: This is hands down my favorite place of 2021!! There is a live DJ spinning a variety of tunes. The eclectic decor adds to the setting. I enjoyed the small details such as the black chrome utensils, the modern cabbage plates, floating barstools, asymmetrical tables. .....Not to mention the must try pork sliders, they are spicy, crunchy, and served along with pickled pairings DELISH. We tried about 4-5 different drinks and they were all awesome with a signature twist. Hal Greens was fantastic as well, very personable, he dropped a few precious nuggets about the origin of the restaurants name (if you see him ask about it.) We commend him and his wife on this great addition to The Grove!!!
name: Takashima Record Bar

text:

One thing that really upset me is that they have an option to add a tip. For what?!  You get your own drinks and sauces and they don't deliver the food to your table. I get better service, comparable food, for a lot less money from fast food restaurants.

Definitely not recommended.

text:
If you are in north county, this is the place to go for pizza. It's a small family owned restaurant and my family and I have been going there for years. The service is always good. It never disappoints. 
I would definitely recommend Roberto's!

text: We placed our order online and went to pick it up in the drive thru and they told us to pull around and they'd bring it out. text: I was excited to go here but unfortunately, since I'm on the younger side of their customers, I was ripped off. I paid for a drink with my card, mind you there was about ten people in the bar, and I never received it. When I asked for my drink they made it and then asked for payment, I told them I had already paid and they said it didn't go through. Even though the charge came up on my account. Annoyingly I gave the man a $20 bill and then he tried to give me a one dollar bill back. When I called him out he tried to argue with me but I was not having it. Thankfully he gave me my change back and although it may have been an honest mistake I ended up paying ten dollars for one drink. I know just turning 21 that we aren't your favorite people to please, but we are bringing in a majority of your business and it would be nice to be respected !
name: Krueger's Bar

text:
Friendly staff, excellent fast food chicken sandwich.

If you are in the mood for a chicken sandwich and have fast casual expectations this is your spot.  Chicken Out is for those looking for an upgrade on your typical chicken sandwich.  The chicken sandwich marketing war is a bit absurd so I will spare you the theatrics and simply say that their sandwiches are worth the couple extra bucks.

The pandemic should update your expectations from fast food joints and dining out in general.  I think old expectations are driving a lot of the other reviews I have read.  If ~14$ per meal (at the time of writing this review) and a 5-10 minute wait are dealbreakers for you avoid Chicken Out, otherwise enjoy a better fast food chicken joint.
name: Chicken Out
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants

text:
Upscale cocktail experience with a unique vibe and excellent DJs spinning vinyl.  Reservations required and good for two hours of service. 

Based on Japanese listening lounges of the 1950's, the atmosphere transports you to a different space filled with unique records spinning in high-fi stereo sound. 

Service from our waitress Ellen was fantastic. The hostess had a reservation move their time, so she offered an extra hour of service. That was a nice move by her.

We enjoyed the records spinning from local DJ and musician, Andy Coco. He also hosts a great radio show, The Rhythm Section on KDHX 88.1 FM, Fridays from Noon - 2 PM. 

Cocktails were excellent. A bit pricy at $12-14 but handcrafted and tasty. 

Food was just ok, but you're not really coming for the food. Charcuterie board should have had more meat and cheese for $25. Fried Calamari was tasty with lemon and aioli, $14. 

Overall, a unique place to impress friends or a date. I will keep an eye on the DJ calendar and will definitely return!
name: Takashima Record Bar

text: This vinyl record spinning bar is tucked away in an assuming building in forest park southeast. With no signage or boards indicating the bar it maintains it's incognito appearance. Once you enter though, you are greeted by a warm host and the walls of vinyl records. They have vinyl record spinning DJ setting the mood while you sip on well made craft cocktails. The small note options were good with the pork sliders being the best item we tried. The calamari was a bit disappointing and the fries are perfect for something to casually munch on. The service was top notch and the cozy booths are perfect for a good group hang. Parking was mostly street and not too difficult to find. A must visit location in STL!
name: Takashima Record Bar

text:
My friend invited me to a celebration that her work was having for her at Takashima. I had some trouble finding parking at first, but eventually found a spot across the street. 
I was greeted at the host stand and told the hostess I was there to meet a friend. She took me upstairs where her company had the whole upstairs reserved. 
I had one of the signature drinks (something with bourbon, can't remember the name) but it was delicious! Ended up getting two of them. 
As the name suggests, this bar is big into records, so it can be a bit loud inside. That being said, this is not the place to go to catch up with a friend over drinks. For a celebration though? Absolutely! 
And I'm pretty sure this is the first bar I have been to since the pandemic, and the experience did not disappoint.
name: Takashima Record Bar

text:
I ordered the smoked brisket sandwich, which was okay, but I didn't make a yummy noise when I bit into it. The bread was dry and the meat was underseasoned. For sides I had the mashed potato salad (which was mustard based), and slaw. The slaw was bitter but I didn't hate it. I also got a bottle of cola, which was flat. I went to immediately throw it away in the trash in their dining room. They have one of those trash cans like in fast food dining rooms. When I opened the flap to toss the soda, it was so full I could hardly fit the bottle in there and a wave of gnats flew out at me. The guy at the counter gave me my order: the brisket sandwich, potato salad, and slaw, and told me it was a different sandwich at first, which caused some confusion. Then he gave me my bag, called me sweetie, and walked away. He had only put one of my sides in there. 
So it was a bunch of these little things that added up to one crummy experience.
-Boring sando
-Flat soda
-Disgusting trash can
- "Sweetie"
-Incomplete order (and he called it out wrong to me)

I don't need your boring sando sir. 
And I ain't your sweetie, sweetie.
name: Navinâs BBQ

text:
This was the first time I had been to Takashima Record Bar and even the first time I had been down to The Grove.  As someone who didn't grow up in a big city, I am not as comfortable driving in the city of St. Louis.  There isn't that much street parking, but there is a free lot a couple of minutes from the bar.  I was greeted at the door by the hostess and felt a lot more comfortable after talking about the safety of the neighborhood as I had made sure before leaving my home that I had made sure that there wasn't anything in plain sight inside my car.  

Takashima Record Bar is a clean and cozy Japanese style bar with attentive bar staff.  I was seated at the bar and enjoyed music play as a DJ changed songs from different artists.  It was such a different atmosphere than what I am used to, and even though I didn't recognize any of the songs that played I enjoyed all of them.  As you look across the bar your eyes are almost mesmerized by the number of record albums that are displayed on the walls like art.  I am not always great with names but the bartender was so attentive and friendly.  The first cocktail I tried was made with Cognac, it was a classic Japanese style drink.  I haven't ever tried Cognac before and wanted to try something new.  It had hints of orange but it was really strong and I will be honest, I couldn't finish it.  I also ordered the Pulled Pork Sliders.  If you are someone who really likes spicy food, then this is a dish for you.  I have a low tolerance when it comes to spicy food and so this was a bad choice for me.  The creamy slaw, pickled onions, and onion straws that came with it were really good though.  I definitely want to come back and try their goat and beet salad.  That looked really good.  The last drink I had was a Shochu Cocktail.  The bartender was able to leave out the spice that they normally put in after the pulled pork debacle.  This cocktail was more to my liking because it was made with rum and coconut milk.  I finished this drink and this was definitely better than the first one that I had.  

Overall I would rate Takashima Record Bar with 5 stars because the staff were excellent.  For the venue being a bar and a place with a DJ, the noise level wasn't that bad.  I didn't come to the venue with anyone but talking to the bartender wasn't difficult.  The bar and bathrooms were clean.  Even though I didn't like the pulled pork because it was too spicy that is personal preference.  I would recommend this place to other people, especially those of my friends who love music.  I am glad they open a little earlier (at 4pm) as someone who can't drink late at night because of migraines it is nice to be able to go someone without having to worry too much about that.  The one thing I would say is that the price of the cocktails was more than I would pay, but once in a while it is okay.  Overall it was a great experience!
name: Takashima Record Bar

text:
It's a little corner bar on Forsyth between downtown Clayton and Washington University.  This is still a smoking establishment.

They have a number of specials - both daily specials which can be viewed on their website and other specials.  Today they had hot tomales, chili, and beef brisket.  But I went with what I knew and what the previous two reviewers mentioned as well - the burger.

I had the bison burger ($7.50) with soft cheddar (add 75c).  If you get the bison and they ask how you want it cooked, I would recommend medium.  You don't want bison overcooked.  The soft cheddar topping was tasty, but man, does it melt/slide right off your burger.  It takes a bit of maneuvering to keep your sandwich together.  (Using my best memory on the prices)

You get a choice of side, and I had the fries.  They were surprisingly very good for "bar and grill" fries.  I made a mixture of mayo and ketchup to dip them in.

One friend got the brisket and liked it.  Another friend got the reuben and was surprised how tasty the corned beef was, so that really stood out.

Good service, good food.  My burger, fries, and soda ($2) cost me about $12 after tax, not counting tip.
name: Krueger's Bar

text:
Few things to start with: First off, being in the Grove, parking is interesting, so give yourself time. Also, if you're traveling at night and don't know where it is at, look for the Seoul Taco. It is right by there, but the sign is hard to spot in the dark.

 As far as the place itself, I think if you have the right expectations, the place is great. It's not cheap alcohol or food, but for the most part, the menu is full of combinations that you're not likely to see elsewhere. It seemed like the mixed drinks averaged about $13 each. And they are not stingy on the liquor. So if you are willing to spend a bit more and be adventurous, it might be a great fit for you.

On the food, we tried the calamari, cheese board, and fries, and they were all very good.

One concern that I saw in some other reviews was the sound level. If you're at all concerned about that, go for a booth. We were baked to talk to each other easily, despite the music.

Every staff member we interacted with was nice, and food and drinks arrived in a reasonable amount of time. No problems there.

Overall, I would definitely recommend this place. It would work for couples, but I think it is best for a small group of friends. Split a few small plates and try a few new drinks. You're sure to have a great time.
name: Takashima Record Bar

text: Tried Chicken Out today! I had the chicken out crispy, husband had the spicy chicken out. We sat outside by the large fiberglass chicken, there is a drive thru you come in from Manchester and drive around the front to get to the back where the menu and speaker are then exit on side of building (see pic) Definitely rivals Chick -fil -a although different. The potato buns are fresh and good, the pickles are standard. Crinkle cut fries had some spices they were good. We liked the onion rings especially for a fast casual they get high marks. It says "sometimes" they have shakes but they did not today. You can see them making the food fresh. The drinks are in a smaller I think 16 oz so be prepared for that. In addition to the price of the sand it's $4.50 to make it a meal. You are at 13$ for a meal. I downloaded app and when I tried to use the promo for signing up and the one for downloading app both were rejected by the app when I clicked redeem "not redeemable at this location" . It definitely costs more than Chick-fil- a , but it's not necessarily better. Location is close to home and very happy to have Chicken Out in our 'hood!
name: Chicken Out
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants

text: Great place to start the evening with excellent drinks.  They made a perfect old fashioned and sazerac.  The drinks on menu looked great also.  The small plate cheese board was good for appetizer.  Sat at the bar and was comfortable.  Wish they had more of a lunge experience area.  Lounge is considered tables and booths versus sitting at bar.
name: Takashima Record Bar

text:
I was a little skeptical when I heard that St. Louis finally had a good spot for barbecue, but during a recent drive through the Midwest I decided to take a chance and check out Navin's and I'm REALLY glad I did.

We decided to order a little bit of everything and found the entire menu to be delicious, but I've gotta give some extra credit points to the burnt ends (both the brisket and pork belly) and the smoked chicken wings (which I never usually order but these ones were truly something special).

Don't sleep on this place -- check out Navin's ASAP!
name: Navinâs BBQ

text:
Absolutely LOVE this place. Now this is my kind of vibe from the music to the ambiance to the drink and the food. It was hard to chose from the new drinks on their menu but I ended up grabbing the #2 drink which was the Gin based one and the #4 one which was Cognac based. I really liked the cognac one because I'm a sucker for dark liquor. Definitely a sipping drink with great flavor. Personally I wasn't to fond of the gin drink but it was great to try it. 

The pulled pork sliders were super amazing. The house bbq with that lil kick on them was a very nice taste. The lemon pepper/Parmesan fries were good too. The garlic aioli just sent them to the top! Highly recommend!!
name: Takashima Record Bar

text:
The newly re-opened Takashima under new ownership is a good addition to the grove neighborhood. It's influenced by Japanese listening bars in which vinyl/music is thoughtfully curated by house DJs. 

I stopped by twice during two different time periods (pre-dinner and post dinner) and the music/vibes were drastically different, in good purpose of course. Vibes are dependent on DJ at the time. The night time DJ played exclusive heavy hip hop.  I think as Takashima matures, its identity, along with their DJ's, will as well. This isn't a knock on Takashima but solely based on its name the new owners inherited, Takashima is a bit of a misnomer. There's nothing Japanese about this place except for some availability of Japanese whiskys and drinks. This was unlike for example, Murasaki Lounge in Chicago where I felt like I was transported to 1980s Japan based on their DJ/music/vibes and drink selections. 

Their cocktails are well-made and delicious. Diamond life and satin dolls were favorites amongst our group. They also have beers and a good list wines. The highballs are overpriced (liquor with soda water filled to top of tall glass) and I wouldn't recommend. 

The hostesses were welcoming and ensure that you are seated quickly. The servers are friendly, efficient, and would never try to rush you out the door.

I'll for certainly be back next time I'm in the neighborhood!
name: Takashima Record Bar

text:
I'm curious as to how the fees add up because my total in the drive through was $28.xx (was not given a receipt so not 100% sure what the exact total was) but my order was only $23.50 before tax. So unless Kirkwood has 20% sales tax (they don't) there is something going on in the fine print of how you are charging customers. I wanted to see what the total would be if I ordered online (picture attached) and there is a "service tip" ... to me this implies it goes to your workers. Is that correct? But then you ask people to tip on a drive through...It's just all a bit confusing to me. 

Food was excellent. Ordered the spicy chicken out and added ghost pepper. Highly recommend! 

I received the wrong order, though, and had to park and go into the restaurant. (Should have checked when I was still in line!)

I'll probably go back since the food was good, just would appreciate more transparency in how you charge customers.
name: Chicken Out
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants

text: This is the type of BBQ joint that I like to check out when visiting a city.  It's super local, kinda hole-in-the-wall, but also very well curated.  Love the nod to Steve Martin.  Themed sandwiches are amazing.  Don't sleep on the poultry (which is something I don't usually say about BBQ restaurants)!  Wings, pulled chicken, and smoked turkey are some of the best items on the menu!
name: Navinâs BBQ

text: This was our first visit and our last. We ordered a two meat combo plate with brisket and burnt ends. The brisket was dry and under smoked, and the burnt ends or fatty and not pleasant to eat. The quantity of the meat for $18 was quite small compared to salt and smoke and sugar fire. And the sides or just as unimpressive. You could do a lot better for your barbecue dollar at salt and smoke and enjoy a better product for sure.
name: Navinâs BBQ

text:
I had a nice experience here.  We booked a table via OpenTable which was easy.

The vibes are relaxed and the music is loud, which I guess is the point.  It was dimly lit, and we were seated immediately.  They have an extensive bar menu with a few small plates.  We tried the "Go for your guns," "past time paradise," the suntory toki whiskey and the hendrick's gin highball.

All of the drinks were excellent.  The DJ played some cool music, and overall we had a good time.  It might not be the best place to go with a crowd, because it's hard to talk over the music, but again- the music's the whole point of coming here.
name: Takashima Record Bar

text: Super disappointed in Bobby's Place. My friends and I have been going here for YEARS. So I thought it would be the perfect place to throw a party for a friend moving back to STL. I was told I had a reserved spot, but when we got there, nothing had been reserved and we had to sit outside. I was even more disappointed that nothing was done to rectify the situation and no apology was made. Go to bobbys for a drink but don't waste your time trying to host a party there or reserve a spot. Overall, I don't think any of us will be back.
name: Bobby's Place

text: I used to love the friendly, welcoming feel of Thurman's. We stopped by at least a couple of times each week, with and without the kids. Not anymore, since the ownership changed. Yes, the place looks much nicer than it did, but the atmosphere is unwelcoming. Drinks are ok, but food is pretty much average, or below. The clientele has changed and the awesome neighborhood spot has become just... well, transparent. We don't even see it anymore on our walks in Shaw... what a loss!

text: So...here's the thing....had great hopes for this neighborhood spot. Not new, but new ownership... sadly disappointed!  Been three times.. #1 - newly opened, owner made pretense of introducing himself ... yada,yada....Time #2- super busy, took awhile for waitress to take order, apologizes...Time #3...tonight.rainy, fairly empty..get the picture?  My husband and I came in, took a seat...owner, Doug, never looked up from his perch at the end of the bar....10 minutes or so after we sat down, another couple came in. Doug, finally looked up-and surprise- went to couple who came in AFTER us! Took their drink order, came back and took their food order...then proceeded to total other patron's bar bills, not once looking in our direction...All these patrons lacking melanin in their skin...FINALLY...enough is enough...we got up and left, first calling out Doug for his obvious oversight, who claimed he did.not see us, which of course is the inherent problem ...WE WILL NEVER BE BACK and people of color...BE WARNED...go elsewhere or you will risk being blatantly and obviously ignored! Spend your green elsewhere as we did!!!
name: Thurman's in Shaw

text: We went there within the past two weeks. Nice,quiet atmosphere. Good jazz. Honestly,the food was mediocre. The extremely small street Taco's might have had a tablespoon and a half of meat and,virtually,nothing else. It would have helped to have some diced tomatoes,cilantro,cheese, & maybe a teaspoon more of meat. Sauces came in very small containers that might have held a tablespoon and half of product. Taco's were 3 something a piece. Very over priced. Tasty but not much to them. All of the Mex food needs to be elevated to equal the price. Nothing special otherwise and over priced. Very average. Good staff. Friendly. Service could be better even with 4 people in the whole place.
name: Thurman's in Shaw

text: People in Shaw love their neighborhood establishments and no disrespect to them. But if you're not buddy-buddy with the clientele going to Thurman's is kind of like going to the dog park across the street: it's a fine experience, but it's not meant for you. I've been there three times over the course of the year and live right down the street, but no one who works there has ever been particularly friendly to me or my partner. Nor is it the sort of place where you can meet new people, especially if you're not of the same race and age group. The beer selection is small, the drinks are OK, and the food is a little expensive for the quality (good wings though). If you're not meeting a Thurman's regular I suggest checking out any of the other bars in the neighborhood.
name: Thurman's in Shaw

text: A great neighborhood spot. Good beer selection with a lot of local stuff and a really awesome patio. I liked this place a lot when it had solid American style pub food. But recently they changed things up and now serve high quality, inexpensive Mexican street food and I love Thurman's even more. We're here at least once a week when the weather is nice. And the patio is a great place to hang out and drink while your kids run around. I'm usually home before the live music starts, but the jazz is supposed to be great--in fact, the place got written up in the New York Times as a music venue (no joke). Check it out!
name: Thurman's in Shaw

text:
This is a Shaw favorite! We love the atmosphere and it's a great spot to run into neighbors. The staff is always friendly and we love the specialty drinks. Jazz on Thursdays and special events are fantastic, and Thurman's is also a great place to catch local sports games -- which is what we do sometimes because we only have internet TV. My favorite drink is the Sweet Revenge mule, but everything they've suggested has been great. The food is regular bar good, but that's usually just right on a Thurman's night!

We're glad Thurman's is in Shaw. It's one more reason we love the neighborhood.
name: Thurman's in Shaw

text: The Thurman Grill has new ownership, a new name, and a completely new look. Now Thurman's in Shaw, this great neighborhood bar keeps a nice local beer selection on tap, a fantastic whiskey selection, and they've even added a fryer to the kitchen. The chicken tenders are some of the best I've had and the onion rings are spot on with a nice crunch. Pricing for food is reasonable and the portions large. The new owner keeps up Thurman's  music chops with regular blues, jazz and other music acts. It's also the most impressive sound system I've seen in a neighborhood bar. Simply stated, if you haven't been to Thurman's since their remodel and reopening, I highly recommend checking it out.
name: Thurman's in Shaw

text: 6-12 drunk, body builder golfers and their buddies owned the place. My friend and I were repeatedly bumped into while sitting at the bar. One drunk golfer nearly fell down as he spun around and fell into our chairs uttering "sorry" in a blacked-out, blank face. If our chairs were not there he would still be falling. This did not stop the bartender from serving them shots of Fireball! Mind you this was 7-9pm. They obviously were drinking on the golf course all day. CUT THEM OFF FOR EVERYONE'S SAKE ALREADY!! It was very unpleasant just sitting there as we kept getting encroached on by drunks! The last straw was when one of them started twisting my beer bottle in my bucket - right in front of me at my seat! I asked what he was doing and he said he thought it was his bucket. For God's sake it had been sitting in front of me for an hour and was a 40 ounce bottle. When I raised my voice and asked him to get away people took notice. A bouncer suggested we all separate. I had nowhere to go - I was simply sitting at the bar in my stool next to my friend. Some backed off for a while and then came an MS-13 looking tattooed Mexican. He stood with his back to me about 4 inches from my elbow and allowed me to inhale all of the smoke from his cigarette - that he was not smoking. The golfers started buying him drinks for continuing the aggressive inconsideration towards us. Bartenders began ignoring us and essentially stopped service. DO NOT GO HERE!! It is a closed group, drunks were continued to be served and the management did not protect our right to sit at the bar and mind our own business. Lots of Valley Park hoosiers to boot!
name: Bobby's Place

text:
I have been to Thurman's on Friday nights when they have free jazz and it is great. I am someone who goes to see live jazz music regularly, and trust me when I say the Kendrick Smith trio that plays there every Friday is top notch. Also, there is no cover, so it does not get any better than that. 

I've only had bottled beer here and taken a sip of the margarita. The margarita was good! They also have decent drink specials which I have taken advantage of. There is not a huge selection of beer on-tap,  just FYI.

The bar itself is located on a street corner in the middle of the neighborhood. That neighborhood-aspect makes the bar feel very cozy. I can't wait to go here in the winter! They also have a nice patio out front you can sit on with stringed lights. The reason I knocked one star off is because I wish they dimmed the lights a bit more on the inside. Obviously this is not much of an issue though at all. Definitely I recommend visiting.
name: Thurman's in Shaw

text: I don't usually write reviews but I keep thinking about a breakfast I had last week with my grandchildren at Kingside diner in Clayton. All the food was pretty good, but the service was terrible. It was a weekday at 8:00 and no one was there, apparently, including any staff. After seating ourselves, waiting about five minutes and calling out that we were there, my eight-year-old grandson asked if he should go find some menus.  It took a long time to get our food and even longer to get our check. Our money ran out in our meter, but fortunately we did not get a ticket.  Fortunately I had cash to pay the bill so I didn't have to wait for someone to run a credit card.  I chose this restaurant because I enjoyed it in the central west end.
name: Kingside Diner

text:
This bar has everything on my wishlist for a neighborhood spot:
1.) Great trivia. Tuesday nights, put on by Tenacious Trivia. The host Andi is funny and has the best music playlists.
2.) Great patio. The new shade canopy is a nice touch. Not only are dogs welcome on the patio, but the owner might come out and give them a doggie biscuit or two.
3.) Great drinks. The cappelletti spritz made my whole summer.
4.) Great food. There's awesome tacos, and now there is BRUNCH.
name: Thurman's in Shaw

text:
What a surprise! We arrived about 7, were told the band started at 8. It was mildly crowded. We ordered Drinks, some of the favs were the Moscow Mule and the House Margarita. There were a few hiccups with ordering but they smoothed that out. Band started late but when they did I looked up and it was PACCCKED! Great Jazz, drinks and Guacamole! 

A couple of warnings: the Guacamole comes in two little (side of ketchup) cups in one of those red baskets (very odd and difficult to dip your chip) and when it gets crowded the wait staff starts to harass the @$& out of you to give up your little red basket as soon as you have 10 chips left because they need them for other orders (come on guys, let's up the budget and order another stack of these). 

Great place, I'll be back!!
name: Thurman's in Shaw

text: Best tacos in St. Louis. I'm a Texas girl living in St. Louis, always searching for the best tacos in my opinion, their Carne asada tacos are particularly good. I've tried many other places' tacos, and while they've been good, I haven't craved those like I have these. Plus, they have churros!!! And some great sangria and house margaritas. My husband and I often opt for Thurman's ever since they changed up their menu with Mexican food. We are looking forward to their brunch service starting tomorrow - the menu looks great! I like the easygoing neighborhood feel of Thurman's, as well as the convenience of its location for us.
name: Thurman's in Shaw

text:
Bobby's Place is a staple in our family as it is close to where we host most events and great for a night out. 

I was just here Saturday night for a surprise birthday party for a cousin. This was arranged in advance by her spouse and Bobby's Place had a reserved area waiting for us. They also served out a variety of appetizers very quickly and there was a server checking in on our party all evening. She was attentive and quick with orders. 

Depending on when you go there is usually a live band or a DJ. We were told there wouldn't be a live band this night, but there was one - BONUS! The band was okay, but unfortunately they seemed a bit much for the small venue. The music was so loud I couldn't hear even the person next to me and that was a bit disappointing. This is not usually the case here...

Some of us had tabs at the bar - I did. The bartenders were friendly, efficient and make a great white russian! 

They also have a nice large outdoor patio - great for nice weather (not so much on Saturday). 

Note: this bar does still allow smoking inside, so if you are a smoker - this place is for you! If not, know that going in. It does not ever get "too smoky" in my opinion, but still a good to know before going.
name: Bobby's Place

text:
Found this place by accident actually. Went in for drinks on a Thursday night and realized I just walked into Bob Plager's place!! "Number 5 in your program, Number 1 in your hearts". I was ecstatic. I saw Bob there in the back, I said hi and so wanted to ask for his autograph but felt that was not appropriate. I might go back again and ask Bob for his autograph. After all, he is an icon of the STL. Blues. 

I had a nice time. The music was good. I Did not like the margaritas though. Our waitress was very friendly and kept us content. :) A band took the stage at 10pm. I was shocked to see this place rocking on a weeknight. I would say the only negative thing was the cigarette smoke. It was not over powering but for someone that does not smoke, it was taking its toll on me. But I toughed it out. I will definitely go back and try the grill next time also.
name: Bobby's Place

text:
I had a proper cheeseburger here.  Two patties, gooey cheese, nicely toasted bun.  They didn't pile a bunch of other stuff on top.  There wasn't a fancy sauce.  It cost about $8 and that's a bargain given the location.  

The patties were hard-seared on a flattop to create a little bit of crunch and caramelize the edges a bit.  The cheese was melted perfectly and even a bit stringy with each bite.  Bacon was an option but I passed.   

Fries on the side and I asked for a little bbq to use for dipping.  The fries were lightly battered and fried to a crispy, golden brown but still flaky on the inside.

The irony of this meal?  I had just ordered a grilled chicken cuban sandwich and the waitress had walked away a split second before someone delivered a cheeseburger to the next table.  I took one look at this guy's food, jumped up and caught my waitress before she entered my order so I could get the burger instead.
name: Kingside Diner

text:
Wow....I am not sure what to write here but what an experience!  A few of us met up there last night to catch up and see ADD, a great band.

First and foremost, the place is really smoky.  It is a bar so it is totally understandable.  I just mention it to you if you have issues with smoke.

Other than that, this place is priceless.  Our waitress was attentive and nice even though she had a ton of tables to manage.  The beers were cold and the mixed drinks were stiff, which is a bonus.  Personally, I do enjoy when you can actually taste the booze in a mixed drink but that is my own preference.

I cannot speak to the food but it looked like your standard bar food.

The best part of the visit was the crowd.  Boy, what a treat.  There was a guy at the bar who had a mustache drawn on his face...I couldn't make this up if I tried...

Not to mention, the Jim Beam honey liquor girls were there with a guy in a bear suit handing out free shots....  Unreal.
name: Bobby's Place

text:
Gotta love a place who gets its namesake from Bobby Plager, one of the most charismatic and beloved people to ever wear the Blue Note. 

This place gives you everything. You can get cheap, fast lunch specials guaranteed in under 15 mins as well as daily specials. They run some good drink specials as well, including cheap pitchers on Thursdays. They also feature the 40 oz Busch bottles, which I am partial to. Rotating craft beer taps were a nice touch for a bar in this area. I've eaten here a handful of times and its always tasty... steak sandwich, pizza, wings.... all very good. Its bar food, but its good bar food. They make their own wing sauce which is tangier than most. 

They do allow smoking, but theres a patio also. Lots of TVs, juke box and a few bar games such as Golden Tee... you may even see Bobby running around in there from time to time.
name: Bobby's Place

text: Great dive bar! If you love bar food, beer, and hockey, you can't go wrong. I recently stopped by this place for the first time for a St. Patty's Day meal and to watch the Sabres/Blues game. Felisha was our server and she was amazing!!! The restaurant was packed and she was the only server on at the time. We never once felt looked over or forgotten about. I've never felt so taken care of by a server before. We got a few buckets of beer and she always seemed to swing by just as we ran out to get us another one. Food was alright but we weren't expecting a 5 star meal. Overall, a great experience. I took off one star just because it is a smoking bar. As long as you're cool with that, it's a great local bar that I'm happy to support! Go Sabres!
name: Bobby's Place

text:
My husband, 2 dogs and I are from KC, had just finished trail running at Lone Elk State Park and were starving.  We drove by Bobby's Place, saw the outside patio and decided to give it a try.
They were very gracious with our dogs, let them sit outside with us and kept bringing them water.  I had a hamburger that was very tasty and my husband had the burger that consisted of two patties, two pieces of bacon and cheese between two Krispy Kreme doughnuts.  Sounds kind of disgusting, but it was delicious.  
The service was awesome - very highly recommended!!
name: Bobby's Place

text:
It is a nice clean place, I will give it that. BUT... there could be some improvement! 
1. Having your customers sit at the bar is confusing for others who would like to order. I came in one day and there were so many people sitting at the front bar space I didn't even get to order! Nobody said hello or noticed me so I just left (literally just lost some money). maybe put some chairs outside or make a backyard patio space for customers.
2. There are a lot of young black ladies who work there and that is great! But they need to smile more and greet their customers! This really makes all the difference. They are not rude but they are not friendly either. (I really want us to get out of that stereotype is all)
3. How can you afford a flat screen TV playing booty shaking videos but no logo for the cups? priorities? 
4. It is a smoothie place and you sell waist trainers??? Waist trainers almost sent me to the ER so I don't think you should be selling body modification items in a healthy smoothie store!
5. to be fair the smoothie made for me the first time I went was great, so I have no issue with the smoothies themselves. 
6. When I walk in I don't get healthy overall vibes. There's rap music playing and selling of waist trainers and CBD oil! It's just confusing!
7 I will continue to go to this establishment because I really want to support black owned anything, but we need to learn how to run these businesses professionally!
name: Healthy Habits Nutrition

text:
The name describes it: hot dogs, hamburgers, chicken tenders and wings. Salads, a loaded potato, and rice bowls round out the menu. 
It's not fast food. On a Saturday at 2pm with four customers and at least two staff I waited 25 minutes for a Chicago dog. 
In St Louis Chicago style dogs are typically a variation of the wiener Windy City residents enjoy. Saucy's rendition keeps some authentic elements but is grilled rather than steamed and not the Vienna Beef skin-on dog Chicago vendors purvey. Still, the overstuffed sandwich is filling.  
All dogs come with fries--a chewy style with a salty, somewhat cheesy seasoning. Staff couldn't tell me what the seasoning was other than "a lot of different spices." 
Several frankfurter meals mimic traditional versions with twists. 
New Yorkers will recognize sauerkraut with their dog but be surprised by Thousand Island dressing, queso, and green onion toppings. 
Chili dogs include Fritos and sour cream. A Missouri dog nods to St Louis with toppings of toasted ravioli, marinara sauce and--perplexingly--queso. The New York City Pizza Dog also has queso plus marinara sauce. 
Some menu items are downright odd. A vegetarian hot dog? Yep. The Veggie Dog is fried tofu, pico de gallo, and spicy raspberry sauce on a bun. 
Hamburger varieties follow some of the hot dog options, including the Mac & Cheese Burger and the Two Faced Burger (spicy raspberry sauce, cheddar cheese, BBQ sauce, and jalapeÃ±os). 
Wings, tenders, and salads keep to more traditional recipes. 
Soft drinks are canned or bottled from a cooler. 
The spartan interior is decorated with repurposed church pews for booths.
Staff were friendly and helpful, and apologized for the delay in delivering my meal.
name: Saucy Dogs-Burgers-Tenders
categories: Burgers, Chicken Wings, Hot Dogs, Restaurants

text: Overall it was a great experience. Only thing negative I have to say is a little cold inside.
name: Bobby's Place

text:
Thurman's got a face lift! And let me tell you, it was some much needed plastic surgery. Old Thurman's was fine but it was a dive bar without the prices and terrible food. 

I finally got to check it out since it reopened as Thurman's "in Shaw." I didn't try the food but the ambiance and beverage selection is everything you need in a neighborhood bar. They have a great draft selection with a decent group of beer and wine. The have an industrial pipe shelving bar with some pipe light fixtures along the wall. It's imitate but casual. 

The service felt better and overall just a great upgrade. I'll be back for sure.
name: Thurman's in Shaw

text: Bobby's Place is GREAT!  There are very few smoking bars left and one can even enjoy a cigar.  The waitresses/bartender are the BEST!!  Always fast and very friendly service. The ppl who complained about the smoke should not go, or not complain.  There are plenty of non-smoking restaurants around, so go there and DON'T complain.  My husband and I love the place and frequent often.

text: Just got my togo order and I was given a Caribbean Dog instead of the Philly Cheesesteak Dog. The Caribbean Dog supposed to have  pineapple habanero, cilantro aioli and queso cheese. First off, when I see habanero, I would think spicy but there is no spiciness at all. The hot dog is not bad but I was thrown off by the sweetness of the pineapple. I don't even think I tasted queso cheese. The hot dog meat is more like a beef sausage. The bun is not your typical hot dog buns. It's a French Hoagies roll.  I'm not a huge fan of hot dog but wanted to try them out since they were newly opened. It's a huge disappointment that I didn't get to try the Philly Cheesesteak Dog. All the hot dog are served with regular fries. They don't only serve hot dogs. They have salad, wings and etc..

Only downside was the volume of Affliction t-shirt wearing Jersey shore wannabes.  They do allow smoking but I don't mind, it's a bar.  The business should have a photo of the waitresses.

text:
My wife and I moved to Shaw at the end of June.  Since then Thurman's has basically been closed the whole time as it has transitioned ownership.  Last night, we decided to walk to the corner of Thurman and Shenandoah (downtown Shaw) for dinner with our 10 month old baby. 

We've been following the announcements on social media as the new Thurman's has added to its menu.  First it was just the drinks.  Then came salads.  Now, they offer burgers, fries, chicken sandwiches, chili, and many entree salads.

When we arrived, we planned to sit outside on the patio where there are long communal tables. The only problem was there were smokers, so with the baby we headed inside.  The music playing was all jazz and MoTown. We grabbed a high top table. I went to the bar to order drinks, a glass of cabernet for her and a local IPA for me. All the draft selections were from local craft breweries: Urban Chestnut, Civil Life, Four Hands, O'Fallon, Schlafly, and Griesedieck's.  In bottles were macro swill and a fascinating list of Belgian beers, including a Flander's Red sour.  The selection isn't a long list yet, but I'm very impressed so far.

We both had cheese burgers with a basket of fries to share.  My wife also had the caesar salad.  All the food was tasty and right on bar for a neighborhood bar.  The burgers were simple and juicy without pretension.

We're very excited to have a new food option down the block. I'm sure we'll be regulars at Thurman's.
name: Thurman's in Shaw

text: This was my first time trying out this place while visiting STL and I love it. I got the Banana Caramel Smoothie (Vegan), and the loaded Oatmeal with Pecans, banana and blueberries added and they both were sooooo good! My uncle tried some and loved it too. I will definitely be back to get some more when I come back to town. Great taste and healthy, good combination.
name: Healthy Habits Nutrition

Extremely disappointed in my experience and would not recommend this location.

text:
We went here to watch the STL Blues game. The atmosphere is laid back and our server was great! She was busy but she still stayed on top of all her tables and was very nice and kind. They had $2.5 domestic cans and $0.60 boneless wings during the game. Their signature wing sauce is a good mix between hot and a little bit of sweet. I would definitelyrecommend trying their wing sauce. 
I didn't know it was smoking and I don't prefer that but overall its a good place to watch the game at if you don't mind the smoke.
name: Bobby's Place

text: Walked in and was immediately turned off.  People were smoking all around.  Disgusting.  The food, not impressed. I ordered the steak sandwich and side salad.  Salad was the best part. I had wanted a vinaigrette dressing, but apparently that's too classy for this place.  They only had 3 different salad dressings, so I was forced to pick  ranch.  The only flavor on the sandwich was the horseradish.  The meat was bland, bland, bland.  The "server" had no idea how to wait tables.  There were 4 people at our table.  Took her 2 trips to bring 4 drinks.  Took her 3 trips to bring everyone's order.  At the end of the meal I asked the "server" for a box for the other 1/2 of my sandwich.  Even though it wasn't the best I never let food go to waste.  Sit there a while talking and waiting and this dumb little girl basically asked us if we were leaving. I glared at her and said I'm waiting for the box that I requested.  Maybe if this place spent more time hiring wait staff with talent and a brain instead of who looks good in a bra and mini skirt, they might actually be crowded on a Sat night.  If the line hadn't been so long at Sugarfire, would have dined there.  Save your money and time.  This dive is not worth it!
name: Bobby's Place

text:
Brought my partner for her bday dinner this evening and had a wonderful time! 

I must say, I'm equally shocked and not surprised by negative reviews surrounding covid protocols. Some people are just determined to be unhappy. And since you can't say it, I'll say it for you: "The customer is NOT always right".  From one industry professional to another, don't the haters get you down. Karma's a bitch 

Back to our experience: we were greeted by two, a trainee with a shadow. I believe they introduced themselves as "M.L." Or maybe... Em Elle? Anyway, they were wonderful. And the shadow trainer was present but did not enter the conversation unless needed, creating a good boost of confidence for the trainee. Both had great recommendations on cocktails, apps, pizza, entrees and wine. We felt very welcome. 

To start off we both got a Black Manhattan, it was so smooth. The booze sort of snuck up on us. (Not to insinuate it wasn't boozy, we felt it ). On the servers' recommendation we moved on to the Calimari. OMFG - wow. Never had a Calimari without a dipping sauce before, but it did not need it, giardiniera  was fried in with it and it was bursting with complimentary flavors. 

For entrees, bday lady got the eggplant parm and we split a pizza. She said the texture was a little weird for her, but the flavor was awesome. Neither of us are red-meat eaters, so we got the sausage-ricotta-giardiniera pizza, minus the sausage. We also splurged on a side of the house made hot honey. It was upscale flavor town, like guy fieri in a tux. seriously tho, it was yum. 

The ambiance was totally our cup of tea. I mean, drinking manhattans while our four year old is safe at home with grandma while listening to beastie boys and biggie smalls and eating bomb-ass pizza.... you had us at Beastie Boys. 

We'll be back.
name: O+O Pizza

text: I am a regular here as it is close to my house and love this bar! However when it gets busy do not expect great service, it takes about 15-20 mins for someone to come check up on you so we normally have to go hunt them down which doesnt bug us for people who are new that are with us it makes them pretty mad. Also if you are in a big group keep an eye on your tab/ bank account. My card normally gets run twice when I come for some reason. The food is great though and the happy hr has really good specials! Also a good place to go on friday for ladies night ($2 wines, wells, and domestics) and wednesday for $1 well night!
name: Bobby's Place

text:
Please don't order to-go here. It goes as such:
Place order, show up 30 min later. 
Stand at to-go counter for 25 minutes without being greeted. At minute 55, they'll ask who you are, then 15 minutes later they'll ask who you are again, then they'll make the food after serving a few customers that walk in after you. You'll be lucky to get out in an hour and a half.

text:
I enjoyed a wonderful meal here a few weeks ago. The food was on point!!! I thoroughly enjoyed the love that was put into every dish. The scallop special was the best bite of food I've had in months. 

The pasta did not disappoint. I had the Lobster Rigatoni, which sang notes of lobster and tomato harmony. Not going to lie, I bargained for a few bites of the other pastas on the table, and the Lamb Corzetti was Stellar. I cant wait to come back and eat a whole order(or two). 

This is everything I love about a great restaurant. Attentive/knowledgeable service, a comfortable environment, and incredible food!

text:
I can't, in good, conscience, recommend it.

Full disclosure, I did have a bit of a drive, so things weren't completely fresh by the time we got home. The fries, when fresh, were great - no complaints there.

But the wings I had were inedible. They were tough and tasted bad - and it wasn't a result of the drive home. They weren't cold, the quality was just below par.

The strips were better, by comparison, but I still wouldn't go back for them.

Side note, does not reflect the review: Their buffalo sauce has mustard in it, which is fairly common in the Saint Louis area. I'm not a fan. I ended up getting the garlic parm, and although that didn't save them, it was better than the alternative.

The people were nice, so I feel terrible about giving a negative review. But the food was not good.
name: Saucy Dogs-Burgers-Tenders
categories: Burgers, Chicken Wings, Hot Dogs, Restaurants

text:
I wish I could give this place negative stars. 
The bouncers scrutinized the bf's ID but couldn't care less about mine. Service was terrible, it's like the girl had too many shots behind the bar. We ordered two mixed drinks plus a pitcher of Budweiser, the server had to come back to ask if we wanted a pitcher or bucket, and what of. Then she charged us for a bucket and gave us Bud Light. The mixed drinks tasted like fruit punch and orange juice, I really don't believe there was any booze in the drinks.  There was so much smoke in the joint that I think I might have cancer already. The band was agonizingly loud and did a terrible job on their covers. Don't go. Please. For me, don't go to this bar.
name: Bobby's Place

text: I have been here twice for carry out and so far so good.  We call and it is always ready in 20 minutes for pick up with the correct order.  This is quintessential comfort food at it's best. The Mac N Cheese Burger was fantastic! To me, the mac n cheese has a tiny hint of curry which adds just the right amount of interest to the flavor. If you don't care for curry, don't worry. The creaminess will win you over.  The Gyro dishes are very good as well. Generous portions, good prices, and high quality seem to be the norm.  I am not a fan of fast food and Saucy Dog is so much better than any fast food. When we have been in the staff is wearing masks (thank you for protecting me) and the service was just fine.
name: Saucy Dogs-Burgers-Tenders
categories: Burgers, Chicken Wings, Hot Dogs, Restaurants

text: Place is straight fire, flamin hotdog, burger, and fries all amazing!! The Steak philly smacks and comes in at 6.99 with fries a Danm steal.  The boneless wings deal is amazing, not your everyday frozen generic wing. Food to price ratio best deals in town
name: Saucy Dogs-Burgers-Tenders
categories: Burgers, Chicken Wings, Hot Dogs, Restaurants

text: I give this place 5 stars the hotdog was delicious and plentiful with the fries. I had the Chicago style hotdog and even tried the chicken tenders and those were awesome also. All smiles over here and will definitely be a repeat customer.
name: Saucy Dogs-Burgers-Tenders
categories: Burgers, Chicken Wings, Hot Dogs, Restaurants

text: You get a ton of great tasting food for cheap! Ordering online was a breeze and the food was ready right on time.
name: Saucy Dogs-Burgers-Tenders
categories: Burgers, Chicken Wings, Hot Dogs, Restaurants

text:
I got one of the smoothie bowls, banana caramel was my base flavor. It's a large bowl and I can tell you it's very filling. 
I hadn't eaten all day when I decided to stop and try out Healthy Habits, so I was pleasantly surprised at how satisfied I was after finishing my bowl. It's topped with fresh fruits and nuts of your choice. 
Due to COVID-19, they're only doing curbside pickup or delivery right now. Everyone wore masks and gloves and focused on keeping the clients and workers safe. 
Timing was a bit slow, but my bowl was worth it! I'll definitely frequent this little health food spot more often.
name: Healthy Habits Nutrition

text: Really loved the ambiance and the food. The pizza is unique but very good. All the appetizers and drinks were excellent as well. I appreciate them trying to be safe, but it was kind of a turn off to have to continually take masks on and off. Seems like that's more unhealthy than minimizing the amount you handle the mask. Also, while I do not blame our serve (she was very sweet), the idea of "announcing" her approach to the table was a bit overkill. Again, I appreciate them being safe, but feel like they could make things feel more normal as many other restaurants have done. Regardless, I will be back for the food and drinks.
name: O+O Pizza

text: One of my lunch hang outs. Great atmosphere, and great waitresses. They have a very inexpensive strip steak special on Tuesday's. Lot's of TV's to catch up on all the sports action. I normally get the strip steak along with a salad and mac and cheese. It's not a Tuckers steak by any means, but it's half the price. I also will get the pasta con broccoli but it depends on the cook. One of them loves to put cayenne pepper (I think I spelled that right) on it and you pay for it later in the day. All and all a great lunch spot! Oh, and it's a smoker friendly restaurant.

text:
Four star bar, but I'm removing a star because it's a smoking bar. I don't like the smell of cigarettes. It's a blue collar crowd. 

Cool place. Bobby's is a sports bar that focuses on hockey. However, if you come here to watch a game, grab a table. The bar is in the center of the room, but the TV's are spread along the perimeter of the restaurant. You don't have a good view of a TV if you sit at the bar.

Great happy hour specials. I went here on a Friday and from 4:00-8:00, they had $2 domestic drafts and 1/2 price appetizers. Bobby's has pub grub, but their menu is broader than a lot of sports bars. The server recommended burgers, wings and catfish nuggets. I ordered a cheeseburger and tater tots. The burger was good; the tots were great! I can see where the catfish nuggets would be good since they bread their food by hand.

The server was a sweetheart. She was patient with my many questions. I wish she could have been quicker to check on my table, but it was a busy Friday night and she was covering most of the bar. She did a good job under the circumstances. The bartenders and servers at Bobby's are all female and they are cute.
name: Bobby's Place

attributes.Ambience: {u'divey': False, u'hipster': False, u'casual': False, u'touristy': False, u'trendy': False, u'intimate': False, u'romantic': False, u'classy': True, u'upscale': False}

categories: Bars, Pizza, Nightlife, Restaurants, Italian

text:
We decided to O+O Pizza a try since we are fans of Olive & Oak. We went during the week to avoid what we thought would be crowds. We ordered the handmade toasted ravioli which we extremely tasty and I would stack up against any handmade ravioli on the Hill. Next we split the Caesar salad with hot croutons and I would stay that this was great as well. Lastly we decided on a pizza since this is (should be) their specialty since it's in their name, we were extremely DISPOINTED in this. We found this supposedly New Haven style pizza to be terrible, the pizza crust was soggy especially in the middle. I am not sure if they have not fine-tuned their recipe or need a better pizza oven or are afraid of a little charred crust, but they need to work on cooking the pie all the way through and need to perfect this if they want to keep "Pizza" in the name.

The drinks as at Olive & Oak were excellent. I did feel that the wine by the glass was overpriced for the tiny pour they give you.
If I go back, I would stay away from the pizza and stick with some of the pasta dishes instead.

My review is solely based on the above and did not factor in anything I mention below, which would have lowered it even further.

Okay we have dined at several restaurants in past three months since we are trying to support as many businesses as possible, but this place was a first with regard to COVID precautions. They require customers to put their mask on each time a waitress or any employee approaches you table. I understand the need to be careful, but this is overkill and very annoying for the table, stopping in mid bite to put your mask on or just constantly trying to pay attention to what the employees are doing in case they come near your table is not a relaxing night out. As customers, we all understand the risk associated with dining out and if we are in your restaurant we are comfortable with that risk. If you as a restaurant or your employees are fearful then; 1) DO Not OPEN, 2) Do not come to work if you are an employee, or 3) Protect you staff further with either face shields or even have them put on fully biohazard suits (this is overkill, but so is putting mask on and off 20 times during a night out).
name: O+O Pizza

attributes.Ambience: {u'divey': False, u'hipster': False, u'casual': False, u'touristy': False, u'trendy': False, u'intimate': False, u'romantic': False, u'classy': True, u'upscale': False}

categories: Bars, Pizza, Nightlife, Restaurants, Italian

text:
We stopped in for drinks only at O+O Pizza last night to celebrate our daughter's 21st birthday, and had ML and Kyle take outstanding care of us! The cocktail menu is amazing, and ML and Kyle are talented and welcoming. They even made a tasty non-alcoholic concoction for our 17 year old. I never noticed O+O has non-alcoholic mixed drinks on the menu. Brilliant! And all four of our drinks were as beautiful as they were tasty. Thanks for making the end of our celebration special!

While I'm reviewing, we've dined in and ordered curbside from O+O several times in the last year. The food at O+O Pizza is absolutely DELICIOUS! The eggplant parmesan is to die for - thinly sliced pieces of eggplant stacked instead of one thick slice elevates the dish. (I'm sure there's a lot more to what makes it so darn good than just the way they slice it.) Every time we go in or order curbside from O+O, I almost always get the eggplant parm, but you honestly can't go wrong with anything you order. Some other of my top picks are the lobster rigatoni and the shaved brussel sprout salad.
name: O+O Pizza

text: I really hate to give a bad review but I want to be honest and give my opinion on our experience. We ate here for the first time based on many positive reviews we read, but after eating our meal, we will not be back. We ordered 3 meals and all came with fries. To start, each order of fries were more on the soggy, Luke warm end. None were crispy or hot. They are also marketed as seasoned fries, but sadly the seasoning was not mixed together very well and just a ton of seasoning was on a few pieces in each batch. I got the crispy fish sandwich and it was very undercooked. I took a bite or two and noticed and decided it would be best not to finish. My boyfriend got a hot dog and said it was just okay. The catfish nuggets we got we were not a fan of either. The menu also specified we get fries and coleslaw with the catfish nugget meal but we just realized we didn't get any nor did they mention they were out. It began to get incredibly crowded so I didn't want to cause a scene and mention to the employees about my undercooked food or ask for a refund. I just chalked it up to a lesson learned and not to return. Of course, try for yourself as everyone's experience is different!
name: Saucy Dogs-Burgers-Tenders
categories: Burgers, Chicken Wings, Hot Dogs, Restaurants

text: It's the same location and interior from the original O+O. Except you get bomb ass pizza and Italian speciality dishes. What's not to love. Everything hot and fresh from the kitchen. Great bread from Union Loafers. Same great cocktail program and speciality beer. Its a winner!!!!

text:
BEWARE! Ordered via Doordash. Tenders are COATED in sauce. It is not a sauce on the side. The picture does not show sauced tenders and there is no option for 'no sauce' so it never crossed my mind that they would be coated. And I understand not to expect much from delivery fries but these are sub-par even for delivery fries.

Edit: Just took a bite of the mac n cheese. Are you freaking kidding me? Canned nacho cheese sauce???? Recommend running away from this place.

2nd edit: I took one bite of chicken, one bite of fries, and one bite of mac N cheese.  Fifteen minutes later I can still taste the gross.  These people have probably ruined my entire afternoon.

text:
Just a warning for those who have an aversion to cigarette smoke: avoid this place like the plague. Nothing memorable in terms of food. I found the burgers to be just okay. The only thing that stood out to me here was there fried pickles which are cut very thinly and then battered. As for the pizzas, they are very thin and bland.

Overall, the menu is very limited (mainly pizzas and burgers, but what can you expect? It's a bar). Bobby's doesn't distinguish itself from other bars although it is located in a nice area. There are the typical game slot machines near the entrance of the building and a few tv's scattered throughout. If you're looking for a place to socialize and drink beer, this place will do. Cheers!
name: Bobby's Place

text:
We made reservations for Clover and the Bee, but they're currently only seating people in the sister restaurant called O+O pizza. 

The ambience: the floral motifs on walls, quiet environment, makes it a good place to have a long chat with friends. They're extremely strict with their COVID policy, you have to wear a mask every time the server approaches your table ( upto 10 times, to take orders for drinks/ apps, check on us, serve dishes, settle the bill etc). I respect that. I did not mind wearing and removing my mask in the middle of my meal that often, too much, but if it can kill your buzz, this is not the place for you. After a couple of drinks, it can get a little irritating for some folks.

The drinks: The torino sour: Decent, I'd give it a 7/10. Can't go wrong with gin and lemon.
Spiced pear sangria: oh my goodness! This warm cup filled me up. The only hot alcoholic drink I've had before, has been a hot toddy or cider. This was a pleasant surprise. It's hot and sour with a hint of pear. 
There was a mocktail with turmeric and ginger,the name is slipping from my mind, but it was the most unique flavorful drink I've ever had!

Fried gnocchi: The mix of the crunch and soft center is pleasing, it's a light appetizer which pairs well with our drinks.

Rigatoni: Yummy! This warm creamy pasta was split for the two of us, and the portion was more than enough. The sauce is seasoned well, the Rigatoni melts in your mouth, and the small pieces of lobster make the whole dish smell and taste absolutely divine!

Margherita pizza: This was so underwhelming :(. It was too salty, the texture of the thin crust was hard, there was barely any cheese. We couldnt bear to have more than half a slice. The only reason why I'm deducting a star for the review. 

My friends had the halibut with Cesar salad, which they really enjoyed as well. 

We topped everything off with the famous Clover and Bee Tiramisu. This is definitely one of the best Tiramisu you can find in St. Louis. Makes you forget how terrible the pizza was, and makes my decision to give the place 3 stars, 4 instead.
name: O+O Pizza

text:
Got O&O for V-day carryout because we wanted a less expensive and easier to transport meal than Olive & Oak.

We started with the meatballs and the gnocchi apps. Holy smokes, the gnocchi was the best thing we ate.  Served with pork belly in a rosemary cider cream sauce, I could have most likely eaten this as my entree.  Gnocchi was pillowy and whole dish was stellar and complex.  The polenta and ragu that was served with the meatballs was also tasty but I felt that the meatball texture was off, a big spongy, too tightly packed.

The Caesar salad was tasty though the croutons were more like large pieces of crispy bread.  Tasted great but were challenging to eat as a part of the salad.

While it's O&O Pizza, we didn't actually get pizza...  For entrees we tried the lobster rigatoni and the agnolotti.  The rigatoni was a surprise favorite.  My husband was suspect of lobster in his pasta, but upon tasting it, we both agreed it was a fantastic dish.  The calabrian chilies added a bit of spice that cut the richness from the cream sauce. There was also a surprisingly hefty portion of lobster, yay!  The agnolotti was a miss.  The pasta was great but the garlic butter sauce and the sun-dried tomatoes added zero flavor.  I would like to see this pasta preparation revamped.  Slap some of that rosemary cider cream on them! 

All in all, good price for the quality of the food, easy ordering app and curbside pick-up. Would definitely try again, especially for the gnocchi!
name: O+O Pizza

text:
Exactly what you'd hope for when deciding to eat out.
We had 9 adults & kids combined and our total was $110 without tip & without drinks, so as you can imagine out order was huge. I was worried it would take a long time and that our order would be messed up, as most places have a hard time with larger orders. But to my surprise, the entire order came out,  packed and ready within 15 minutes (I was stunned). They packed up extra sauces, napkins, silverware, everything I could ever need for my huge family. They were so nice that the cashier actually helped me carry all of this to my car! The hospitality and kindness of the cashier was astonishing, plus she was very confident we'd love her food, which honestly hyped me up about it! Long story short: the food is amazing (I got the Italian beef and it's the best I've had in a really long time, but the philly & Caribbean fries were mouth watering ), and the staff is amazing. The building is clean & well kept, so we definitely will be back!
name: Saucy Dogs-Burgers-Tenders
categories: Burgers, Chicken Wings, Hot Dogs, Restaurants

text:
Food was very good! The cheesesteak was just the right amount. It was heavily seasoned, covered in cheese/sauce, and put between a soft hoagie roll. Fried okra was good/as expected and came with an aioli dipping sauce. I wasn't sure what to expect for the chicken and beef bowl since the description didn't mention flavor/seasoning. Turns out it's a middle eastern type cuisine I think. The meat was cooked tender and seasoned, the rice was yellow and seasoned (maybe saffron or turmeric, cinnamon, and cumin maybe, not sure) All very tasty and delicious. The fries were the most surprising for me because they were seasoned and a bit sweet and they paired well with the salty cheesesteak to help balance things out. 

The man who took my order on the phone was very nice and the order was ready in 15 minutes. When I arrived he was very friendly and thanked me when he found out this was my first time trying the food. 

Price: 5/5
Food: 5/5
Service: 5/5
name: Saucy Dogs-Burgers-Tenders
categories: Burgers, Chicken Wings, Hot Dogs, Restaurants

categories: Bars, Pizza, Nightlife, Restaurants, Italian

text:
Made reservations a week out because we couldn't get into Olive + Oak on such short notice and figured we'd give this a shot.

We started with the arancini and Caesar salad, which were great.  The arancini in particular was the best I've ever had.

For dinner we had the lobster rigatoni and the OG pepperoni pizza.  Both were absolutely amazing.  My wife asked how spicy the rigatoni was before ordering, and they volunteered to make it less spicy.  It was a great service touch, and wasn't too spicy for her lightweight self at all.

The pizza had a good deal of spice which was more in my wheelhouse.  The crust was very thin and light, and the toppings were insanely tasty.  The mozzarella blend they used made me never want to go back to regular pizza cheese again.

As great as the food was, the drinks were also top notch.  We tried the Sing to Me Paulo, Poison Apple and Can't Wake Up, and all were wonderful cocktails.

This has definitely made it into our restaurant rotation!
name: O+O Pizza

text: My first time trying Healthy Habits Nutrition was Wednesday evening; although most places require entry if a face mask is worn, HHN only allowed curbside pick up which is totally fine "SAFETY FIRST". The employee who greeted me at the door was very rude & treated me as if I was a frequent customer when I told her this is my first time trying HHN. Moving along, I received my smoothie & it was delicious I was very satisfied. Now it's Friday & I wanted to try their fruit bowls because I heard it's the best thing they sell. Giving that I had a horrible first visit on Wednesday, I wanted to give them the benefit of the doubt because they may have had a busy long day and I really wanted to support a local Black business especially during the pandemic where a lot of Black businesses are closing. I get to HHN around 4pm and sat in the parking lot while calling to order. The employee who answered the phone was very rude and condescending AFTER I told her this is my first time trying your fruit bowls and I wanted to know which specific bowl to order, she tells me the bowls are pre-made and that she only have smalls left and proceeds to hang up on me. I'm literally watching her do this as I'm in the parking lot trying to order. So then I get on yelp to view their  menu so I can be well prepared. I call again less than 10 minutes, as I'm in the parking lot and tell her my order and then she tells me that she's backed up on orders and it'll take 40 minutes before she can make my bowl. After that I had enough! I really tried to support this business but it sucks when the customer service overshadows the product. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME AT HEALTHY HABITS NUTRITION! TAKE YOUR MONEY ELSEWHERE!!!!!! SMOOTHIE KING WILL NEVER!!!!!
name: Healthy Habits Nutrition
