text: I've been to O+O Pizza twice to have dinner with my family. As the only vegan in the family, I have a very very hard time finding options, ordering food, and receiving the right order. There simply aren't any options. The first time I went, I asked if they had vegan cheese and was told they "haven't figured out how to melt vegan cheese". There are over a handful of restaurants that do pizza with vegan cheese. The second time I went to O+O it was a disaster. I ordered the Chopped Salad without some ingredients, no cheese, and a different dressing. I made sure our waitress was aware I was vegan. She was extremely understanding and confirmed that the dressing would be changed after checking with the kitchen. However, I got my salad with shredded cheese and the original dressing. After asking for it to be changed, I got lettuce with lentils and the same dressing. I want to emphasize that the customer service was good, but the communication with the kitchen or something was just awful. Overall, the experience is simply frustrating and makes me want to convince my family to go anywhere but to O+O Pizza.
name: O+O Pizza

text:
10 starts for O + O Pizza!

1. Be sure to make reservations online before arriving!  They are offering indoor and patio dining right now.

2. The staff were all amazing!  Our server was kind, polite, funny, and very well informed about the menu.

3.  Extensive cocktail menu including craft cocktails, craft beer (bottled, canned, draft), and wines.  

4.  FOOD WAS AMAZING!  Olive + Oak did it again!  We started with the fried gnocchi, best starter I've ever ordered.  We then decided to share a chopped and Cesar salad.  The kitchen staff split the salads for us, so that our  plate had 1/2 of each.  Such a great touch!  Then we shared the classic pepperoni pizza....warning, it does have a bit of a kick, but was well worth it!  Came out out hot, crisp, and delicious!

Highly recommend trying this new spot out!
name: O+O Pizza

text:
Thurman's is a Shaw staple. Stag on tap, an excellent beer selection, and plenty of whiskey--this bar is great for watching sports, listening to jazz, playing trivia (Tuesdays, depending on Covid situation), or just for a nightcap before turning in. Chill and classy, with lots of indoor and outdoor seating. 

They're between menus currently and renovating the kitchen, but stay tuned for good food!

text: Hungry on a Tuesday night, we stopped by for a bite to eat. Perfect bar-like setting. Great service from our waitress. I ordered a "fruity martini"- no drink menu. We also ordered the crab Rangoon appetizer and a steak sandwich. The drink was perfect, not too sweet, not to strong. More carb Rangoon on my plate (7) than most places serve. I was very upset when my husband ate the last one when I wasn't looking. He really enjoyed the fries and the steak of course. Lots of TVs with everything imaginable playing. Huge patio. They even had corn hole games in the parking lot as we were leaving. My only complaint was the smoky smell. When we attempted to escape that issue on the patio, it was worse. That's what patios are for though. We sat in a booth on the far side of the room without any issues. Our waitress informed us they just put out a new menu. Wish they had a dessert menu.
name: Bobby's Place

text: We had dinner with friends at O+O Pizza.  The service was wonderful!  However, they should be ashamed to even put pizza in their name.  If you liked Chef Boyaredee Pizza growing up, then you'll relive great memories.  The pizza did not have enough sauce and hardly any mozzarella cheese.  There was plenty of almost powdered Parmesan, so much that you could feel the texture of it on your tongue.  All the salads are $15 and way too much for even two people.  Why not offer a dinner sized salad?  One person in our party said the toasted ravioli was delicious, and the small plate of gnocchi was very good.  The best part of our meal was the wine and the bread.  This restaurant needs to take some lessons from The Salvage Yard on Hampton--one of the best pizzas in St. Louis!
name: O+O Pizza

text:
COVID WARNING - During my visit, only the cashier WAS wearing a mask; however, the kitchen staff (mostly obscured by two small room dividers) was not. One woman walked out front from the kitchen and didn't even have a mask on, let alone on her face. I was able to catch a glance at the cook, and he was also not wearing a mask as he prepared orders.

The food here was good; service was somewhat slow; however, the food was prepared to order, which is understandable. The interior is no-frills, and due to COVID, we got our order to go and decided to eat in the car. I like to think that this place has potential as they are a dead ringer for Dog N Frys, which used to be a favorite stop before closing last year.

text: Warning: Do not bring  your own dessert to O + O pizza because you will be charged a $2 cutting fee per person even though the wait staff did nothing and we left zero dessert trash. What a joke!  We had delicious cocktails, apps, salad and pizza on the patio to celebrate my friends birthday. She opened up a few gifts from us and then I pulled out individual bundt cakes. As we were enjoying the desserts, an employee(not our waitress) told us we would be charged a $2 per person cake cutting fee. The staff did nothing to help us with our dessert, we were never offered dessert, nor did we leave any remnants of our dessert on the table. The staff could of handled this very differently but what he did was screw his waitress out of $6 in tips. Please be upfront in the future, put the fee on your menu, approach your customers sooner with this charge. I am not sure if I will come back or not because I'm pretty bitter right now. Sorry O + O pizza you were a big disappointment in your customer service tonight.

categories: Desserts, Restaurants, Diners, Food, Sandwiches, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Tried a new brunch place in the Saint Louis suburb of Clayton on a Sunday morning. There are two locations that are approximately 1.5 mile apart. 

Parking is off street or nearby parking garage. I elected for off street and the area was clean. I will note for whatever reason GPS gets confused finding the address. It's in an office building with restaurant on first floor. 

The restaurant is good size with a bar counter. Windows are along an entire side, so it bright and has a modern feel. Everything felt spic and span clean! 

My party arrived at approximately 9 AM to put the name down for 930 arrival. We were offered a private room. When everyone arrived shortly before 930 we were quickly greeted by the hostess and led to our room. Our waitress arrived within a few minutes and set up water crafts, coffee and napkins. 

In short time our hungry party put in orders. I believe everyone got something different. My order Country Fried steak with gravy, two eggs over easy with potatoes and toast. I really enjoyed. 

Approximately 20 minutes later food was on the table and timing was correct for everyone at the same time. My dish was very good. The coffee was excellent! Everyone else also really enjoyed. Service my our single female waitress was outstanding with follow up on food, refills on water and coffee. Price for the amount and quality about right. 

I think a 4.5 best suits them. There was no service errors. Our timing of being seated and food arrival was above average. The food taste was above average although not what I would call 5 star. Locating the diner was annoying, but not their fault. I will return next visit.
name: Kingside Diner

categories: Desserts, Restaurants, Diners, Food, Sandwiches, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Kingside Diner is not your typical diner. It is an upscale diner, that serves delicious comfort food for both breakfast and lunch on the edge of downtown Clayton. It has a full service bar and they make one killer Spicy Bloody Mary that is always a go to for me. 

On my first visit I intended to order their, Slinger after seeing chef Eric preparing on TV. Come on, The Slinger is a St Louis classic breakfast, why wouldn't I give it a try? Then as I sat at the bar, I saw the pictures posted of their Damn Delicious and thought I'd give it a try. The server also shared with me that the DD was chef Eric's favorite. 

As I got ready to order, my attention went in another direction. I saw another picture posted here on Yelp of the Veggie Hash. I love Brussels Sprouts, so I was sold. I enjoyed a full plate of fresh, crisp sprouts covered with two eggs over easy. Delicious! I couldn't be totally healthy, I had to add a side of bacon and Hash Browns. 

My next visit I choose, Damn Delicious. The DD is very filling, it is a lot of food. They take two scrambled eggs with bacon and put it between a sliced croissant. They then smother that with sausage gravy, shredded cheddar and chives. If that isn't enough, it is served with a side of Hash Browns. I was so stuffed, I skipped lunch that day. 

I'll share a little secret with you, I prefer the Clayton location over the CWE. The service here is more personal and friendly. Veronica is a delight, excellent server. I also think the food is prepared and presented better.

Note - the address is on Bonhomme Ave, but you actually enter the restaurant on Brentwood. 

I'll be back? - Yes! Gotta try that Slinger

When: June 6 & 13, 2019
Why: Breakfast
name: Kingside Diner

text:
I have no idea how this place has 5 Stars rating! 
This has been by far the WORST place I've been ever. The service, quality and drinks were mediocre at best.    Let's start with the drinks/quality control.   The yogurt bowl was giving to us with Saran Wrap covering the bowl and in a paper bag  â  What could possibly go wrong with that right!?  The blended coffee had chunks of grains still in it, which made the drink "undrinkable."  If it's a To Go order, you would normally tell the customer which drink is which, since they are all in identical white styrofoam cups.  You should provide straws for your orders, or at least let the customer know where the straws are located.  

Furthermore, we ordered online and arrived 15 min later.  The lady behind the counter hadn't even started in our order (place was empty) so is not like she was busy.  She was annoyed that we were there so quickly.  Not only did she move at the pace of a snail, but she also had a full on personal conversation on the phone, cursing left and right wanting to know "who the fuck is talking all that shit".    Seriously lady!!?  No no no!!!  Totally Unprofessional.   DO NOT go to this place

text: Atmosphere was nice and relaxing. Enjoyed my cocktail. There were some unique cocktail choices to try. The arancini was fantastic. The chopped salad was great. My husband got the caesar and it was just ok. We shared the OG pepperoni pizza and loved it. Pepperoni was perfectly crisp and it had just the right amount of spice. A little heat, but not spicy. Pizza was reasonably priced, but some of the entrees did seem a little steep, so something to consider if your budget is tight. Service was friendly. Overall a great meal and we would come back.

categories: Bars, Pizza, Nightlife, Restaurants, Italian

text:
Don't let the name fool you--O+O Pizza offers so much more! I'm not downplaying the pizza at all; it's delicious. But take a look at other menu items. 

The Starters menu has some similar items to Olive + Oak. The Octopus Corzetti is amazing. Tender pieces of octopus served over thick pasta slices is decadent. The red wine and tomato lend a great deal of flavor.

At my last visit I tried the Seared Scallops. These are an amazing summer dish. The scallops were seared to perfection and served over a corn puree with tomatoes and micro greens. So yummy!

The beverage menu is also outstanding. From house created cocktails to an approachable wine list, there is something for everyone--including NA spritzs. 

Bottom line O+O Pizza is a great family friendly restaurant with top quality food and service.
name: O+O Pizza

text:
We moved to the area a little over a year ago and always drove by this place. It is constantly full of cars and curious about it. 

We tried it one day and has a good old town feel and people are always friendly and girls at the bar always take care of you. Very Spacious. We have our group over and it accommodates us all. 

Food is a solid 5 star here. We have gone and seems like they always have a happy hour(more like hours) and specials. 

I recommend their wings (breaded or unbreaded). I always get the spicy garlic ones. I recommend highly. 
Cheddar Balls 
Crab Ragoon Eggrolls are yummy
Irish Fries (tator tots with cheese and sour cream)

I have heard their pizza and burgers are good, but never had them.

The reasons I give this a 4 stars is that yes (As everyone says) it is a smoking bar. And it is very smoky. I can handle it for an hour or so, but anymore it is a bit much. I got spoiled with smoke free bars.

They do offer take out (and honor their happy hour specials) so if I don't have a sitter for my son, we get take out.
name: Bobby's Place

text:
I don't quite know how this location has a 4 star average... It's not the worst Schnucks location I have been to, but it's definitely not the best or even second best.

This store is older... And due to its age it doesn't feel as clean. The lighting isn't very bright either. The lock one of the doors at night (this location is not 24 hours) I believe for safety reasons, which I think says a lot.

There used to be this turnstile you'd have to go through to get inside which kind of made me feel like I was being treated like cattle. Like they thought I was going to steal before they even let me inside. That changed a year or two ago (probably two years). 

They don't carry all the products of the nicer Schnucks. For instance, no Fitz's and no decent sushi (they have sushi, but none I would ever trust).

The cashiers aren't as friendly or nice.

And the store has a weird layout. It changed semi-recently, so it's better than how it was... But still.

The deli is also not nearly as great.

My fave Schnucks (though it's not the nicest of them all) is Webster Groves and I routinely drive there for grocery shopping to avoid this location.

Not as bad as shady Schnucks on South grand, but not good.
name: Schnucks - Arsenal

text:
I've only used the service once. The stated price for delivery was very reasonable ($14 plus tip). However, they didn't deliver any of the frozen items so they had to send out another driver (which means another tip and waiting at my house for eight hours). Also, the substitutions were not reasonable IMO. E.g., they substituted an inferior brand (for the same price) for one product, substituted creamy peanut butter for crunchy peanut butter, etc. Some of the items I ordered were unavailable. No one called to see whether I still wanted delivery despite the warehouse not having several of the items I'd ordered. So what I thought was going to be a modest delivery charge for a fairly large ordered ended up being a fairly large delivery charge for a much smaller order, especially when you consider the amount of groceries I'll need to take back from this order. 

Part of this was my mistake in allowing substitutions but that is partly because the default on the order form is to allow substitutions. So whenever I went back to the product page to get information, it was reset to allow substitutions. I said no substitutions for most of the items but I did allow it for some. Further, they don't let you specify whether a specific type of substitution (e.g., brand, flavor) is ok, it's a global yes or no. Based on my experience, I'd strongly advise to not allow substitutions. (However, then you'll need to assume that a fairly high percentage of your order won't be delivered at all. Your choice: bad substitutions or no product.)

I thought that this would be like my local Schucks store, which IME almost always has the items I"m looking for. If they are out of an item, they often allow a good - excellent substitution or give a raincheck. Unfortunately, a far higher percentage of items that I ordered from Schnucks Express were unavailable. (That's not counting the several ad items that weren't even available for ordering on their website.)  I'd guess that almost 25% of my order was not available (and so either nothing or a bad substitute was delivered). If my local grocery store's stock were as depleted as Schnucks Express, I'd change grocery stores ASAP. Plus, you don't get a raincheck when Schnucks Express is out of a sale item. 

They need to have the website update in real time so that you know what products you'll be getting. Also, it would be very helpful to have a button that let you select no substituions for the whole order. They need much better communication with the customer as well. 

Bottom Line: If you don't mind waiting at home for 8 hours for about 3/4 of the groceries you ordered, this is probably a good service for you. It's cheap (if you don't have to pay for more than one driver due to Schnucks Express Connection's mistakes) and (if they don't mess up your order) reasonably quick.  If you order by 7 PM, they will deliver (to your house or your local Schnucks, depending on where you live) the next day.

I'm going to try this service one more time. If my experience is significantly different, I'll update the review.
name: Schnucks - Arsenal

text:
I've been telling myself that I'm going to start meal prepping and bringing my lunch to work for months, so when I heard about Jillian's Fit Flavors, I decided to admit to myself that I was not going to do that and check Fit Flavors out instead. My boyfriend and I visited the Brentwood location on Sunday, 2/15. The staff was very friendly, helpful, and unpretentious (which is important to me for a health-oriented business because that's not always the case). We bought 7 things to try, planning to take them for lunch a few days this week. Well, it's Wednesday and we have already eaten them because we've been making them for lunches and dinners. All of the options we've tried have been delicious - and so healthy. 

One other thing I'll mention is that I'm not the hugest meat fan in general, and the thought of days old reheated meat kind of grosses me out. However, all of the meats have been very well-seasoned and moist, even reheated. I thought the meat may be a problem for me, but it's not at all.

While the ~$10 per lunch price point is more than I might spend prepping my own meals, we all know I'll never actually prep my own meals and it's much cheaper and healthier than eating out for lunch every day. Also, they have a free rewards program where you get $5 off every $100 (or some variation of that)... basically 5% off. Regular Sunday stops at Fit Foods may be my "meal prep" plan from now on - highly recommend!
name: Fit-Flavors
categories: Food, Dietitians, Health Markets, Fast Food, Vegetarian, Health & Medical, Restaurants, Event Planning & Services, Caterers, Fruits & Veggies, Specialty Food, Nutritionists, Food Delivery Services, Gluten-Free

text: The only reason I'm not doing a one star is because the sandwich was decent... We just moved to the area and found Bellacino's on Yelp. When we got there last night, the workers didn't acknowledge we were there, which whatever......but then when we walked up to order, the girl was super weird. My husband asked her "if you were coming here for the first time, would you try the Italian or the steak sandwich?" She just blanked stared at us and kept shrugging her shoulders. It was weird. The other 2 employees there were also silent. They didn't look up at you and it was just a very awkward atmosphere. Ok so there's that. THEN we sat down at a table and waited 45 minutes for our food. FORTY FIVE minutes... for ONE sandwich and some fries. Granted several people had ordered after us.. there was only 1 person who had ordered ahead of us. The fries were disgusting - and I never use that word about fries (most fries are good, even if they aren't the best). They were burned and there were only a few in a basket, see pic. Needless to say, we will not be coming back. Not even because of the wait or the burnt fries...(the sandwich was pretty good)... but because customer service was terrible.
name: Bellacino's Pizza & Grinders

text:
Went to Dierberg's yesterday after almost exclusively going to Schnucks mostly for location and convenience reasons.  We were amazed the price difference, Schnucks is way cheaper wiuth the same quality products.  This Schnucks "on the hill" features a ton of Italian cookies, cheeses, pasta, pasta sauce, etc from bakeries and restaurants on the hill as well as somethings imported directly from Italy.  

It may not have the same variety that Dierberg's has in terms of natural ingredient, gluten free, or organic products, but they have been making progress in this realm as well.  

The store is always clean and the employees are very friendly.  The manager even ordered me a special kind of alcohol that they didn't carry.  They have a better than average wine selection.

The fresh made sandwich's are always a favorite at gatherings with our family.

text:
I went in to the store today on my way to work.  I love this Schnucks as it is very close to my home.  Usually the experience is wonderful. In and out quickly with great service. 

Today was a different story.  Apparently the management has given up on trying to train its cashiers and baggers to be friendly and attentive.  As I was waiting in line the cashier Patti was deep into her own conversation with the bag boy about some police case she was aware of.  She went into detail about autopsies and case points while haphazardly checking out her customers. (Apparently Sherlock Holmes is her great grandfather or something.)

It was finally my turn. As I stepped forward I got not one glance and a diffident "Hi" that let me know I was definitley interrupting her very important conversation with the bag boy. Not once did she look up or at my groceries as she carried on with her conversation. (lucky I didnt have eggs or this would have been a disaster.) She did not tell me the price of my purchase after she was through.  I went ahead and used my debit card and entered my pin. Then I waited.  And waited. And waited some more for her to realize my part of the transaction was through.  with an annoyed face she completed her side of the transaction.  All the while still in deep convo with the bagboy. She handed me my reciept with not a word or glance.

I had had enough.  I stood there waiting for her to realize that her line was not moving. As she angrily looked at me I gave her the standard Schucks "Thank you, Have a nice day."  She repeated the phrase to me in what can only be described as deep and hatefilled sarcasm.  

I don't think the cashiers realize the danger that lurks just a few aisles over in the form of do it yourself check out lanes.  I usually don't like going to those because I enjoy the personal touch of a good and competent human cashier.  However if service like this continues I would suggest to the manager of this store that he or she get rid of the under trained and incompetent cashiers and just fill the check out area with do it yourself aisles.
name: Schnucks - Arsenal

text:
This Schnucks is our city store of choice. It's a typical Schnucks that's probably 25 years since its last refresh. That's fine, whatever. The reason to go here is for the Italian food. Yes, there are better markets on The Hill, but they all close at 5:30 or some ridiculous hour. This Schnucks has most of your favorites, including wonderful bread from several bakeries, along with a nice olive bar and more.

Yays:
- Italian specialties!
- Good produce selection, with some rarer things like chestnuts and other Italian favorites
- Never, ever, ever crowded like Loughborough or Lindell stores are. I think people forget this one exists.
- Standard Schnucks pricing and service, so it's okay.
- Pretty decent beer selection
- It's a smaller store than lots of others, which is good and bad.

Nays:
- Gigantor parking lot that never gets used. Seriously, Schnuck family, why not put something else in, or make it street facing, or something?
- It hasn't been remodeled in forever. 
- It's a smaller store than lots of others, which is good and bad.
name: Schnucks - Arsenal

text:
Schnucks Express Connection is a fee based grocery delivery service offered by Schnucks.  I love the convenience of this service.  Especially when I need to order bulk heavy items or if I'm having a party and I need lots of ice, soda, beer, etc.  It's also handy if you are sick, weather is bad, etc.

Orders are placed online and groceries are categorized by aisle on their website https://www.schnucks.com/express/.  You can search for individual items, save favorites for future orders, review sale items and review previous orders.
  
I've checked out some of the other grocery delivery services in the area and this one seems to be the most reasonable, by far.  The fee generally ranges from $10-$15, plus tip for the driver. So, it's best to wait until you have lots to order, since the price doesn't fluctuate with the size of the order. You choose a store from their list that is closest to your home and you will know what the standard fee is before placing your order. It costs a bit more for same day delivery.
name: Schnucks - Arsenal

text:
This is my favorite Schnucks.  It's not the closest to me, and it's not the absolute nicest, but it's pretty close, and it's pretty nice, so that's why it's my favorite.

The produce selection is very good (better than most in the City) and I really like the Italian section.  The little Companion corner, tucked away at the end of the Italian section, is my absolute favorite spot in the whole store.  I love their Bavarian pretzels, the multigrain sandwich bread and other awesome baked goods.  

Overall, this store is well stocked and well staffed, parking is ample and well lit, and come Girl Scout Cookie season (i.e. now), you can usually find a local troop selling cookies on the weekend.

text:
Schnucks markets have been my choice of grocery shopping since I moved to the city over 25 years ago, and this location used to be "out of the way" for me but I still chose to shop here because I was happy with the service and the quality of the store.

This location has been "My Schnucks" for about 17 years now, I know the aisles, the departments and the layout of the store. the employees here are very courteous, and they take pride in their departments and their jobs. The store hasn't been upgrade in a few years and could use some touch ups, but it still doesn't deter me from returning simply because of the level satisfaction I get  when I walk out of that store.

It's nice to be able to go in to a store, find what I need and exit in a short time without the hassle of having to walk up and down aimlessly looking for the correct aisle, for the needed item.  it's nice to say hi to the workers by name and be answered back in the same friendly way.  This will always be "MY" Schnucks...
name: Schnucks - Arsenal

text:
This has been my neighborhood and go-to Schnucks forever. It doesn't matter if it was out of the way or another place was closer I always would end up at this one for all of my grocery needs.  

I also like how they haven't really changed too much as far as where things are over the years.  I can still walk in and find whatever I need much like I could 5-6 years ago.  They have also improved their Deli to be more Culinaria-esque. You'll find me here on 10 for 10 gatorade sale days also. I have to say sometimes those 10 for 10 deals are what bring me in.

The one thing that really makes this Schnucks stand out over other locations is that it is on the Hill and probably carries the most local products from Hill businesses here.  On the down side, this causes patrons to graze basically...and very slowly.  When I shop, I have my list which is usually in the same order I need to find things and I can be done in 10-15 minutes, if no one else was in the store.  At least the checkout is always fast and friendly and I really do like the self-checkout (just wish I didn't have to wait for verification when I buy booze through it).  

Either way, I know I'll be back whenever I need to go shopping again.
name: Schnucks - Arsenal

text:
I like my local Schnucks. I usually get an amazing parking spot! That alone is enough to make me frequent it (and that it's the closest location to me). It's not the most updated of locations (in terms of decor and possibly selection), but I love the little "Italian Hill" section near the Deli. 

I've encountered some very friendly employees here. 

But every once and awhile I've gotten a checker that says "Can you take your items out of the basket, please?" (While not smiling) 

Really? When did that become the rule? A checker at the Schnucks in Crestwood laughed when I told them checkers have made me do that before. And Target has scanned things directly from the basket. 

Maybe it's a social faux pas that I'm ignorant of, heck I don't know- but now I always comply for fear of getting reprimanded.

Sheesh, I kindof feel like I'm in grade school.
name: Schnucks - Arsenal

text:
Ok...I thought I had found the best sandwich ever...I thought a veggie sub was just a veggie sub....oh no...not the case...

This is a hot veggie sub...and it's AMAZING.  I am not kidding, I have never had anything so delicious between two pieces of bread.  The sandwich was hot, the veggies were crisp and roasted, the cheese was melted to perfection, the bread was amazing....I loved everything about it.  All you need is a half sandwich, which will run just under $5 and will fill you up plenty.  Seriously, this place is just amazing.  You must try it.  

They also sell pizza and salads and an array of other foods, but I have yet to steer away from the veggie sub.  It's nothing short of amazing and totally worth trying.  Thank God they put one of these by my house....I will be gaining weight accordingly...
name: Bellacino's Pizza & Grinders

text: Sometimes cheap food is just that. There's nothing great about it and it borders on tasteless. This was that case here. The special was a pork steak, which was burnt and then tossed in a pot of sauce for easy serving. The sides, which were also the special, we're canned, not baked, beans and corn. The beans tasted like a cheap version of Bush's, but less flavor and the corn was definitely straight from the generic can and dumped in a pot to warm. The service was not as good in the past as well. If you don't mind AB beers, crooked tables that you have to steady between bites, and asking for drinks you'll be happy. If you're looking for a decent, clean and fresh atmosphere go somewhere else. This place is turning into a hole in the wall if it hasn't already and that's not a good thing in this case.

text:
Not my usual Schnucks, but we were shopping on The Hill and thought what The Hell why not. 

I will say this, FACE-LIFT! This store in is serious need of an upgrade and remodel. It just felt and looked very dated. We found most of what we needed, found it odd that a grocer near The Hill did not have fresh basil in stock. 

It is extremely clean, to the point of scrubby dutch clean and spacious. Spacious to the point of they have a lot of wasted space that could be utilized to increase those sales $'s per square foot. 

The staff here is crazy. They just seem to be having way to much fun at work. Cracking jokes, bantering with customers and each other. That is a work energy I can respect. I think we may have had the same employee who helped Christine with her whipped cream in a can. Either that, they all have dirty little minds. Didn't there use to be a hospital on Arsenal for crazies? 

My new list  "Parking Lot Derby" was created after shopping here. Why you ask? There was a young man driving around the parking lot talking on his cell phone. To be more honest, he was zig zagging from one side to the other, with no regard to traffic flow or parking spaces. As we were leaving, it took both of us to keep track of  him so we could leave the parking lot safely. 

As we exited on to Arsenal,  thinking we were in the clear here comes Mr. Zig-Zag out of the other entrance cutting in front of us. Yes, still on his cell phone. Brad looked behind us and saw him pull back into the parking lot. Guess he was practicing driving while talking. Trust me, he should park and talk.
name: Schnucks - Arsenal

text:
Making fried chicken stand out is usually a challenge,  but they delivered!  The chicken was extremely juicey and flavorful,  and you get very large portions for the price that is paid.  Two in our party enjoyed the chicken and we are still talking about it.   Someone else had the ribeye sandwich which was cooked perfectly and a huge portion. 

My only critique of this experience would be the outrageously loud, drunks that were sitting at the bar.  Since this is a small place it makes it difficult to carry on a conversation.   The staff did great trying to get the drunks to keep it down.  

The other patrons in the bar were definitely regulars,  that were all eating dinner,  this is usually a great sign that the food is great.  

Great food...Great Sides...Casual atmosphere...a place to try if your in the area.
name: Fergie's Bar & Restaurant

text:
I stopped in at this easily overlooked bar on the recommendation of a friend & local patron. The best fried chicken she said, & "You can't go wrong with any food you get there "she said. "Big pieces of chicken & 2 Sides for 8.95$".  I couldn't start my diet without 1st trying this place, fried chicken is one of my top favorite foods ,I've tried it in every state. everything my friend said is true, The chicken , 4 huge pieces , fried to perfection, steaming hot, juicy, very flavorful & fresh!! I just wished they had a little honey for my dipping pleasure:). It is on the salty side for those who have a issue with that:) The home cooked sides are delicious, I had mashed potatoes & macaroni , comes w rolls. it's not a huge place, so it can get loud, but plenty of tables & I was glad too see that. Check it out if your wanting a seriously tasty hot meal & cold drink;) 
mmm Chicken

text:
Two words: Parmesan Sticks. These are not cheese sticks but bread sticks covered/drowning in Parmesan sprinkled cheese. 
I ADORE these bread sticks. I do not get it with tomato sauce though, I get it with the buttermilk ranch dressing to dip them in. YUMFEST!

Their sandwiches are oven baked and are very good.
They even have low fat sandwiches that have low fat cheese on them!
The pizzas are good and do not use provel cheese, 100% mozzarella.
The interior is clean and casual. 
Absolutely worth going for a lunch, call ahead, or a very casual dinner.
name: Bellacino's Pizza & Grinders

text:
This location is slowly winning me over as a regular and it is doing it at good pace. 
I stop here on my way home from work, so I do not need to pass my house and visit the one at Hampton Village. I'm thinking in the future, instead of going to HV from home, I'll head over here to Arsenal. 

I'm still not comfortable with the lay out of this store, but I can learn a new floor plan. 
The vegetable and fruit department is smaller, but the selection seems to be fresher. 
I rarely buy my meat from Schnucks, but the butcher counter here is as good as any other location. I also, like the fact that they periodically offer samples. I have never seen samples being passed out at Hampton Village. 

What truly sets this location above other locations, is that the staff still practices Schnucks old motto, "the friendliest stores in town".  They by far have the best customer service skills of "any" grocery store I have shopped in the Lou. Having this, makes it worth the drive of a couple extra blocks. 

Another side note making it worth to shop, it has some of the best eye candy in town. 
Whatever catches your eye,  you'll see some hottie's in the store.
name: Schnucks - Arsenal

text:
This nondescript little dive bar & grill is something you are likely to drive right past if you aren't looking for it.  But that's part of the charm here at Fergie's.

It's a local spot but not in an exclusive way.  The staff will make you feel welcome regardless of if you are one of the regulars or new to the joint.

The menu is what one might expect: burgers, wings, sandwiches, fried food, with one exception.  Fergie's has a Brain sandwich.  That deserves it's own line.

Fergie's has a Brain sandwich.  Calf's brain.

A little research shows me that that was once a common thing here in St Louis but has all but disappeared from the food landscape.  It's alive and well at Fergie's and reportedly pretty good.  (I didn't try it but am resolved to go back and do so)

We had an assortment of things when we went there: Hot & Tangy Wings, French Dip, Turkey Club, Cheeseburger, Fried Cod.  Everyone liked their food.  Nobody loved it.  And I think that's probably what you can expect here on most occasions.

Fergie's isn't reinventing the wheel.  They are just making typical pub fare in typical fashion.  The service is great. The divey atmosphere is lovely if that's your kind of thing.  The food is good enough.  And they have a brain sandwich.  Isn't that reason enough to check it out?
name: Fergie's Bar & Restaurant

text:
OH MY GOD YOU GUYS THEY HAVE SANDWICHES ALMOST AS LONG AS MY ARM

So....maybe there are better places downtown (Planet Sub is p. good~) or in the Loop, but otherwise Bellacino's is my favorite sub place in St. Louis. Their pizza is pretty good (I haven't had the salad in literal years, but I remember it being like salad under this inch-thick layer of cheese under some grilled chicken), but their grinders -- 16in long toasted sandwiches with thick bread and fresh veggies -- are the main attraction.

And they're really, really good! Fresh veggies and fillings and such, meats and cheese that don't taste like GUMMINT PROCESSED MEAT AND OR CHEESE PRODUCT that you get in 25lb boxes or whatever, and light menu offerings that don't taste blah (and while the light section is a little small, they'll use fat-free cheese/mayo on other subs if you ask~)...

Friendly staff and clean restrooms also a plus. But yeah! Go here, get your astonishingly large sandwichin' on. (Pssst, the Bayou, Italian, and Chicken Light are really tasty.)
name: Bellacino's Pizza & Grinders

text:
When I go out to eat, I don't really think about picking a sub place but I did a dare and stopped by and I wasn't let down.

They have lunch specials galore and there's going to be something you will want off the menu.  They will not combine coupons with specials, so keep that in mind if you're an avid coupon user.

My hubby got one of their hot sandwiches while I got the pizza/salad combo.  It was just the right size and both came out fresh and hot.

Pretty clean area, staff was nice and ready to help.

Great place to stop by if you're in the mood for something different, fast and not bad for you.

text:
Debi Sugarman

Cannot say enough about this food and Company and staff!! The BEST to all!!

I started eating these meals in February, 2016 after I moved here from Texas. 
Since I really don't like to cook..these meals were the answer to my food God!!!!!! :o)) Even my family knew I was in Fit-Flavors heaven!!!!!

From April, 2016..I started to use these meals pretty much on a full time basis. I still make some of my own breakfasts...yet would rather have some of their yummy meals!!! The best part about all these meals (other than the great taste!)...they have all the nutritional information on each container. How much easier can that get??? 
I've always been into fitness and nutrition. However...Fit-Flavors just made things so much better. I lost weight and felt great! I still wanted to know more about how to fit these foods in with an even better nutritional plan.

About a month ago, I attended a free Cooler Chat session with the Dietitian, Allison Leskow. The topic was MyFitnessPal. Since I've used MyFitnessPal in the past..I wanted to get more information about how to better use it. 
Allison was great! She was very informative and as so nice! I was then curious about having these foods and using this device. She said that she can help set up a nutrition program incorporating the Fit-Flavors food. That was my main focus...so I set up some sessions with her. Allison set up my program using calories, as opposed to my previous programs with the breakdowns of macros. Yet with these foods...that information is already there...and it is so much easier to just do calories.

My results were almost immediate and it's only gotten better!! It has been sooooo easy to stay focused and on track with MyFitnessPal!!! I'll also set up a few meals ahead and then I don't even have to think about what to eat other than look at the device to see what is planned for each meal and snack. And the body knows when it's time to eat!!!! Trust me!!!!!!

I can honestly say that at the age of 66...this is the best I have ever looked or felt! My clothes fit amazing and I'm at the lowest size and weight I have been in a very long time and it is due to the right amount of calories for my body. And...I will not be on that yo-yo track anymore. This is a great way of life!
And....eating these pre-made Fit-Flavors foods has been one the best things to make this journey so successful. And the snacks can be some of those "forbidden" foods...yet...when tracked...they fit right in with the plan. Even if I go out to dinner...it's still easy to track food with the device...so ya never have to be away from your plan.

I cannot go on any further without saying...Allison is the reason for helping me get to this fantastic place in my life!!! She is the Best!!!!
Yes....I am the one to do the work. However..she is the one who gave me the correct tools and direction!
I just love her and appreciate how much she cares about her clients! And no matter how many clients she has...you and your success are very important to her.
I would encourage anyone who wants to make changes and have true success..to contact Allison!! It has been the best decision I have made in a very long time!!
name: Fit-Flavors

text:
Since moving to STL, I've lived in three different neighborhoods. With a change of neighborhood comes a change of grocery stores. Out of all the Schnucks locations I've frequented, this is by far my favorite. It's not as fancy as the Ladue Crossing location, but the product selection is more than adequate, the store is clean and secure, and there is a great selection of Italian goods. 

I've always been able to find what I need here. The meat and seafood counters have a good selection. They have a larger variety of fresh baked breads than most Schnucks. The deli counter does not have Boar's Head meats, so you'll have to go elsewhere if you are looking for them. 

I do enjoy going to the shops on the Hill, but this Schnucks is a good alternative. You don't have to worry about parking, the prices are far more reasonable, and you can finish all of your shopping in one trip.

Between the olive bar, specialty italian cheeses, and friendly cashiers, this Schnucks location has won me over. The fact that it is a 5-8 min. walk away only makes it better.
name: Schnucks - Arsenal

text:
I live closer to the Grand Schnucks, but I prefer this location.  It isn't usually as crowded and the produce seems fresher to me.  I also like the little Italian section.  But I have a few problems with it.

They recently stopped carrying stuff that I buy regularly.  Where are the Skippy peanut butter, Planter's honey roasted peanuts, and hamburger in 2lb packages?  And for a while they weren't carrying the snack size Edy's real fruit bars that I like, but I did see them again on my last trip.  I really wish they carried Haagen Dazs tropical fruit sorbet like the Schnucks in Columbia, MO.

Also, the cashiers and baggers are friendly but sometimes are too friendly with each other, carrying on a whole conversation with each other and not paying attention to the fact that a can of soup should not be thrown on top of a bunch of bananas.  I even tried to put the things on the conveyor belt in an order that would be good for bagging.  It didn't work.  Although, a trick that I learned recently after getting quite tired of the inattentive bagging is to use the reusable bags.  (I have some I got elsewhere and purchased a few from Schnucks when they were on sale.)  The baggers pay more attention to bagging when you use those bags.  They also tend to pack them until they're full, which I also like because it means fewer bags to carrying in the house.

And, while it isn't as crowded, it can be just as tedious when the little old ladies come out.  I have no idea what was going on, but when I went a few weeks ago there were old ladies everywhere, standing in the middle of the aisles and not hearing me when I said excuse me to try to walk around them.
name: Schnucks - Arsenal

Today I stopped in to check this place out, after my mom told me about it.  The owner greeted us as we walked in. She was extremely friendly and informative. Since it was my first time in, she gave me a menu and a run down on all the food. 
The selection is huge! I can't wait to try more. I picked Spiced Rubbed Chicken Breast (with veggies) and the Asian Slaw. They were delicious. I even accidentally heated my chicken twice but it was still amazing :)
Unfortunately, I'm only here visiting (which is another reason this place is amazing and helpful, while traveling) but I'll be stopping in to pick up more meals.
The employee that rang me up was also very nice and helpful with my questions. 
I highly recommend going in and trying a few meals.

text:
Bellacino's is great we have been going to this location for about 9 months now , our order is always perfect, the food is great , have not had anything from here I didn't like , the pizza is like no other in St. Louis. 
I personally love the sweet chili wings , The Meat eater  pizza is also my favorite. The kids love the boneless chicken nuggets. The triple decker Grinder is also one of my favorites. If you haven't been here you definitely should try it , We haven't ordered from a different pizza place since we discovered Bellacino's Pizza & Grinders.
name: Bellacino's Pizza & Grinders

text:
Love to go here for the fried chicken dinner. The best place  for fried chicken this side of River Des Pere! 
Other reviewer commented on it being smoky. Well, they are smoke free now so don't let that scare you away.
They have a large "regular " crowd that fills in game nights to watch the games and drink cold beers. So if you want dinner try a different night. If you want beer and sports TV, any night it cant be beat.

text:
Avoid Deli  Under cooked Rotisserie Chicken, I HAD TO SAW OFF THE CHICKEN LEG with a serrated knife . and undercooked Fish . I got salmonella poisoning from undercooked chicken. At the Arsenal Street location.
One of their employees at the Arsenal location , said he got sick eating undercooked fish the week prior. Another thing I have noticed in the evenings, they do not change out the hot food , just serve the old crusty nasty-looking food that's left to whatever sucker walks up. Till It's Gone . 
When I go to Whole Foods, I noticed they pull off all the old food that's been sitting all day at 4:00 pm, replace with fresh food on Hot bar. When I called the corporate office , the man their stated his last rotisserie chicken, he had to use a serrated knife and saw off the leg, you can't pull it off with your hand. Give me a break , how many chickens have you eaten that were roasted, that you couldn't pull off a leg with your hand. Also I noticed the little plastic price sign on each of the items in the cold bar at the deli with greasy fingerprints on the little plastic signs flipped over laying in the food. Some spoon handles laying in the food. After talking to a few people at the church. I find they stop eating in the deli because of subpar food. The management don't seem to give a hoot. I will not be eating there again. It's bad enough their prices are very high compared to Walmart or any other grocery chain.
name: Schnucks - Arsenal

text: Always a great place to go for an excellent fried chicken dinner and cold pitchers of beers. They have burgers, wings and pizza for those that are looking for more typical bar foods. The place is nothing to look at but it is a pretty good sports bar for whatever games are on. It does get loud and I think that the cooler behind the bar needs to be replaced because it adds to the noise but it's all part of the charm.  Enjoy.

text:
I have been shopping at schnucks for over 30 years and seen them grow and have enjoyed the  Arsenal location, But now that they have  bought up and closed most other Choices of Grocery stores in the city things have slowly changed, the Meat selection and  Quality has went to hell they sell mostly Low grade fatty cuts of all there Beef, prices have been going up and  Quality Down, Down, Down...
The shelfs of basic Grocery items have less choices to choose from a higher Quantitee of their name brand has went up and most of it is very low Quality for example you cant even buy Del Monty's whole Green beans any more it's the little things, that make a big Difference when shopping, also please look at Expiration dates, I have picked up more Expired date items in the last year it's Uncomfortable several times in the meat department, the service has went way down there are a few older employees that have been there for years and I have a lot of  Respect for and are great !! but I have seen I don't give a Dam attitudes throughout the entire store they don't care about rotating the stock properly just lazy employees in most of the departments some of the freezer stockers work there but off and in the fresh produce department are great will go out of there way to help you or just a nice attitude when you see them work.
it is what it is judge for yourself.
name: Schnucks - Arsenal

text:
I have been trying to live a healthier lifestyle with healthy food choices and Fit Flavors has really helped me with that. With my busy lifestyle and three kids, I don't always have the time to cook healthy meals for the whole week. With Fit Flavors I can just grab my food and go and not even have to worry if I am making healthy food choices or not. Did I mention the food tastes great too! Yesterday I had Peanut Chicken of Asian Slaw and it was to die for!

Not only do I love the food, but it is always such pleasant experience going into their store. Their employees are so friendly and helpful. I recommend Fit Flavors for anyone with a busy healthy lifestyle.

text:
I've been to 3 other Schnucks (Lindell, Grand, Hampton Village) since moving to the city and this one beats them all. I can always count on this store having meat beyond ground beef and having fresh vegetables in stock. Those aren't high standards but those are all the ones I really have anymore since Schnucks doesn't seem to think city residents want nice stores. 

Beyond my hate of Schnucks upper management's handling of STL, this store really is nice. It's similar to the quality of store I had in North O'Fallon, MO which means it's a little aged but has workers always stocking and checking people out. I love that there are all sorts of local treats here from the Hill like meats from Salume Beddu, cheeses, pasta sauces, dressings, and pizza. 

I have been approached in this parking lot by the car dent scammers that seem to live at the grocery stores and gas stations in the city. I was annoyed that the cart guy saw me being blocked in by the scammer and ran away once he heard me yelling without reporting it to the security guard or management. I had to take that step even though he was clearly aware that I was a lady alone at dusk being trapped in my parking spot. Luckily the team inside were very helpful once aware and I haven't had a problem since. I've encountered the same crew at other locations in the city so this isn't so much a Schnucks problem as a criminal problem. I just want to get my zucchini and tomatoes in peace!

4 stars is because I'm in the city, I want good Schnucks stores, and this one should be a model on how the others could improve. If I was in the burbs I'd knock them down a star but beggars can't be choosers.
name: Schnucks - Arsenal

text:
This store is outdated and in serious need of a remodel, but it by far has the best customer service of any Schnucks I have ever shopped. The staff here still lives up to the old Schnucks motto, "The Friendliest Stores In Town". Every employee from the shelf stockers and the produce men to the cashiers and the baggers make sure your shopping experience is a good one. Seriously, this store should be used to train new hires in customer service. 

Even though I am shopping here more, I still get confused in the aisle layout. That is where the stockers come in handy, they are always there to guide me to the correct aisle. The produce staff has gone the extra mile going to back and searched for items that were sold out on the floor. Once I am done cruising the aisles for my food and reach the check out, I am greeted by a friendly cashier who actually chats while they scan. The baggers even say more then, "paper or plastic" and actually know how to separate and bag items. 

I also like the fact that they always have a sufficient amount of staffed check out counters open. I hate using those self checkouts, I want to  protect another persons job.  As I said in 2012, this location also has some great eye candy that makes the shopping for groceries enjoyable. If they'd remodel this store, it would be the bomb.
name: Schnucks - Arsenal

text: So it's safe to say I'm OBSESSED. I have started living off of these for breakfast, lunch, and dinner when possible. Everything is extremely well made and they do not skimp on the ingredient quality. They have a rewards program when you buy in a store. So far I've earned two free meals, one from a referral and another from rewards. My favorite meals are Peanut Chicken over Asian Slaw, Farmers Breakfast, Chicken Verde Enchiladas, and Balsamic Chicken and Zoodles. For snacks I love the Snickerdoodle Peanut Butter Balls, Coffee Cake, and the Chocolate Raspberry Muffins. Everyone in store is extremely helpful and nice and seem to be very excited about their job which really makes things even better. I will be going there for as long as I can, it's such a great way to eat healthy but also feel full and pleased with what you ate.
name: Fit-Flavors

text: Very upset with Fergie's! Actually I'm pissed!! We bring grandpa dinner every Monday. We drive from St. Charles and Grandpa lives right across the street so we thought Fergie's was a good fast take out option. Went there a couple weeks ago and the service was great, took my order over the phone, food took 15 minutes longer then expected, had a crying baby in the car, but no big deal. I still tipped $4-$5 on a $20 tab for a to go order that took 30 minutes. We moved on and the food was good so planned on coming back. Called this evening to ask the soup of the day. Not an option grandpa would enjoy so I said I'd call back. Called back less than 5 minutes later and went to voicemail. Called again and went to voicemail. That's complete bullshit! I planned on spending $40 worth of food and tripping $8 to bag up my damn food. Well, screw you Fergie's, you lost my business forever! Your shits nothing to rave about so more your loss than mine.
name: Fergie's Bar & Restaurant

text: I have been searching for a new breakfast spot ever since the famous St. Louis staple goody goody close down. I think I have found it with Freddy Gs. The interior Decour has nice warm colors and  very spacious. On site they have mask and also hand sanitizer just in case anyone walks in without a mask on during Covid times. When I arrived to the restaurant it was not very busy but soon start to pick up. I will admit it did take them a while to make the food but I was very much satisfied when my food came out. The chicken was cooked to perfection the waffles soft decadent. By far one of the best chicken and waffles in the city since goody goody. It is very much worth your time if you have a minute to wait for the food. The only reason this and I get five stars is because I don't think the restaurant is finished with his interior design.
name: Freddie G's Chicken And Waffle

text: While having a full remodel of the only bathroom in my house I have been without a place to regularly poop. While grocery shopping I decided to kill a second bird with my stone and take advantage of the facilities. Imagine my surprise when I walked in a stall almost half the size of the room. Look at the size of this stall. It is so luxurious. I truly feel like a king when pooping in a stall that is roughly the size of a double wide trailer. I'll come to this Schnucks sometimes twice a day to handle business. Don't be surprised when the work on my bathroom is completely and I'm still coming through walking funny and leaving feeling relaxed and docile.
name: Schnucks - Arsenal

text:
I am slowly transitioning over to this Schnucks from the one on Hampton. Why? Customer service. The staff here is so much friendlier and professional. This location also seems to always have enough cashiers working, so the lines are not insanely long. 

It has taken me awhile to adapt to the different lay-out. I'm now favoring the shorter aisles, that are cut in half with a center aisle dividing them in the middle of the store. Which means more end-caps to display those sale items and implies items we should all avoid. 

I'm finding the same fresh produce,  quality meats and regular grocery items that I need and want. The frozen foods section is laid out and organized much better.  Plus, with the superior customer service, it is a no brainer to shop here over my previous favorite. 

Hope they get a remodel soon. They deserve it.

Chances of returning: It's a work in progress
When: January 17, 2019
Why: Grocery Shopping
name: Schnucks - Arsenal

text:
I placed an online order 20 minutes before arriving to the restaurant. Upon arrival, i waited 10 mins before I called 4 times as instructed for a Togo order. The line rang and was not answered. I then went inside and was told that my order would take an additional 10 minutes.

We sat and waited until he car another 30 minutes before having to go back inside to ask for a status. I even tried to call again and the line just rang. 

When I went inside the statement was that there were a lot of online orders at once. I am happy that business is booming, however, don't have customers waiting on Togo orders for over 40 mins then say you had other orders to handle. We are already there.....waiting. 

I had high expectations and was severely let down that my business wasn't appreciated.
name: Freddie G's Chicken And Waffle

text: I ordered a cookie cake from the bakery this morning, I asked for "We Walk for Andie" to be written on it. I spelled the Andie for the woman who took my order  and asked for " ". I asked for light and dark purple, She mentioned that  they do not have light purple icing, but she may be able to do something. I said dark purple is fine. I picked it up promptly at noon and let me just say, WOW! Andie was spelled with a Y and when I asked the woman behind the counter to correct it, she scrapped off the y and added the ie. As yu can still see the y.  Not to mention how crooked it is. I did not have time to wait for another cake done correctly. Nor was it   even offered by the manager. However, I will never order another personalized bakery item from Schnucks again. Maybe Schnucks should rethink selling personalized bakery goods. It's a good thing we have a sense of humor!
name: Schnucks - Arsenal

text: My husband and I decided to eat lunch here, since I work close by. When we sat down it took quite a while for any waitress to come over. She finally came over and took our drink order. When she came back to take our food order, my husband ordered a cup of chili. She was supposed to bring it first as we requested. We sat there for 20 minutes and she never brought over the chili. I finally got up and walked over to her and asked her to bring the chili again. She went and got it, but did not apologize for not bringing it before. After 35 minutes we finally got our food. It was not even warm. When she brought us the bill, it seemed rather high. It said $5.00 for drinks. My husband had a soda. I had ice water. I asked her if a soda was $5.00? She said oh, I thought you had ice tea. I said no, just water. She corrected the bill. It certainly was not a great experience.  We won't go back again. Pretty disappointing...
name: Fergie's Bar & Restaurant

name: Fit-Flavors
categories: Food, Dietitians, Health Markets, Fast Food, Vegetarian, Health & Medical, Restaurants, Event Planning & Services, Caterers, Fruits & Veggies, Specialty Food, Nutritionists, Food Delivery Services, Gluten-Free

text:
Where would I be without Fit-Flavors?! I started doing orders with Fit-Flavors in February of this year. I wanted to get back into meal prepping and wanted to be mindful of low calorie/low carb meals in order to lose weight, and stumbled upon Fit-Flavors. I like that the food is already prepared and only needs to be reheated in the microwave for minimal time. The prices aren't bad, about the same that you'd pay at a restaurant if not a little less, and on average in the $10-$13 range per person/per meal. They offer free delivery for STL metro customers for orders over $70 or $75. That's easy to get to when you're buying meals for a whole week. You can also go to the store and pick up meals as you go and just put them in the freezer or heat them up that day. The food only lasts 5 days in the freezer.

Some of the meals are hit or miss on flavor so there is a bit of trial and error that goes into finding what food you like, but most of the options are really tasty. My personal favorites are the spaghetti squash with marinara and meatballs, the buffalo chicken tenders/nuggets, the Greek salad, blackened salmon, the oatmeal with mixed berries, and the steak with Yukon potatoes. My least favorite meal so far was the turkey meatloaf. The texture and taste just weren't it, at all. 

I also can proudly say that while doing Fit-Flavors for dinner only for 10 days out of a month (5 nights every other week), I did lose weight during those weeks, so I've been successful doing Fit-Flavors. If you're wanting to meal prep or just want to pick up dinner that is already portion controlled and has the nutrition facts of the entire meal indicated, I highly recommend Fit-Flavors!
name: Fit-Flavors
categories: Food, Dietitians, Health Markets, Fast Food, Vegetarian, Health & Medical, Restaurants, Event Planning & Services, Caterers, Fruits & Veggies, Specialty Food, Nutritionists, Food Delivery Services, Gluten-Free

text:
I live in LA and everybody loves Roscoe's. I do too. They are a legendary establishment. But on this last trip to St. Louis, I was introduced to Freddie G's. 
I don't mean any harm...but Freddie G's has elevated the chicken and waffle game to the next level. Their chicken alone, seasoned to perfection was worth the flight, hotel, and Uber. I didn't add a single thing to this flavorful presentation of some of the best chicken I have EVER tasted. 
Beautifully complimented by a fluffy waffle and jalapeÃ±o maple syrup, Freddie G's is a must. The standard by which all chicken and waffles must now be judged.
Simply the best.
name: Freddie G's Chicken And Waffle

text: This place has been a lifesaver! Forget all those giant companies that ship your food from god-knows-where, Fit-Flavors is right here in St. Louis! I'm supporting a local business AND eating healthy. They make it super easy for me to stay on track and log my meals, and with the changing seasonal menu, I never get sick of eating the same thing over and over. Everything I've eaten from these guys is simply divine and it only takes 2 minutes to heat up in the microwave. You could easily put the food into a glass dish too if the oven is more your style! The containers are recyclable and they will even take back empty clean containers. I cannot say enough good things about Fit-Flavors!!
name: Fit-Flavors

text:
I love to see people stand behind & give their business to the little family owned businesses that some people would never give a chance. I love to see these great reviews! Fergie's is definitely a dive bar lol...looks like it did MANY years ago inside & out. But, that has nothing to do with the food they put out & the place is clean! (It's also SMOKE-FREE now!...so anyone that doesn't go because of how smoky it got sometimes this is no longer an issue!!! YEA!!!) Just about everything is always SO good. Their brain sandwiches remind me of the ones my grandma taught me to make. I haven't made any in a long time...now that my kids are grown, when I get that craving I just come here...even though it's about a 45 min drive! (It's SO worth it!) Always fresh & always huge! I had brain sandwiches in Evansville, IN last year (they claim they're the home of the brain sandwich...they even have a festival every year!)  They were ok...but none of the 3 I had even compared to Fergie's!!! I was honest when they asked how they were...they all seemed kind of shocked & taken back that an old hole-in-the-wall in South St. Louis had them beat when it comes to brain sandwiches ...truth hurts sometimes . Fergie's fried chicken is absolutely delicious! I just recently heard that they use Hodack's old fried chicken recipe. No wonder its SO good! Hodack's USED to be THE PLACE for fried chicken in South St Louis but that hasn't been the case in years. Their original recipe is the bomb! Thank goodness Fergie's is keeping it alive. 
If you've never ate here, drove by or walked in & didn't give them a chance because the building & furnishings are old or the place was too smoky...PLEASE reconsider so you can have a mouth watering meal. You won't be disappointed, the prices are really great, the employees & regulars are so friendly, & you'll feel like you're sitting in an old neighborhood tavern transported back a few decades ...there's nothing wrong with that . Thanks for all the great food & doing what you do Fergie's!
name: Fergie's Bar & Restaurant

text: My husband and I drove a 1/2 hour to eat here and was told upon walking in as of 3:15pm they were no longer taking anymore tables. It was 3:20 when we arrived. All of the tables that were seated didn't even have their food and there were tables available. If you stop taking tables 45 minutes before you close, put that information on your website so your potential customers know. It's very inconsiderate for patrons driving quite a distance to patronize your establishment to close before the hours you post.
name: Freddie G's Chicken And Waffle

text:
Delicious food! Used the online system to order and went to pickup. I tried to call and make sure food was ready but phone goes straight to voicemail just like the other reviewer said. I really wish they'd set up a phone number, it's the main reason this is a 4 star review. I heard about this business on the For The Culture website because I feel like I've ordered takeout from the same spots over and over and wanted to try and find Black Owned spots near me. 

The Chicken and Waffles lived up to expectations - crispy well seasoned chicken and fluffy waffles. The grits were good although maybe a little too much butter as it was pooling in the styrofoam container.  

Friendly service when I went to pick it up - there were diners inside eating and staff was all masked up.

Online ordering platform says to leave your car make and model and then let them know when you arrive which you can't do because no one answers the phone.  Went inside to pick up my food , greeted by friendly staff and happy to see there business was bustling.
name: Freddie G's Chicken And Waffle

text: Do you like fried chicken? Do you like brain sandwiches? Are you disappointed in how utterly bland and tasteless Hodak's has become? If so then this is the place for you. Fergie's inherited the original Hodak's fried chicken recipe from Tony when he sold the restaurant in 1987. Now Hodak's uses a generic fried chicken recipe that is nowhere as good as the recipe that Tony used and it shows since he left it to Fergie's. Their brain sandwich, which I had personally very recently is absolutely massive and hard to get your mouth around. Compared to Schottzie's tiny sandwich it is just huge. The pork brains used to make it are so fresh and perfectly fried  that its irresistible with onion, pickle, and mustard. The fries are okay, nothing special, they're just serviceable. The onion rings and potato skins though? OH. MY GOD. Get them and be prepared to want more! The ambiance is pretty divey since it is a hole in the wall in Lemay, but get there early or be prepared to wait for a table to sit and eat at as Fergie's is a local institution.
name: Fergie's Bar & Restaurant

text: I love the food and atmosphere at Freddie G's. I usually get the chicken and Waffles, but I switched it up this time by getting the 2 X 4 breakfast special. The parking is always good, and I was able to get a seat as soon as I walked in. The volume of the music is perfect because it's loud enough to hear, but you can still talk to the people at your table with out yelling. I was also told by waiter that you get free mimosas or a pitcher of sangria on Sunday. I will definitely be back.

text:
This been in my list for a minute, and my coworker been telling me to go for a minute. Took some time out a beautiful Sunday to stop here for brunch. My friend had a table at the front so I immediately saw him when I walked in. Wasn't crowded and people at each table were enjoying themselves. They had music but it wasn't overwhelming so conversations were possible. I ordered 4pc wings and grits (cuz I had a bad grits experience at breakfast so I figure this would redeem it). 

They also had free mimosa on Sunday (hint hint). Also, they close their kitchen at 3:30pm as well. 

Food wise, I was satisfied. They had a limited menu. Chicken was hot and crispy. Grits were hot and buttery. I enjoyed a basic meal and will gladly come back. Gotta try the G sauce I heard about.
name: Freddie G's Chicken And Waffle

text:
As a Floridian transplant to St. Louis, none of the grocery stores here can compare to Publix, but this Schnucks is not bad. The layout is much better than the one in Hampton Village, they just repaved their whole parking lot, and it has pretty much everything you might need. 

The reason I shop here sometimes is because it's close to my house and I don't feel like driving 10-15 minutes to the Aldi or the nicer Shop 'n Save to save a few cents. When I need something quickly, I stop by this Schnucks. 

Someone please explain to me this double coupon thing, though. I feel like maybe I would enjoy shopping here more if I could save more money and not have it cost so much more!
name: Schnucks - Arsenal

text:
This is what I call the "Arsenal Schnucks" or "The Schnucks near The Hill" - and do a majority of my grocery shopping here, since it's not too far from Cherokee Street and definitely an upgrade from the Ghetto Schnucks on Grand/Gravois.

Why an upgrade? There are a few reasons that come to mind:
- It's cleaner
- It's well-lit
- No security guard necessary
- Produce is usually better - and there's more of it to choose from
- The Hill section - full of gourmet pasta, pasta sauce, olives, cheese, etc.
- I don't have to watch my back when going in and out, although I rarely go grocery shopping late at night anywhere!

Are the prices any better? Probably not. If I lived closer to a Target or Wal-Mart, I'd probably shop more at one of those stores since they're a better bargain. But Schnucks does the job most of the time.
name: Schnucks - Arsenal

text:
Still open during COVID 
The food here is worth the wait!!!
Yes the wait is long, however they let us know up front that everything is made to order so I was prepared. I never had the feeling that they were "being slow" due to poor service or a lack of interest. 
Now that the sloth in the room has been addressed let's get to a solid review:
The menu isn't overly complicated which I liked. I knew I was coming for some chicken and some waffles, so of course I expected to get some bomb C&W. They didn't disappoint. The syrup didn't over power the meal. The chicken wings were well battered and oh my gosh the spicy sauce set it all the way off. Plus, since it was made to order the food was piping hot. 
My server was helpful, attentive, and contributed to our dining experience. 

Covid precautions were taken and the tables were spaced out properly. Let's keep this local business alive. Stop in for some quality STL Chicken and Waffles.
name: Freddie G's Chicken And Waffle

Our waitress was very attentive and took our orders the moment we sat down.  We ordered drinks and settled in the for the football games as our order was made. If you're a Mizzou fan, so are they so they go all out when there's a Mizzou game on.

This is a little hidden gem bar with classic bar food. I have tried several menu items and each has been good! As others have noted, the fried chicken is crispy and delicious! If you are craving pizza, that is my favorite. it is thin crust cooked to perfection - crispy crust and crisp bacon topping. 
What sets Fergie's apart from other bars is the extra frosty beer mug they provide to go along with your pitcher of ice cold beer! Best way to drink a beer!
Service is super friendly and welcoming. Seems like a place where a lot of regulars go, but staff is very welcoming to all!

text:
Knotty pine walls and vintage sports clippings dictate the overall feel at this south county tavern.  For us regulars, it's an institution and the ONLY place to watch a Mizzou game, unless you're at the game live.  The owner is a die-hard tiger enthusiast, so don't look for him if there's a home game.   

Of course the beer is great, but the food is equally good.  Only a couple of stinkers on the menu.  The Fergie's wings are a deep-fried favorite with the runner up being the Deluxe cheeseburger (1/2 lb, bacon, cheese...ask for wing sauce for dipping and you'll be in heaven.   The pizza is a pretty good resentation of St. Louis style.   Try the pizza and pitcher special.

One downside only:  it can get smoky.  For this reason, we usually try to get there early for Saturday lunch or an off-evening.   The place was packed for Sat. night karaoke the two times I went.  If you're into the St. Louis local tavern vibe, be sure and check it out.   I don't know of a better neighborhood joint.
name: Fergie's Bar & Restaurant

text:
Fergie's has long been an excellent hangout in the Lemay / South County area.  Many regulars and newcomers come to enjoy the friendly atmosphere, reasonable prices, and decent bar food. 

Under new management in the COVID era, their staff are definitely striving to maintain safety standards as well as provide the high quality of food and atmosphere long expected by loyal customers.  For the most part, Fergies has kept consistency in changing times.

Our order tonight consisted of takeout: a burger, a beef sandwich, and a generous portion of potato skins.  As usual the food was good. We look forward to the days that this place can serve a full crowd for a Blues game or Cardinals game on TV.
name: Fergie's Bar & Restaurant

text: I love Toasted Cafe'! Everything I've had thus far is off the chart delicious! The staff is awesome. They greet you as you walk in the door, smiles galore, always a made that morning fresh selection of coffees, cakes, BREADS and cookies! I give this establishment 5 stars for all these reasons. The food and coffee is outstanding! I can't recommend just one thing...! Try it all, because it's just that great! There's a Childrens corner to entertain while the adults enjoy their coffee and breads. The entire set up is cozy as soon as you enter the cafe. Stop by, step into their world and you will be so happy you did. I am, and I'm headed back today for the fresh bread that we just can't get  enough of!

text:
This place is super convenient.  I can appreciate that the foods are healthy and generous portions.  The price is a little steep, but in the area there is not a lot of healthy to-go foods. I love bringing these for lunches/breakfasts at work, and sometimes go and grab dinner for me and my husband.
The rewards program is insane! Great value! Staff is always courteous and the Smoothie Bar is awesome, too. You can tell the management here appreciate their customers as I'm almost always greeted like I'm family.
Most of the menu items are seasonal and some of my favorites included:  Burger and Fries (now Burger and roasted reds), Smoked Spicy Muscle Maker, Peanut Chicken over Asian Slaw (can you please bottle that dressing - it's delicious!), Chicken Quesadilla, Lemon Cake, Tropical Parfait, Mixed Berry Pancakes, Turkey-Eggs-Potatoes Breakfast, Egg Enchiladas. Their enchilada sauce is amazing (another one I'd love to see bottled).
Would be kinda cool if they could put together a "Weekly Plan" for you to purchase 5 days worth of breakfasts, snacks and lunches (for office people) to save some money. I would totally do something like that!
Thankful to have something like this so close to my house.
name: Fit-Flavors

text:
Debi Sugarman to Fit-Flavors by Jillian
3 mins Â· 
Love...love...love these foods!!!!! All my meals and most snacks (love those Chickies!!)...are Fit Flavors foods!!! So glad the Chickies snacks are still on the menu and hope they continue as a regular item!!!!!! LOVE the Smoke Chicken and Butternut Mash dish this season! I really hope they keep this longer...at least thru the winter season! Seems to fly off the shelves!!!! Speaking of winter...I hope the chicken with wild rice soup returns this winter!! At least the great veggie soup is always around!! That's even so yummy cold!
I recently discovered the changed container with the vented top. Fantastic!!! Now.. without having to first open the lid on the corner to vent..the food stays so much more moist. I really noticed that with the turkey burger. The turkey burger was already wonderful...yet now it's even better!!!! And the Sloppy Joe....I'm in heaven!!!! Every time I eat a Fit-Flavors meal or snacks...I thank Jillian for having her vision!!!! I hope she knows what a difference she has made in the nutrition industry! Finding this Company has been one of the best parts about moving to St Louis last year and living Very close to the Creve Coeur location. This Company has the best staff!! They go out of their way to make sure everyone has the best experience in their stores!!! This Company has changed my life regarding nutrition! Huge part of the change is also due to Allison as well!!! Plus...my family knows that any gifts are more than welcomed with Fit-Flavors gift cards..which they have so graciously given me!!!!!!!
name: Fit-Flavors

I was standing waiting for my drink and she put a drink up on a higher Stand, didn't make eye contact with me so I  didn't think it was my drink, and then went back to making another drink that I naturally thought was mine , she made that drink and then with a big smile called for "Justin "and said  your drink ready!
