text:
Wow! What a great concept! Healthy food with full nutrition labels and it's yummy too! :-) Super convenient. 

My family came in from out of town and we bought 2 giant bags of food and after about 3 days, we came back and bought 3 more giant bags of food. It was great to be able to accommodate everyone's diets (or lack of diet, as the case may be). We had one person who was trying to eat more vegetarian fare. No problem. Another person who was focused on trying to eat lots of protein. Again, no problem. Another person who was calorie conscious. Again, no worries. And lastly, two people who just wanted it to taste good. Again, no problem.

I bought several packages of the Chickies and one of my daughters told me after she ate one that she was worried it was going to be gross health food because it's chickpea flour, but that they are surprisingly yummy! And she was happy to gobble up several of them. 

So everyone was pleased. 

Everyone loved the taste of the foods and a few really appreciated being able to gauge what they were eating by the nutrition labels. 

The ladies at the counter are super friendly and super helpful! I wish there was one of these in LA.
name: Fit-Flavors

text:
I love this place!!! I went in weary, because my friend who recommended it eats, what I consider to be, gross healthy food. But, I decided to try it about a month or so ago and I'm hooked, and have gotten half my office hooked!  

On the surface, it may seem kind of pricy, but when I really broke it down, it wasn't too bad. I spend about $50 for my week of lunches. When I was meal prepping, I would spend about $30. But, for $30/week it meant I had to (1) spend about 3-4 hours of my Sunday afternoon making lunch for the week, and then cleaning up, (2) I had to eat the exact same thing every day, and (3) by Wednesday or Thursday I was bored with my lunch, would throw it out, and go spend money on unhealthy food at a restaurant for the rest of the week, effectively spending more than $50 in total for the week. Now that I've found Fit-Flavors, I pick up 5 lunches for the week, get to eat something different everyday, don't have to clean anything up, and get consistently delicious food!

For breakfast, my favorite is the Carne con Huevos. The small version keeps me more than full until lunch. I've started buying the large because it actually gives me two days of breakfast, and still keeps me full. (Note that I usually eat A LOT, so the fact that this stuff keeps me full is amazing.). For lunch, right now, I really like the Grass-fed burger with mango salsa, and the Memphis rubbed steak tips. I add a little hot sauce to my burger and it's perfect, and my steak tips are super flavorful the way they are. One of my co-workers mentioned that some of the food didn't have enough flavor to it, but she added some salt and then fell I love. Remember, it's super easy to add salt (or hot sauce) to a dish - impossible to remove it. So it makes sense for the (healthy, mind you) dishes to be low on sodium. Just add some and you're golden. 

I recently started trying the snacks. The granola bars are probably my favorite.  They're filling, and have a good amount of protein in them - double perk. 

So, if you're looking for an EASY way to eat healthy...you need to check this place out!!!  You won't regret it!  And sign up for their rewards program while you're there. Then you get discounts in the future!
name: Fit-Flavors

Save your time and energy and drive to Sunset Hills, Crestwood, Rock Hill, or even inside Target. This is always the WORST Starbucks! Not to mention how small is it, with no drive through. Besides that, the service has always been the worst! 
I go there MAYBE 2x a year, because I go next door for my glasses. Otherwise I avoid it at all costs! 
For instance, spent $6.06 on my Venti Iced vanilla latte with almond milk today (which I get everyday)... he made it COMPLETELY wrong. It was dark, made with iced coffee instead of a latte, and I told him it was wrong and tasted bad. Him AND the manager looked at me crazy. She said we can add more almond milk... so he added more almond milk to it and wouldn't just remake the drink they made wrong in the first place! I just left, because I did t want to cause a scene. I walked there today, because we live close and I still try and avoid this location! Do. Not. Waste. Your. Money. There!

text: I came here with a craving for a smoothie and left with a smoothie AND breakfast. I don't live here but wish I had it where I lived. They had all different kids of breakfast, lunch, and dinner options pre-packaged, as well as healthy deserts. I decided on the Cold Busta because the matcha and flaxseed sold me. It was good! But even better was the egg, turkey sausage, and sweet potato breakfast bowl I heated up in the microwave and ate on the road. I just put a little bit of hot sauce on it and it was great! Will return when I travel in the future. I would literally open a franchise in my town if I could.

text:
I used to eat here much more often when I worked in the area, but I'm just now getting around to catching up on writing reviews.  My coworkers raved about this place, so I decided to give it a try.  The meals are a tad expensive, but they are FANTASTIC!  Forget frozen microwavable lunches.  Anytime a coworker would bring food back, we'd all get the craving because it always smelled SOOO GOOD.  Their meals are labeled with nutritional information, which makes it easy to track your food intake if you have fitness goals.  

They also had a smoothie bar, but I never got around to trying the smoothies.  They have a rewards program which can help some with the cost of the meals if you eat there on a regular basis.  They also have people there you can ask what meals will best help you meet your fitness goals.  The staff was always extremely friendly and super knowledgeable!
name: Fit-Flavors

text: This place is great!! I haven't been in the area long and haven't found a great vegan place until trying CC's. I had the chicken salad made with jackfruit and a  side salad with house made vegan ranch and it is the best meal I've  had since moving to the Midwest. I can't wait to go back and try more of the menu and see what's in store for them in their new location.

text: I love Fit Flavors I frequent the Brentwood location for easy healthy meals to take to work during the week. I was able to grab my meals for the week and get a meal replacement shake for my lunch on the drive home. Hopefully the Brentwood store will get one some day!

text: Was excited to check this place out but was disappointed from my experience. Ordered the gogi bowl w/ steak for myself and the veggie gogi bowl with fried rice for my partner. We waited over 20 min for our food. When I started noticing multiple people behind us getting our food I went up to the front to get an update on our food. The cashier realized our food accidentally got put in as a pick up for carry out order instead of dine in. She handed it to us. The cashier was friendly but lacked appropriate knowledge to do her job up to standard. Since our food was ready but not appropriately given to it's customers, it was cold by the time we ate. Also the presentation doesn't look appetizing whatsoever. Taste was just alright. Not planning on returning anytime soon.
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text:
I love this Starbucks for no other reason than the fact that the barista doesn't bat an eye when I order a Iced Skinny Caramel Macchiatto alongside the biggest piece of coffee cake that they have. 

I'm such a walking contradiction.
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants

text: Normally this place is great. The past several weeks they've been getting really backlogged on orders. A mobile order with an estimate of 3-6 minutes has actually taken a half hour a couple times for me lately. One time I think my order may have gotten lost in the shuffle somehow. The employees are very nice and very fast so I'm not sure why things seem to have gotten so busy/delayed. I still recommend it if you don't go from like 7:30 to 9:30. At least not if you're in a hurry. Hopefully this is a temporary problem though.
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants

text: The house blend is some of the best coffee I have ever tasted!  I was visiting friends in the area so we decided to come to toasted because their breakfast poppers were highly recommended.  They didn't disappoint either.  It's a muffin baked with cheese, eggs and meat, all in one convenient package.  After one, I wanted another, but two was almost too much (almost).  They had their house and French roast up front, the french was solid, but the house blend was delicious!  I would buy that coffee every day if I could.  All of the staff were very friendly, and there were quite a few patrons just talking and having coffee.  Super cool place, and definitely worth a visit if you're in the area.
name: Toasted Coffee House
categories: Cafes, Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Coffee & Tea

text:
We did curbside pickup. Ordering online was really easy and finding a spot to wait for pickup was easy, but it wasn't clear if we needed to call for the order or just let the person at the hostess stand know we were there for a pickup. 

We got our food pretty quickly after arriving and it smelled so good. The drive home felt so long! The burgers were delicious and the fries were perfect. I can't believe I waited so long to try them out. The house sauce was very tasty! I can't wait to try them again.
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text:
There are certain restaurants in St. Louis that are ubiquitous with the foodie scene in the city. It's so easy to forget the bold flavors of Seoul Taco were born in the back of a food truck. Now they have multiple locations in both St. Louis and Chicago. And you know why? Because their food is SO good!

The original brick and mortar Seoul Taco location in the Delmar Loop was always such a pain for me to get to, so I actually never had food from that location. When they announced that this Asian-fusion eatery was opening a location in the brand new apartment complex in the Grove, my mouth watered.  While you can still find their food around town at food truck rallies, the idea of it being so easily accessible on Manchester was the stuff dreams are made of!

Ordering from Seoul Taco is so simple. Their online system is a breeze. We actually ordered inside with an incredibly pleasant employee though. The food was hot and ready in just a few minutes. (Ordering and getting fresh food is really something that I've missed during the pandemic.) Because it was a Friday in Lent, we went with completely meatless options. My boyfriend chose the tofu quesadilla and I went for the burrito (we had a coupon for a free taco too!) 

The quesadilla was full of gooey cheese and oozed flavor. The rice in my burrito packed a spicy punch, but wasn't unenjoyable. Loved the fried rice inside the burrito, but would have liked there to be a little more sauce. Overall the Asian-fusion meets Mexican flavors were a unique combo for our Friday feast.
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text: I'm not a vegetarian anymore, but I don't eat a ton of meat so I decided to give CC's a go. It was a long wait for the food. They are shortstaffed like everyone these days...It would've been better if I had ordered online before I got there. In fact, they expect you to order online regardless.  Everything was REALLY tasty and they were friendly. It's a small restaurant. Very busy.

text:
Toasted came highly recommended by several friends, & it did not disappoint. I tried the Toasted Macch (aka Carmel macch), & it was PERFECT. 
A sweet lady took my order & prepared drink while I browsed their shopping area:
Gifts by local artist. 
Looks like a small room is under construction for private events. 
Cafe had several peeps enjoying conversation or laptops as wifi is free. 
I will be going back to try more beverages as well as baked goods.

text: What a great place!  I got a double cheeseburger and fries.  Service was excellent on a busy Saturday night.

text: Always so yummy. They have a great online ordering/pick up situation here. Parking can sometimes not be ideal but I make it work for the Korean inspired burritos. The spicy pork is fantastic. The burrito does have some kick with the sauces but the sour cream and greens keep it reasonable. Portions are large, I typically go for the burrito or Gigi and waffles and can't finish the whole thing. Though the menu is simple, Seoul taco is packed with huge flavor.
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text:
I ordered delivery and it was OFF THE HOOK delicious, hot, fresh, amazing, on point. We got a steak quesadilla, a burrito and a couple spicy pork tacos. Sauce was served on the side and I enjoyed trying each one separately and together. 
The food and flavors are unique but also accessible to people who don't know where Seoul is or don't think they like Kim chi. If you like tacos and quesadillas, give it a try! It's spicy, sweet, salty, tangy, all the flavors you love. 
The next time I ordered, we walked over to pick it up. They were backed up, but one of the employees was speaking to folks individually to apologize and update them on their orders. By the time we got home with our order, it was good, prepared well and with care, but not quite the same quality as the first time. That could have been due to our 15 min walk home, but I will revisit in the future!! Love having them close by.
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text: Food is delicious! Must try liquid gold cheese on everything. Service is prompt and friendly.  Food and drinks for adults. Food and drinks for kids.  Perfect family place that grown ups can also enjoy.  Great addition to Webster.  The Parkmoor nailed it.  Be back soon!!
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text: I used door dash this morning to order Seoul Taco today because it's taco Tuesday and I love Seoul Taco. Our food was delicious as usual and even ordered an extra container of kimchi and a pound each of chicken and steak so we can make our own tacos again soon. I don't think the meat comes marinated in their sauce but they have so many layers and so much depth with their food i can definitely whip up some marinade. I'm looking forward to using cooking the meat they offered for our own dinner.   I couldn't wait so i took a bite of my burrito before i got to take the picture
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text: Have had their cheesesteak, burgers, onion rings, fries, chili, Mac and cheese, drinks, snow cones and about to get their meatball sub. This place is f**king amazing. Everything is so good.

text: What a wonderful addition to High Ridge!!!  The Coffee and Hot Chocolate are both excellent.  I love the convenience of having a cute quiet place to meet with friends, and have short business lunch meetings.  The Tomato soup and grilled cheese panini are so good.  The sisters that own Toasted are always so friendly, and such a pleasure to talk to.  If you are in the area stop by and check it out for yourself.  You won't be disappointed!
name: Toasted Coffee House
categories: Cafes, Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Coffee & Tea

text:
A great addition to downtown Webster! Classic diner fare with an updated twist. The smash burgers were great, fries were very crispy. One star off for onion rings being too heavily battered with very little onion to it at all. The chili dog was spot on.

Excitedly tried the sno balls but turns out they were just ordinary sno cones, nothing special to them at all, bummer.

The cherry pie was delish with a buttery, flaky crust. So skip the sno ball and go for the pie for dessert - all pies made in house every day!
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text:
Walk and you feel welcomed~ 
Food taste good Af! 
Steak seasoned just right!!  A must try!!
name: Phillies Cheesesteaks
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Cheesesteaks

text:
A great addition to Webster Groves! Nice to have a place for the entire family and not feel like you are dragging the kids to a bar! Bahaha 

We ordered curbside and at the end of the call she asked if we wanted utensils or Ketchup. It's the little things that set places apart (and they were all in the bag)! Food was ready when we arrived and brought out quickly. Service was super friendly. 

The food was great. Hot. Fresh. Delicious. 

Hummm, was the food a tad bit pricey?? Yes, it was. But, was it worth it? Yeppppppp it was!

Burgers were smash Steak 'n Shake style! Fries were greaaat as were the onion rings. Onion rings had that awesome CRUNCH factor, maybe a tad bit too much batter but really can you have too much?! 

Kids meals were a nice addition and the bustiers came with fries, cheese only .50 extra. 

Can't wait to go back and try their SnoBalls on a hot day!
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text: It's really nice to have a coffee option in House Springs that isn't a gas station. The staff is super nice and they have a pretty good reward program. I've yet to try the food but I've several people eating and it looks awesome.

text: I come here a lot. I love the tacos. Sometimes it's AMAZING and sometimes it's a little dry or lacking in sauce/limes so I just have to remember to ask for extra, but overall have a great time here. Plus, where can you get this delicious of tacos for this great a price. I want it right now.

text: I really enjoy having a place such as this available. The town I'm from there isn't anything like this. It's def not much cheaper than eating out for lunch, but it's clean and healthy which makes it worth it. It's also dishes I would never ever make myself. I love that they offer delivery now as well.

text:
Got the spicy pork burrito and chicken tacos to go. Loved the spicy pork burrito! It was tasty, filling, and did not disappoint. The chicken tacos were ok. They were spicier than I expected and it probably is not a great item to get to go because it looks like a mess if it gets shifted around. The burrito was better than the tacos.

Curbside parking was available in front of the store. The food was ready very quickly! Great stop for Korean-Mexican food.
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text: I had a pork burrito and some Rico fries - both excellent. The burrito filling is a sort of mass of deliciousness that all melds together as it melts in your mouth. And the fries are a filling side to split of wedges with gentle but flavorful seasonings. Others got chicken burrito bowl and a Rico burger - both were very pleased. Service was quick for pickup and very friendly and clean.
name: Pi Pizzeria and Â¡RICO! Mexican
categories: Restaurants, Pizza, Tacos, Mexican, Chicken Wings

text: Phillies cheesesteaks is pretty awesome I went with my friend on the opening day and definitely wasn't disappointed. I love the teriyaki chicken sandwich but everything I have tried so far is really good. The bread is fresh the steak and chicken is cooked well and everything is seasoned adequately. They also have really good deals sometimes
name: Phillies Cheesesteaks
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Cheesesteaks

text:
This review is based on drive thru the first week they were open so maybe issues have disappeared.  Called prior to ordering online to ask what WHET includes on the burritos and either the gent didn't want to tell me or didn't know because he hung up.  Undeterred, I ordered online.  Pick up (drive thru) was just plain odd.  Text/email said food was ready so I get into the drive thru lane and wait for 5 minutes for the car in front of me to get their order.  Once at the drive thru window I have to wait another 5 minutes for my food order.  While waiting, you get a great view of the kitchen staff doing their stuff which doesn't give me much confidence in a great outcome.  2 stars for the lead up to dinner.
Carbon Burrito (still have no idea what WHET includes) was very good but I was hungry so a shoe may have tasted fine.  I would try it again.  Bacon pizza was great, certainly hit the mark here according to kid #1.  Wife enjoyed her Rico salad w/chicken.  Kid #2 had a  Carbon quesadilla which I finished off as leftovers the next day.  That was pretty tasty! For the actual food I'd give it 3.5 stars. Pricey for a drive thru.  
Overall review rounds up to 3 stars
Location is great but also a curse. The night I picked up, people waiting for their orders blocked much of the ingress/egress which made the drive thru challenging.  Interesting comment from someone else about the tax rate - 11.1% does seem high
name: Pi Pizzeria and Â¡RICO! Mexican
categories: Restaurants, Pizza, Tacos, Mexican, Chicken Wings

text: If you crave nostalgia, probably worth a trip. If you want the best $10 cheeseburger in town, this isn't it. Nothing special at all. I will say the heavily battered onion rings were tasty. And, how can you claim to be Parkmoor reincarnated and not serve shakes! Server was clueless about almost everything. If it weren't within walking distance from my house, I'm sure I would never return. Since it is, maybe I will see if the bologna sandwich is the house specialty!
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text: My wife and I split the King burger and the fried Bologna sandwich. OMG. Both were amazing. The onion rings were some of the best I've had!  We will be back!!!

text:
Neighborhood Gem Alert!!
This little cozy coffee house is awesome!

I get the cold brew with milk. My fav! This has such a distinct taste that I find it addicting in the summer.
 They have wonderful homemade bakery items. I do banana bread and it has toasted pecans baked in which is so tasty. (that's how I do mine at home now! )  

The owners and staff are amazing too. Always friendly, kind and striving continually towards making their business shine and their customers happy.
That's my experience and we've been here plenty. 

The atmosphere is cute too. Cabin-Moose-murals-theme. Games & books/kiddie section/locals artwork on walls for purchase. 
Proud and happy to have this little gem as my local coffee house!
name: Toasted Coffee House
categories: Cafes, Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Coffee & Tea

text: This place is exactly what 2020 needed! We tried this on a weeknight a couple weeks after they opened. We are big fans of Pi pizza and now it's right down the street...WITH A DRIVE THRU!!! Highly recommend the Glendale pizza and treat yourself to a Cadillac Margarita...one was plenty for 2 people. Convenient timed online ordering  with a text message when it's ready to pick up at the window. The easiest carry out ever and friendly.
name: Pi Pizzeria and Â¡RICO! Mexican
categories: Restaurants, Pizza, Tacos, Mexican, Chicken Wings

text: Coffee is good, they have it all. Service is friendly and fast. Nice addition to the area. They are very welcoming and have a nice set up. They offer games to use and have large tables to play them at.
name: Toasted Coffee House
categories: Cafes, Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Coffee & Tea

text: This is a great little coffee shop in an unlikely spot.  There are no other coffee shops that I'm aware of nearby, but Toasted covers the bases extremely well.  Their coffee is very, very good.  My wife bought me some whole bean coffee from them to take home and it was really wonderful, and every drink I've had in the shop has been excellent.  Food is tasty too, and my wife loves their fresh baked loaves of bread. In addition to the food and drinks the atmosphere is inviting, they have games and books available, merchandise from local artisans and authors, and a nice little play area for kids with toys and chalkboard walls.  If you are in the High Ridge, Cedar Hill, Dittmer, Byrnes Mill, House Springs, or Fenton areas check out Toasted.
name: Toasted Coffee House
categories: Cafes, Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Coffee & Tea

text: My stomach is happy to give this place a five star review. There are not many places that have healthy options these day. NO fast food greasy here. NO stand in line at the trough to eat as much as you can here.  Just yummy satisfying deliciousness here. Good place to sample vegan made items.  We got our food to go as we were passing thru the area.
name: CCâs Vegan Spot

text: This is a long over due post. I ordered large cupcakes for my son's first birthday party, and toasted exceeded my expectations! I sent the owners a picture of my son's birthday invitation to provide the color scheme. I had told them I would be happy with plain icing but gave them creative freedom based on the invitation. When we went to pick them up, the store was set up beautifully. In addition, the staff was so kind and made us feel special as we talked about our order. They went above and beyond! We ended up with bakery level cupcakes for an amazing price. I can't wait to try their in house pastries the next time I am there. These ladies are extremely talented and we couldn't have been more pleased with our experience! I highly recommend toasted for catering and will be using them again in the future.
name: Toasted Coffee House
categories: Cafes, Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Coffee & Tea

text: BRA.VO. to this Coffee Shop! Coffee, Food, Service and Atmosphere is above and beyond. This locally owned and operated coffee shop brings life to High Ridge! I only walk away wishing I could have a bigger coffee because they're so good. Tried a coffee and loved it? Take home a bag of it to brew yourself. The inside has cute, quiet tables to enjoy a book or meet with friends. A kids corner allows for kids to play and stay occupied if needed. text: I had a great experience here! The Oreo funnel cake hit the spot. Staff was great, and very catering to my Philly request. Thank you!

text: This new Glendale location is pretty convenient as far as picking up on my way home from work. The drive thru pick-up window makes that even more convenient! I ordered a Deep Dish Cornmeal Crust Pepperoni and Bacon. This pizza is not Chicago deep dish but it's still great. It had been a while since I had it and the cornmeal crust is really good and substantial. It is a little grainy in a good way. There's a whole lot of cheese and the chunky tomato sauce on the top. Slightly sparse on the pizza toppings. A few sprinkles of crushed red pepper make it even better! This was a welcome, and rare, departure from my usual St. Louis style flat pizza. It was also excellent leftover and cold. I'm one of those people who love cold pizza. I enjoyed it and I am going to remember I like it. I'm sure I will be back!
name: Pi Pizzeria and Â¡RICO! Mexican
categories: Restaurants, Pizza, Tacos, Mexican, Chicken Wings

text:
I'll be real honest with you: the only thing keeping this place from 5 stars is the poor customer service/interaction at the checkout. Watched lady at the front running register kind of be a dick to a guy who walked in wondering if she had said something to him (which if you were there, you would understand).

Will re-rate after my next experience (should there be one).
name: Seoul Taco

text:
We actually had higher hopes for this place.  They skimped on the meat in the bulgogi bowl and especially in the spicy pork tacos.  It was as though they ran out of pork and had just a little bit to spread across our 3 tacos.  We ate again shortly after coming here because these meals weren't filling enough.  Also the pork was a little overcooked.

We are normally huge fans of Korean BBQ restaurants and this place unfortunately isn't up to par with most others when it comes to the taste & quantity of the food.
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text:
I'm so glad that Pi is back in the Webster/Kirkwood bubble. I love the concept of this pick up location for what I think is one if not the top multi location pizza places is the area. 

The order was extremely easy to place online. I was even provided with a pick up time. I am a gluten free gal so that is an important feature for me. I ordered a GF pizza that didn't have fully GF ingredients and was called by the restaurant to substitute. How cool is that!!

When I arrived at the drive through at the designated time I was treated by an employee so friendly, I would have loved to had stayed to chat! We received our order quickly and we're on our way! Everything was as smooth as could be and the pizza was spot on. The only downside to Pi is the price but three pizzas fed a family of 5 with no complaints.

Will try RICO next time!
name: Pi Pizzeria and Â¡RICO! Mexican
categories: Restaurants, Pizza, Tacos, Mexican, Chicken Wings

text: Very happy to have a Seoul Taco in the Grove! Can't really go wrong with anything on their menu, but I'm a particular fan of their bulgogi and spicy pork tacos & bowls.
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text:
I was so happy when I heard that Pi was reopening in the area! This location is convenient for me and I love the drive thru window. After being open a week or so, none of the issues shared in some previous reviews happened for our Sunday night order. I placed the order mid-day for a 5:15 pickup. Order was two pizzas, two salads and a kids meal. I got a text that it was ready at 5:10 and pulled in shortly thereafter. Was handed my food and out in seconds.

Everyone greatly enjoyed the food! The pizza was delicious, salads were fresh, and the kids meal had a ton of food (fed both my kids with one).

I'll definitely be back and am glad to have them nearby!
name: Pi Pizzeria and Â¡RICO! Mexican
categories: Restaurants, Pizza, Tacos, Mexican, Chicken Wings

text: This place turned out to be so different from what I expected based on the online photos and website and I'm so happy. Decor... this place is fun! Bright colors, open space and a scoreboard on the wall. Mason was my assigned staff member and he was very friendly, attentive and helpful. I was stuck between the King Burger, Crispy Chick and Shrimp Po'boy. Even though he recommended the Po'Boy, I went with the Crispy Chick add bacon, Swiss, lettuce and tomato w/fries, Wedge Salad to start. Huge salad with ample toppings, fresh and very tasty. They've got great ranch dressing, not heavy on the mayo side. Chicken Sandwich was amazing! This is what I call a freshly hand breaded chicken sandwich! The crust was seasoned well and not too thick. Now, this place serves Snowcones and Adult Snowcones along with Pies, but I didn't have any room for dessert... next time though!
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text:
The service was great. But I do have some things to say about the Philly cheesesteak itself there was a little bit too much sauce and cheese it was so wet it was so wet I could barely hold it in my hand. 
I wanted to like it so badly but unfortunately whatever white sauce or cheese they put on it way too much. I don't usually write bad reviews but I am telling you this so that you can change it and the wetness of the sandwich.
name: Phillies Cheesesteaks
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Cheesesteaks

text:
Went for lunch with my family and sat outside and was happy to have the space heater.  So happy I went as I was not very interested in going and being at a restaurant.  Seating was well spaced and there were plenty of heaters.

The food rocked! The toasted Raviolis were a big surprise - loved the Spicy seasoning.  Crispy Chick, Shrimp PO Boy, and Cheeseburger all got thumbs up, but the menu standout item was the Frankfurter.  

A big thanks to the staff who were fantastic - we appreciated the menu recommendations and attentiveness.  Saw 5-6 cars pull up for carry out and it looked like well organized.

We will be back and try carry out as well.  This is a restaurant I want to support and make sure it gets through Covid!
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text:
The good- the service was outstanding and the fries are perfect! Crispy, well seasoned, hot!

The not so good- I had the steak Philly. Wasn't like a real Philly cheesesteak. There was some seasoning on the steak or something in the cheese that did not compliment the sandwich at all. Maybe Parmesan cheese or garlic.... I couldn't exactly tell but it was enough for me not to eat beyond a few bites. As other reviews said as well, the bread was way too thick and overpowered the sandwich. I was so excited to try this place as I love true Philly cheesesteaks but this fell short. 

Hopefully they will take this into account and make some adjustments because I'd love to continue to support this business in the future.
name: Phillies Cheesesteaks
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Cheesesteaks

text:
I love Philly cheesesteaks, but don't get to enjoy them very often, and this did not disappoint! I ordered the beef philly, which was absolutely delicious! Online ordering process was easy to navigate. Staff was not very friendly, unfortunately. Also, my food was not ready upon arrival to the store, even though I only ordered 1 item. I had to wait about 5 minutes for the sandwich to be made, which wasn't terrible - at least I know my food was made fresh and wasn't just sitting waiting for me. The quality and taste of the food was worth it - I will definitely be ordering from here again!

As far as Covid precautions - none of the staff were wearing masks. This is a very small shop with no indoor or outdoor seating available.

text: This Seoul Taco is by far the worst Seoul Taco location all caused by the staff not caring and obviously management not doing anything about it. I have been to this location for probably close to 200 times and I always get the same thing, a gogi bowl. The only consistent thing about it is that the meat is always seasoned well (the reason I keep coming back) other than that the bowls are never the same. They always pre cook the eggs so they end up being a hard egg, not the sunny side up as it should be. Out of those 200 times I have ordered this bowl I always get it with Seoul sauce, out of those times they have not put it on the bowl at least 150 of those orders. They also have the audacity to charge 50 cents for a tablespoon of that sauce that you may or may not get. I truly think that if the owner would audit this location he would be deeply upset with the quality of food that is coming out of there.
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text: Was excited about trying this place tonight. Me and a friend came out order the steak fries chicken and steak it's not that bad it's ok fair for the price but spending almost $5 for a large drink outrageous

text: Delicious!  We were in Grafton to see the eagles and were so surprised to see a vegan/vegetarian place in the area with such great options.  We had the fried chicken sandwiches (McDonalds style, but more delicious), the onion ring beyond burger, the ISH (fake-fish) pieces, impossible crunch taco, and the illy (Philly) cheesesteak sandwich.  All were amazing.  The sandwiches and burgers came with fries.  I am picky about my fries- I think most places get them wrong- but these were outstanding.   If I got the onion ring burger again, I might see if I can get it with the impossible burger instead of the beyond burger, since it looks from their menu like they have both and I like the impossible burger better.  I'm vegetarian, and my husband's an omnivore, and our meal was a hit with both of us, and our kids!
name: CCâs Vegan Spot

text:
Ah, The Parkmoor. Just the name conjures up grad school breakfast meetings. How I missed it when it closed.

The Parkmoor Webster Groves addition does an excellent job of bringing back all the feels while modernizing the drive in for the new millennium. In the days of Covid, we enjoyed our Saturday lunch on the sidewalk "patio". The tables were comfortably distanced with large umbrellas. 

We had the single burger, mine with onion rings, the hubs had fries. Both were delicious! These are diner-style "smashburgers". They come with the standard lettuce, tomato, pickle, onion and this amazing Parkmoor sauce. The portions were large enough that I couldn't finish my onion rings (and that was after a 2 hour workout).

We didn't try a snowball or other dessert, but I'm definitely game WHEN I go back. They also have other great menu options, including a hot dog I was oogling when it came out for another table.  

Bottom line--splurge on calories and get yourself to the new Parkmoor.
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text: Very nice carry outs on a Friday night. It was an Italian place and I guess Covid killed it. This brings Pi back to the area since they closed their Manchester location. We called and they had a pretty long wait. But when I showed up they had the food ready and it was tremendous. Carnitas taco, BLT Salad and deep dish pizza. It was all great and we will be back.
name: Pi Pizzeria and Â¡RICO! Mexican
categories: Restaurants, Pizza, Tacos, Mexican, Chicken Wings

text:
The Parkmoor is in the old Half and Half in Old Webster across from Straubs. Im not sure of the owner is a relative of the old Parkmoor that I knew at Big Bend and Clayton, but there are definitely things from there in this new Parkmoor. 

I had the fried bologna sandwich.  Its a very healthy low calorie snack...NOT!!!! Basically its layers of fried bologna with two grilled cheese sandwiches as the bread. Ummm Yummmmmm! The fries were pretty dang good too. I had them with the cheese sauce.  This is not for people that have had by-pass surgery. 

My wife had the single burger with onion rings. The burger is a smash type burger. It was delicious. The onion rings were AWESOME! Some of the best I've had. 

Lastly, we had peach pie ala mode. It tasted like it was made by a chef, because it was. We both surmised this was not an off the rack pie. The waitress told.us the chef did indeed make it. You could tell the peaches were fresh just by looking at them.  If you're here, I recommend at least sharing a piece with someone just so you can try it. Ill try the others on my return trip.

Great place to eat!!!
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text:
The thing about this local chain that impresses the heck out of me is that the employees always are so friendly, helpful, and conscientious.   

So much better that the big chains.  

The food is awesome, lots of good options and the prices are very reasonable.  

The other thing?  The playlist.   I've said it before ( my review of the Olive Blvd location), but this is the hidden gem about this place is the playlist.   Classic hip hop at just the right volume level.   Clean, so it's kid safe and the grooves are REAL!

Love this place.

text: So here goes. I remember over thirteen years ago having one of the first Korean taco food trucks in the nation, Kogi, while I was in NYC. I see the Korean taco has finally made it big to this area. We were told Seoul Taco was good so I decided to see what was up. We split the bulgogi burrito and asked for sauce on the side. It really was the perfect portion to split for me and my husband. The bulgogi was tender but flavored as well as bulgogi is. How would I even know?  I'm Korean. We grew up eating this almost weekly and we just moved here from Houston and we are laden with Korean BBQ joints. We've also hit up the ones in LA and of course the OGs in Korea. So beef tender and close but completely bulgogi. I really liked the kimchi rice inside the burrito. I wish the rice had actual pieces of kimchi in it. The flavor was good. The side sauces were good too.
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text:
First time here with my family, we were really excited to try it out.  Husband ordered the po boy shrimp sandwich, that was ok but the bread ended up being soggy. I ordered the veggie burger and that was good. our daughter had the mac and cheese, again another good one!  I gave this place 3 stars only. Because the service could be better, I felt our table was not getting the attention. 

also we really went here to try out the sno ball , but we did not get it because it took FOREVER, so we just asked for the check and left. 

It shouldn't take 25+ minutes to get one order of sno ball out, we were waiting on our blue raspberry sno cone, by the time the waiter made it back to our table, i sure he forgot about us and the sno ball, he said he checked on it but it turns out it was melting and asked if we want to wait for another one. No thank you.  So we drove elsewhere for desserts.
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text:
Very Good!!
Egg Roll Philly was deelish!
The classic was awesome! Very good buns.
Was very pleased with the flavors and quality of food
name: Phillies Cheesesteaks
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Cheesesteaks

text: First time to try this restraint and we are enamored! We tried the burrito with tofu, the chicken quesadilla and the spicy pork Gigi and waffles. We loved all of it ! The flavor profiles were amazing. The sauces had my family wanting the recipes and the spicy pork left them with the back of the tongue tingle that they love. The kimchi rice in the burrito was just the right mix of spicy and tangy. We will definitely eat here again.
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text: I have been wanting to try this place out since they opened last year. I saw an advertisement on Instagram for BOGO this weekend so I went. I ordered a classic Philly cheesesteak, fries, and a sprite. I called to order and they wouldn't allow me to since it was a special nor could i order online. I went inside and placed my order. I paid an extra $.75 to add tomatoes to the sandwich. I waited about 10 minutes and my food was ready. The man at the counter was really nice and patient. The Philly came with some kind of liquid four cheese mix and it was just okay as it lacked a lot of flavor. The sandwich itself and the fries were just okay. I would definitely say penn station Philly cheesesteaks taste better. I noticed my green peppers looked almost raw and they would taste better cooked on a Philly. My daughter and I were both underwhelmed with the taste.
name: Phillies Cheesesteaks
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Cheesesteaks

text: Awesome coffee. I go here a few times a week, whether its in the mornings for coffee and a breakfast popper(which are so good and filling) or for lunch for a soup and panini. I love trying their monthly specials. The workers there are always so sweet. Definitely my favorite coffee shop around and such a great addition to the High Ridge community.
name: Toasted Coffee House
categories: Cafes, Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Coffee & Tea

text: Very overpriced. The waitress was very passive aggressive. How a snobll takes longer than a burger, I will never know. The burgers are not great, and expensive. The fries are no good, I'd opt for the onion rings. The salad was ok, once they got it right. I asked for no cheese and no dressing. I got both. Smothered in dressing! I sent that back. Which clearly displeased the waitress. Drinks were good, via my friend's opinion. I just had tea. It was a fun idea, but I wasn't fond of the actual experience.
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text: Haven't even eaten the food but the ordering is painful. It said I could pick it up after 12:20. At 12:40 it still wasn't ready. It doesn't appear to be busy, but given that there is an employ wearing a mask under their nose I don't love spending too much time in here. At this point I see the employee ask someone if they are there for pick up. The sign says if you are getting pick up or delivery to stand in a very specific spot and they were bringing them out to other people so I assumed I wouldn't need to check in as nobody said anything and there was a table there with spots to pickup orders. Turns out that my order had been sitting there the entire time in a black box off to the side . Either have clear signs and follow a system or ask every customer that is standing in the pick up area what their name is.
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text: The Parkmoor is spot on. King Burger is delicious and this version of the Frank with chili is simply fantastic. Not to mention they've added another-balls with adult options just tremendous. And today it was gumbo they surprised us with on the menu.  That's some award winning type of gumbo. Great job Parkmoor. Looking forward to our return.
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text: I will definitely visit this location again!!!! The chicken nuggets were seasoned to perfection & the fries were nice fresh & hot. We also had the fresh squeezed lemonade and I absolutely loved it
name: Phillies Cheesesteaks
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Cheesesteaks

text: The service is great, the portions are big and it has a really cool atmosphere.  I got the parlor dog and my daughter got the crispy chick.  The chili on my hotdog was a little too salty for my taste. The fries and onion rings were quite good.  We also ordered pretzel bites, and they were really good.  Our waitress was so friendly and very sweet.  She was so enthusiastic and made recommendations for us and with so many choices, it was nice to have someone do that.  We ended the night with their shaved ice.  This is a great place to take kids or just have a fun dinner.
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text: Refreshing watermelon flavor without being too fake. Perfect summer treat, but will turn your tongue red
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text:
Extremely average.

I came here yesterday for Burger Week. The place was clean, pretty full, and really loud and rowdy. Noise just bounces from the floor to the ceiling, to the wooden tables/chairs/booths. I couldn't hear myself talking to my sister on the phone, who also said "where are you because it's really loud?" 

To give a quick rundown of the food and my cocktail: the bourbon cocktail I had was excellent! The burger was trying to be on the same level of Shake Shack and doesn't compare. It was bland and basic. Read my experience below for more details on that. The fries are essentially McDonalds fries. Would you pay $13.75 to get McDonalds fries and a lesser version of Shake Shack burger? 

The service was fair but friendly. My waitress suggested that I go with one of their regular menu burgers instead of the $6 Burger Week burger because she said it's really small. I was starving so I agreed. I ordered the King Burger with fries and a bourbon cocktail (the one with mint, simple syrup, and lemon juice, sorry I can't remember the name). 

I got my food really fast, like rocket speed, but it was missing onions which was noted on the menu and my waitress directly told me that "raw onions" come on the burger. I looked throughout my burger and found no onions. I flagged my waitress and told her. She apologized and said she'd go get some, and confirmed if I wanted raw or grilled onions. I replied that I wanted raw. She turns to walk away and 10 seconds later turns back saying that she thinks she sees them on the bottom of my burger. Honey, I've looked and there are none. She stood there and basically had me dissect my double patty burger, ripping the patties apart tearing the cheese up all to show her YET AGAIN, THAT THERE ARE NO ONIONS ON THE BURGER. She then walked away to go get them. Why did she come back less than a minute later with grilled onions saying "I brought you grilled onions because they taste better." Ma'am, I asked for raw. I accepted the grilled, which legit tasted like White Castle onions. They did absolutely nothing for the burger, and I think the raw, as designated on the menu for this burger would have been a much better choice, which was my choice in fact, but I did not complain.

By this point, I was ready to go. They offer basic desserts including snowballs and ice cream, but my experience and the loud noise kept me from wanting to endure this experience any longer. The cocktail is the only redeeming value of my experience as it was exceptionally good, but everything else was subpar from other dining experiences in the near vicinity or greater metro area. This place seems to be confused on what it's trying to be. It has the appearance of a family friendly restaurant with its bright colors and cheerful demeanor, but with a bar, and with loud ambiance. It kind of seems like it's trying to be a kid-friendly sports bar and grill, which you can just do Applebee's, Buffalo Wild Wings, etc. for that. It's too much and not enough at the same time.
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text: A family favorite! The snow cones should not be skipped. Onion Rings with parkmoor sauce, crispy chick with spicy sauce and cheese fries are our faves. Service and quality always great!
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text: I grabbed dinner here last night. Boy I'm glad I did. One of the best sandwiches I've had in a long time. They made it fresh and it tasted that way. Couldn't have picked a better side with those fries too. Delicious! I can't wait to go back and try the other options. My one nit is pricing. If they get me out the door with a combo for $10, I will up this to five stars. I got the big sandwich, fries, and a diet (lol) coke. It set me back $18. Knowing what I know now, I shoulda gotten the half but even that would be around 13-14, idk. I think a $10 combo would get me coming here weekly. At $18, I have to save up and go monthly lol. Either way, you should try it! You can thank me later.
name: Phillies Cheesesteaks
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Cheesesteaks

text: This restaurant is a breath of fresh air during a time of mucho takeout!  Both their Italian and Mexican food is delicious, one of the best in town.  Also, you can order either one on the app if a family member feels like one or the other, so you don't all have to agree.  The pick up process is super efficient.  They have always had our order ready on time.  We appreciate the professionalism and the amazing food!!

text: I didn't realize I was a fan of Cheese Steaks until I had this place! The food is top notch! I've been at least 5 times and haven't had one item that wasn't delicious.  Service is great! Staff is very personable. Highly recommend giving them a try.

text: I love Toasted. My favorite drink is the honey lavender latte (seasonal), but I also really enjoy the white mocha or a vanilla latte. Their breakfast poppers are absolutely divine. The veggie is my favorite. Everyone is so nice and welcoming from the second you walk in. And don't forget to order a loaf of fresh sourdough on your way out! I love having a local, family run coffee shop in town.

categories: Cafes, Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Coffee & Tea

text:
Have seen this all over IG so had to get here. Wednesday visit right when they opened at 11a.  Very clean on the inside. No inside dining, pick up only. 
First order of the day. Classic Philly, easy mayo, Fries and Coke. 
Fries were great! Perfect seasoning and cooked just right. The sandwich, well...it was a mayo sandwich, couldn't really taste much else so therefore, I didn't finish. Live too far to go back.  Fries are my favorite food, so them getting that right sparked the 3, that and that they were super friendly. I know they just opened a few weeks ago, so maybe just some kinks to work out.
I'll try again, this time will ask for no mayo to see how that goes.
name: Phillies Cheesesteaks
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Cheesesteaks

text: Protein is gas. I got the Chicken Fried Rice bowl and it's amazing. Recommend definitely is trying to gain weight. Lowkey should be playing some Youngboy on aux because the aux is trash.

text: I have been to Seoul taco more times than I can count. The location in Columbia, Missouri never disappointed with quality and consistency. The location in the grove is unfortunately disappointing. Consistently I have online ordered my Golgi bowl with a side of Seoul sauce (an extra 50 cents), half of the time once I get home there isn't Seoul sauce, and if there is there is less than a tablespoon, hardly worth fifty cents. Numerous times there is inconsistencies with the Golgi bowl be it missing spicy paste, wrong type of rice, or no Seoul sauce. This place has the chance to be great, but the inconsistencies make it definitely not worth the money.

text:
Love that Seoul Taco has made its way to the Grove. The Grove needs some tacos on the scene for sure. 

The new building is dope, it has this area inside that's like faux-grass and benches... almost like a park?

I came in the other day for an in and out visit. I was in a hurry, so it was brief, but that's exactly what I need from a fast-casual joint. The person who took my order was friendly and informative. I ordered 4 chicken tacos and had a seat. 

The order came out fast, the tacos... piping hot and delicious. Love that they serve them automatically with lime wedges, I always use them all. 

The space was beautiful, open, and clean.

Glad you're in the neighborhood!

text:
OMG!!!!!!!!!!!

I've been many many times to CC's, and I've never had a negative experience. Their vegan food is amazing!

I've been vegan for 3 years, and pre-vegan my favorite food was fried catfish. I'm from the rural South, and I've missed catfish so much. But since going vegan, I've been unable ethically to eat fish. So today - I ordered CC's ish bites. It came with their tartar sauce, onions, and pickles. Can I just tell you - my taste buds went back in time to my childhood - and the many memories I have of eating fried catfish. 

Please - get down to CC's and support this small business! We can't let this place disappear....I'm begging you.
name: CCâs Vegan Spot

text:
I'm so glad that Seoul Taco is in The Grove. I was heading out with a friend and thought we were getting food but nope, he'd just eaten and wanted to go for drinks first. I hadn't eaten all day so since Seoul Taco was near, we just walked across the street. 

Upon walking in, they have 2 machines on the side of the counter where you can place your order. It still kinda freaks me out that machines replace interacting with people, but at least they aren't cooking our food, YET lol. 

I ordered the chicken tacos. They were very meaty and tender! I love that they didn't skimp on the lettuce or sauce either. I only ate 2 but my friend loved being able to eat my leftover one. Next time I come I'll be trying the pork.

text:
Update: Food seems to be more consistent now with each time I order.

This Seoul Taco is by far the worst Seoul Taco location all caused by the staff not caring and obviously management not doing anything about it. I have been to this location for probably close to 200 times and I always get the same thing, a gogi bowl. The only consistent thing about it is that the meat is always seasoned well (the reason I keep coming back) other than that the bowls are never the same. They always pre cook the eggs so they end up being a hard egg, not the sunny side up as it should be. Out of those 200 times I have ordered this bowl I always get it with Seoul sauce, out of those times they have not put it on the bowl at least 150 of those orders. They also have the audacity to charge 50 cents for a tablespoon of that sauce that you may or may not get. I truly think that if the owner would audit this location he would be deeply upset with the quality of food that is coming out of there.
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text:
I love that we are having all sorts of new places opening in my hood! This is no different. Here are some pros and cons of the Parkmoor after two visits:

PROS
- Easy online ordering for curbside and quick delivery of meal
- Outdoor seating that is well spaced (not all gathered in a small area)
- Walk up window to order sno cones
- DELICIOUS sno cones, tons of flavors and sizes, and optional boozy sno
- Delicious fries
- Good portions
- Husband loved the burger

CONS
- Vegetarian options severely lacking. Would love a veggie burger, adult grilled cheese, or a more substantial salad
- Kids grilled cheese was not good (american on white bread)
- One of my big memories from the old Parkmoor was vanilla malts. No shakes/malts on the menu.

Will I be back? Yes for sno and fries, but would love to see those veg options for a full meal to appeal!
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text: We had burgers & snowballs for dessert.  We'll go back but only trying out some other new restaurants that we've been wanting to try too.  Service was a little slow but probably because it d shortage on waitresses?

text: DELICIOUS FOOD! I've been vegan for 4 years, and local vegan places like these make my world go 'round. My friend (vegetarian) and I (vegan, obviously) ordered: fries, the Illy cheesesteak, the buffalo chickN wrap, the cauliflower bites, the notcho nachos, fries, and a mango icee (we were hungry). The food was exquisite. The vegan cheese was creamy and deeply satisfying. Everything was seasoned well. My cheesesteak blew my mind even though I didn't like normal cheesesteaks when I wasn't vegan (it must've been that cheese!). I would give a 6/5 if I could. Will revisit.
name: CCâs Vegan Spot

text: This place is definitely just takeout since there's no seating but it's Covid times so no dining in for me anyway. The cashier was nice. Seems like a popular place since there was a small line when I got there but it went pretty fast. Simple menu with different Philly sandwich options. Got the chicken and the classic steak. It's definitely expensive for Philly sandwiches but you also get a lot of sandwich for the price. They were tasty but I think they should add a little more meat for the price. It was mostly bread. We also got the cheese fries and it was very good as well. Will come back if we feel like Philly sandwiches again.
name: Phillies Cheesesteaks
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Cheesesteaks

text: My family and I have been searching STL for an authentic Philly with actual cheddar Whiz since we got back from Philadelphia about 2-3 years ago. We finally found it! This place has AWESOME food! The sandwiches were perfect, absolutely delicious, and even the special order sandwich was spot on! The bread, the meat, and the cheese we all so good and put together right with plenty of everything. The staff was also very nice and helpful. I cannot recommend this place highly enough!
name: Phillies Cheesesteaks
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Cheesesteaks

text: People were raving about this place so I thought i was in for a treat. The inside is clean and they have good customer service. You can't call in your order so you have to wait, which is not convenient especially with Covid. The inside is small. I think it would be helpful if more people gave some honest feedback about the food. The bread is thick. They may benefit from steaming the bread so that it's softer and moist. The chicken and veggies did not have any flavor on the chicken philly. It tasted like they may have used a cheese blend that included Parmesan cheese which does not compliment a philly well. Hopefully they make some improvements as they go along.
name: Phillies Cheesesteaks
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Cheesesteaks

text: Way way too expensive for what you get. Burgers were bland, fries no better than fast food. Nearly $75 before tip for two of us. I don't mind $$$ on a great restaurant experience but I just don't think the value is here.

text:
My sister gifted me a mea via door dash and I ordered the burrito based off the description on the website. No where on SEOUL TACOS website does it say there is a wasabi sauce on the burrito. I received my food and there was a ton of sauce! I requested no Seoul sauce nor sour cream and yet I bite into and there is sauce everywhere. 
I called and the person I spoke with tells me the wasabi sauce is listed on the description. NO IT IS NOT! Did they offer a replacement? No did he apologize absolutely not.
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text:
We've enjoyed Pi Pizza for years, but tonight it's about what's been added to Pi's Menu.... More Specifically TACOS!

Everyone knows we love a great Taco and tonight we have crowned a new STL area Taco Champion!
Why?  Crunchy Tacos that we had to add.... thats right NOTHING To!
More of a Tex Mex Vibe, yes But what we were after!
The Flavors/Seasonings were spot on!
As I've pointed out before, Most places serve ground beef tacos (IF they serve Ground Beef Tacos at all) they are typically lacking in the seasoning department.  Another plus was the prices are good! 
I've given other local eateries high ratings in the past but their prices can at times lean on the pricey side. These Tacos were priced right and every bit as good as any we've had in the area!

RICO/Pi Menu is a Great Idea, Maybe I want Pizza, and she wants Tacos? Well they do that and do it well.... Oops They say they also have Burgers that are excellent! So the diversity of this menu covers a lot of bases WITHOUT sacrificing quality!  Great Job guys!

BTW Love the new location: Spacious and roomy a great vibe=We will be back!
name: Pi Pizzeria and Â¡RICO! Mexican
categories: Restaurants, Pizza, Tacos, Mexican, Chicken Wings

text:
The cheese fries were among the best I've ever had and you should order them right. now. Or don't, that means more for me, right? My husband had the fried bologna sandwich and loved it and the onion rings were awesome. The single burger was good but the bun is very bread-y for a smaller burger. We will be back probably many, many times and I'm looking forward to trying a sno-ball!

I think my husband prefers this type of vegan food - all of your favorites but vegan - over others - twists on classics - so we will definitely be making this our go-to. Highly recommend!

text: One of the greatest places to dine in St Louis.  My Parents and Grandparents took my brother and me.  My Wife and I were lucky to be able to take our kids to Parkmoor before they closed off of Clayton Road.  Once they reopened we took our Son and Wife with our Grandkids.  They loved it and ask to go all the time.  The Onion rings are amazing and the King Burger too. Everything is the way We remember it was for flavor and the quality is top notch.  Thank you for reopening and helping to keep a tradition alive.  This place reminds me of some of the greatest and happiest times.
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text:
Nutshell:  Food has great fusion flavors, great portions, great price.  Worth a stop in.

I've been to the Delmar location a bunch, but technically this new location is closer...by like a minute.  That's one less minute I have to wait to get that food in my belly!  This is the second time I've been to the new location on Chouteau.  So I'm going to combine.  Both times I ordered pickup on their website and both times I got the chicken burrito.  I always get the chicken burrito, why mess with perfection?!  The burrito is amazing.  It's huge, lil sweet, lil savory, lil spicy.  It's got kimchi fried rice, lettuce, cheese, shredded carrots, green onion, sour cream, and Seoul sauce (not sure what it is, but it rivals Boss sauce...if you know, you know).  I'm not a kimchi person but I really like how they do it, so don't let that sway you away if you're like me.  My total was about $10 and change.  The only difference between the two visits was the pickup process.  The first time, I showed up at my pickup time and everyone and their mother must have ordered at the same time.  They were running behind by about 15-20 minutes, which was apologetically communicated to me.  It was Friday night and I had nothing to rush off to, so I just popped back outside (because people are gross right now) and waited.  After about 15 minutes I went back in and they were still working on orders.  Total I think I waited about 25 minutes.  The staff were a bit frazzled, but they were still pleasant.  I would say this was a freak anomaly.  This time, I popped in early Sunday evening.  I was actually late, so everything was ready to go.  From the signage I could see, I didn't know what the pickup process was and I told the cashier that I had a pickup order and my name.  I felt like this annoyed the guy working the cashier.  To prevent you from making my error, walk in on the Manchester side, bypass the cashier area and go to the back where you see a line of tables.  They do the pickup orders back there.  The guy back there was very nice and I walked out and went home to gorge myself.  I still love the Delmar location best, but this place isn't bad.
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text:
Tried the new Parkmoor today and was not disappointed.  Amy was our server and she was terrific!  We dined outside.  It was a little cool and windy so she turned the heater on upon my request.  Husband got the single cheeseburger and I elected to try the footlong with chili, grilled onions, cheddar and had bacon added.  Both  were delicious.  We both had onion rings and they were right on mark for the beloved Parkmoor from years ago.
Amy was attentive, friendly, accomandating and made our experience very pleasant.   We will be back.
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text:
The Parkmoor was a chain of diners that that had several locations around STL between 1931-1999, and now it's back! This is a retro spot with all of the basic American staples, and they do them well! They also have both indoor and outdoor seating, as well as a HUGE variety of "snow-balls" (AKA snow cones) for desert).

I tried their wings, nachos, and a "wedding cake" snow cone and it was all delicious! Great new addition to the STL food scene!
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text: The nostalgic tastes you remember from the original Parkmoor. The onion rings...those sweet sweet onion rings and that king burger are what dreams are made of. Run, don't walk!

text: Thank you for having a vegan Philly!  It was very delicious!  After a rough first day open, I returned a few weeks later and the place seems to have gotten the kinks out of the new spot.  Very happy they decided to move to STL from Alton.  CC is so nice!  Can't wait to try the other items.  Always great to have another vegan comfort food spot to go to!

text: We ordered 3 Chicken Tacos and 2 Bulgogi Burritos.  The Burritos were wrapped loosely in a tortilla, and then wrapped half-ass in aluminum foil thus the Burritos were falling apart in the paper bag.  We ordered two different Burritos yet they weren't labeled denoting which was which.  The tables were dirty, the floors were dirty, the soda machine was out of order, and the garbage cans were overflowing.  The Covid excuse only goes so far... this is a case of terrible management, manifesting itself in poor employee training.  Of course it could just be piss-poor employees.  What a shame because the foods not bad.

text: I live in High Ridge and am embarrassed to admit I didn't even know the Toasted Coffee House was two miles from my house. Well, I stopped in this morning, grabbed a large cup of freshly brewed Colombian coffee, and it was grrrrreat. I didn't sample any of their bakery goods, as tempting as they looked, but I'm sure they're delicious, too. I'll visit again and will take my wife with me next time. text: I have been dying to try C.C.'s so I finally made the trip for the last day of the special "chicken" dinner. It absolutely did not disappoint. I tried so many things and they were all delicious! I am glad I tried two different types of lemonade, the cherry wasn't my jam but the pink lemonade was fabulous! I also got the pita with hummus which was quite tasty. The "chicken" dinner came with a side "bacon chicken" salad which was very good and would probably have been pretty good on its own! I was so happy to have mashed potatoes with gravy, I can't even remember the last time I had gravy (one of the few things I miss as a vegetarian). The online ordering process was great and I didn't even have to get out of the car. I really wish I had an excuse to go to Alton more often because I can't wait to try more things on the menu!

text: So Cheesesteak?  Lots of places advertise them and here in flyover country I am always looking for a Genos or a Pats. I mean seriously, how hard can it be?  Bun, Steak, whiz, onions. It does not seem like rocket science. But although some folks get close it is never quite right. I am not saying Phillies is perfect. But it is pretty damn close. We went on a Friday night. It was a treat. We did not pre order. You can check their menu. On our first trip we got bastardized chicken and steak with whiz and onions. They had Super Bowl special and we got a whole for the price of a half. Very friendly and it took about ten minutes. There is no real seating and we wanted it hot so we ate I. The car so I couldn't take a picture. It was awesome, savory and no chewy pieces. My wife raved about it and I thought it was very good. Fries were crispy with that crispy coating that I don't love but it worked. Drink selections were limited to kool aid amd lemonade or water. I am looking forward to running up there from Clayton and getting lunch.
name: Phillies Cheesesteaks
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Cheesesteaks

text:
I was surprised and pleased to find a new Pizzeria location on Manchester! That being said, if you're used to the old Manchester Pi Pizzeria location with the nice ambiance and plentiful indoor and outdoor dining options then you'd be better served going to another location. 

This spot is more for carry out orders as they only have a few tables. That being said, they still offer the same Pi Pizzeria favorites with the added bonus of Rico's Tacos. The staff was friendly and our order only took about 20 minutes for the pizza  which is to be expected. We ordered a Rico Pi and tried a Carnitas taco. It had good flavor and while far superior to Taco Bell or other fast food Mexican spots it definitely was not an authentic Mexican taco. Overall, this place definitely works for a solid pizza/taco takeout option.
name: Pi Pizzeria and Â¡RICO! Mexican
categories: Restaurants, Pizza, Tacos, Mexican, Chicken Wings

text: Always so fast, friendly, and delicious! I love the shaken espresso with oat milk and brown sugar. The baristas are so sweet, and the space is nice to study or read in.

categories: Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants

text:
As I am not a native of St. Louis, I cannot claim any specific knowledge of the "original" Parkmoor, of which I understand this to be a re-boot or re-imagining.  My visit for lunch today was therefore not an exercise in nostalgia, but a search for a clean, comfortable, casual, friendly and reasonably priced restaurant serving what has come to be called "comfort food" - great hamburgers, sandwiches, salads, etc.  
The Parkmoor certainly checks all the boxes on the first three factors - clean, yes (although some of the servers masks failed to cover noses or mouths); casual (yes, with colorful but somewhat plain looking wooden chairs, tables and booths inside); and service was efficient and friendly, certainly as to our personable waitress and the waiter we frequently overheard.
Reasonably priced?  Well, I'll give them that too, as while prices seemed a touch high on the menu, portions were fairly large and many patrons, ourselves included, took home a loaded to-go box from the tall and long entrees (e.g., a fried baloney sandwich served on two grilled cheese sandwiches).
But great comfort food?  Sorry, not to my taste.  Mediocre or average at best, to be kind. 
The Philly cheesesteak, described on the menu as "slow roasted beef griddled with green peppers, caramelized onions, giardiniera (pickled vegetables), finished with melted provolone and liquid gold cheese sauce" was seemingly composed of Arby's roast beef with few green pepper fragment, no onions (but instead a bevy of garlic cloves - same color?), three slivers of pickled carrots (which ain't giardiniera in Chicago or Philly, as far as I know) with two slices of provolone and a cheese sauce not unlike the radioactive, non-perishable cheese sauce often found on movie or sporting event nachos.  I derived little true comfort from this cheesesteak.  (P.S. - fries were very salty and not very hot.)
My advice - go for the nostalgia, but ... eat the entrees only if you need to invoke the good ole memories.  (And I don't recommend the cheesesteak.)
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text: Love Seoul Taco! This location is a bit more chill than the other location and has a different vibe but still such good food and staff. I usually order a chicken quesadilla and an order of chips and queso! One of my fav places in St. Louis!

That said, the gf buns were better than most. I will be back.

text:
My friend wanted to find a place to dine outdoors for lunch so since Parkmoor was on my shortlist of places to try we went there.

Thankfully we got a spot under the umbrella in the shade. Flies were abundant but I guess that comes with being outside right?. 

We were quickly approached by our server and I honestly could not decide what I wanted to eat because everything sounded really good. I asked our waiter what he recommended and he suggested the Shrimp Po Boy. I was eyeballing that as an option so I went ahead with it.

My friend got the chicken sandwich and we both got fries as our side. I was surprised at how fast the food came out, but thankful as I was on a lunch break. Everything was hot and fresh and looked delicious.  I was very pleased with my choice. The shrimp was really good and tasty. I was hoping a few more pieces would be hiding amongst the sauce and lettuce since I couldn't eat all of the bread.

Our waiter Mason was great. Perfect amount of check-ins, very knowledgeable about the menu and a great attitude. 

I'm really happy I tried this place and I'll definitely be back to try the menu.
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text: I'm giving this place three stars for food and an extra star for customer service. I was really surprised that the bread was so soft. I'm not sure if there's an option for toasted but I would prefer that. The sandwich filling made the bread soggy. The cheese fries were ok. My expectation wasn't met as far as the seasoning but I would be willing to give it another try with the chicken Philly. The customer service was great!

Overall I loved the food! I can't wait to come back sometime!

text: At long last, the holy grail of Philly cheesesteaks has arrived to the Midwest. St. Louis has long been in need of an authentic cheesesteak place and Phillies is that answer!! I cannot stress this enough. I tried the Authentic Philly Steak (steak, cheese whiz, onions) -- I thought I was back in Philadelphia, delicious! Got a bag of fries as well -- second to none! Chatted with the CEO and it sounds like he really did his research which it definitely shows, with the variety in their menu and great customer service. As a transplant from the Philly area, I can say this is my cheesesteak spot from now on, 10/10 will be coming back. Keep up the great work. Philly would be proud!
name: Phillies Cheesesteaks
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Cheesesteaks

text:
If you want something different and something quickly becoming a St. Louis staple due to some hype and the success of this restaurant from their food truck days; come check out the Seoul. I loved the layout and interior of Seoul Taco! Staff was great and friendly - no complaints 

Food: Although, different and very "clean" was not to the taste that I was expecting based off what I had come to expect. Let's dig in:

Gogo Bowl w/ steak: I am really not sure what I ate 

Tacos Chicken & Steak: These were my favorite of everything tired; the Seoul Sauce was delicious however, I received mostly lettuce on my tacos and little to no meat. 

Kimchi Fried Rice: Basic and blend completely under whelming; and disappointing. I would have been better served getting rice from Panda Express. 

Until next time.

Cheers,
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean
