text:
We got takeout from the Rico Mexican menu tonight and tried the chicken burrito, carnitas burrito, and a quesadilla kid's meal for my daughter. 

The chicken burrito was delicious, albeit the texture was very homogeneous and it was hard to tell where the rice and cheese was; I think it was mostly refried beans and chicken. I didn't realize that the carnitas burrito had chorizo,  which had a powerful, overwhelming spice/flavor. I loved the salsa and guacamole, which paired well with the burritos.  

My daughter loved her cheese quesadilla but they used the same rice and refried beans in the kids' meal and she was not able to eat it because they were too spicy. I will try the pizza side of their menu next time. It's a convenient location with ample seating and parking.
name: Pi Pizzeria and Â¡RICO! Mexican
categories: Restaurants, Pizza, Tacos, Mexican, Chicken Wings

text:
The classic look of The Parkmoor on Yelp has caught my eye more than a few times as it keeps popping up on Collections of burger joints and lunch spots in the Lou. My former coworker, Lucas, and I like to periodically catch up over lunch. We usually have to meet in Webster Groves as it is kind of the middle point between his new office and my (home) office. The Parkmoor's bold presence on the web definitely sets it apart from other lunch spots and caught our interest for one of our lunchtime pow-wows. 

Finding the The Parkmoor is super simple. It's located on the bustling business district portion of Lockwood. I easily found on street parking, but had to dodge a few cars going a tad too fast for such a pedestrian heavy locale. 

The retro interior of The Parkmoor is so engaging. Bold colors. Strong lines. And a subtle sports theme. The restaurant had a vibrant energy that lent itself to a jovial meeting with Lucas! Additionally, our waitress was such a gem. She was polite and not pushy. Definitely added to the feel-good vibes of The Parkmoor. 

I will be the first to admit that I'm not the biggest burger person. They're fine. I just never get excited about them. EEEEEEESpecially when they're served on brioche. Ok. So I hate brioche buns. It is objectively the actual worst bread out there. Dryer than saltines. For YEARS I've voiced my displeasure with restaurants touting this garbage excuse of a carb as a high end bread. It's trash. stop using it everywhere. Please. I was a bit bummed that the menu at The Parkmoor didn't clearly identify the bun as brioche, but simply a buttered bun. Had I known I would have ordered something else. But I made it work. Slather enough ketchup on a brioche bun and it'll pass. The actual flavors of my mushroom swiss burger were really good. The mushrooms were tender and added a little extra heft to the smash patties.

Since this lunch was pre-2022 and I wasn't really paying attention to what I was eating, I started the meal with a bowl of their gumbo. The bowl was massive and definitely enough for a meal! I appreciated the selection of hot sauces The Parkmoor offered. I would absolutely get the gumbo again.

Excited to visit The Parkmoor again during the summer to try one of their New Orleans style sno cones. The photos make them look like the perfect summer treat. Especially because you can add a little booze to them to get your night started.
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

text:
I remember going to The Parkmoor in Clayton with my mom as a kid. I'm a sucker for nostalgia and my visit here took me back. Katie is so friendly and took excellent care of us. We tried the buffalo chicken toasted ravioli. Red hot ripplet seasoning is my kryptonite! I enjoyed super grilled cheese sandwich with onion rings. The rings were crispy and the best beer batter. The grilled cheese was phenomenal. It comes with caramelized onions which elevated a grilled cheese sandwich to next level. Not to mention the pimento cheese!!! We enjoyed boozy sno cones  in a variety of flavors. Hands down definitely a must visit from the friendliness of the team to the delicious food and the dose of childhood nostalgia. 
p.s. try the cheese sauce with your fries!!
name: The Parkmoor
categories: American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Burgers, Food, Desserts, Restaurants

I enjoyed my first visit to CC's. They only take orders online and are currently doing carry out due to COVID. 

I was firstly excited to have a vegan restaurant so close to home. So after reading about it I hopped in my car and drove to Alton. 

I ordered the beet burger and fried oyster mushrooms. Everything was packaged in earth friendly recycled paper. The mushrooms come with 2 sauces- a sweet & spicy honey mustard as well as a dill sauce. Both were delicious!

I also enjoyed my beet burger and it was tasty too. I wish I had gotten the double burger, but I'll do that next time. 

There was lots of traffic and I can't wait to visit again.
name: CCâs Vegan Spot

text:
Fit Flavors is my new jam! 

I cycle right around the corner at CycleBar, and I dropped in here because of Yelp and a recommendation from my friend Natalie K. 

They have an amazing smoothie bar. I'm totally a creature of habit. I've been in twice and have gotten the same thing both times. A protein filled chocolate peanut butter smoothie with a banana added... yes please. You can get them in a couple different sizes, but I got the largest one. They use 1st phorm protein in their smoothies, which is dope. 1st form is a clean and high quality line of health and wellness products. 

Both times I stopped in I also got the Sesame Chicken. Holy smokes. So good. So fresh. The perfect amount of filling and light. I worked out 30 mins after I had a meal. The meals are packaged and easy to take with you on the go. They have microwaves, so you can prep your meal quickly and be in and out. 

I'm so pumped to have discovered this place. I've got to check out the Richmond Heights location next.
name: Fit-Flavors

text:
I was extremely excited to try this place after seeing the ads in IG. I love  The OG Chessesteaks from PA.  When we were on/go to the east coast I don't leave without stopping by a good sandwich joint.   So needless to say the commercial had me geeked.  

As we walked in the atmosphere was pleasant thanks to the very hospitable cashier. As we began to order I was like thumbs up  to their specialty drinks which included but not limited to KoolAid yep that's right good ole fashioned koolaid.... Although I didn't partake in this indulgent I was delighted and a bit tickled to see it as a drink option.  

Now with so many good things, it would be a triple A if the food lived up to its name, and here's were it goes average.... The sandwich I order the Classic tasted nothing like one from PA and the other sandwich the Buffalo chicken well was seasoned the same.  I truly don't care for it when all items on the menu tasted the same... Now I remind you we only had two sandwiches so I'm not says all their sandwiches tasted the same only the two we had....

Anywho I was impressed that our food stayed warm cause we had a ways to travel about 20 mins or more. And although it's not a PA Philly steak it was no bad either... Glad We tried it but don't see us going back.  Oh no pictures cause by the time we got home that was the last thing I was doing... lol
name: Phillies Cheesesteaks
categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Cheesesteaks

text: First time trying CCs Vegan Spot! Everyone was welcoming as soon as you walked in. The menu is completely vegan and delicious! Got the Double Trouble Burger and Mac N Cheese. The burger was huge with loads of toppings. Their menu is online only. So make sure you have a way to look it up online. The wait for food is approx 15min. I'd advise ordering online prior to arrival if you don't want to wait.

text: We ordered in store. I was told there would be a wait maybe 20 minutes. I waited 1 HOUR! For 2 sandwiches that where mediocre at best. They were moderately busy. As someone that works the line in a restaurant the wait was ridiculous for the amount of orders they had on the rail. I'm willing to wait but the food wasn't not worth it. There customer  service was good but you would wait 15 minutes at the register to get your order taken so I recommend ordering online but even then I saw people wait 40 minutes for a online order. The manger left at one point to go to the store to grab a ingredient they ran out of. At this time the cook was not able to take walk in orders and had them wait for the manger to return

text: My first time at this location, and was a bit let down.  Don't get me wrong, the food was great.  Seana ordered the Munchwrap which was just STUPENDOUS!  We shared some Kimchi Slaw and an order of dumplings.  I got my normal Gogi Bowl with brown rice and spicy pork, and none of these items disappointed.  But we got there shortly after they'd opened, and the floors looked like they hadn't been swept or mopped in quite some time.  Also, we ordered a fountain drink, intending to mix unsweetened ice tea with lemonade.  They were out of BOTH, and knew it (when Seana asked, they said, "oh yeah, we're out of those."), so WHY didn't they have it posted???  Seoul Taco hasn't lost me as a customer, but I think this particular location has.
name: Seoul Taco
categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Mexican, Food, Asian Fusion, Korean

text: Went on opening day at their new location on Loughborough.  Food took a little longer than expected,  but hey, it was their 1st day. And it wasn't that long. The food was totally worth it! text:
Welcomed me when I walked in. Parking is limited and right off of a busy street so don't park in convenient spots if you don't want your car to get scratched or bumped. 

Bathroom is clean. Not a lot of seating. It's in a plaza so there is no drive-thru. 

They have a lot of staff and seem to get the job done quick. 

Popular location for plugging up for productivity, so get there quick!
name: Starbucks
categories: Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants

text:
I've heard that several major cities have been seeing shops pop up where they offer healthy, fit meals in bulk for you to pick up at your convenience. When I found out that St. Louis had one, I knew that I needed to stop on by to see what they had to offer. Fit-Flavors is conveniently located off of Olive Blvd, and it's easy to get to. When you walk in you'll see tables up front, a couple of microwaves to heat up food, several fridges with breakfast, lunch/dinner, snacks, and dessert options with macros listed on the side. They have a great variety of options, including gluten free! 

On my first visit I stopped at the smoothie bar for a delicious smoothie, but I also picked up the chocolate zucchini gluten free cakes. Per recommendation of the cashier I put them in the microwave to warm them up a bit... and oh boy was she right. They were so moist and you couldn't tell they they had zucchini in there. One of the slices of cake was about 140 calories and had fairly balanced macros too. 

 Later on when trying this again I had the steak fajitas meal. Macros were well balanced and the flavor was on point! I didn't feel deprived and hungry after eating either. I like how they have these in the hospitals (had one when on assignment at Mercy Hospital) for a good healthy option on the go! I'm sure they are elsewhere, but that's just where I found this.

Absolutely give these meals a try. I want one of these back in Indy!!
name: Fit-Flavors

text:
My husband and I went there for dinner last night. We tried the rainbow jalapeÃ±o appetizer with several cuts of fish in a yummy sauce with jalapeÃ±os on top. The fish tasted fresh, and the sauce was a nice complement. 

We thought the waitress was very prompt with seating us, taking our orders, and checking on us throughout the meal.

For dinner we shared 3 roll: Volcano roll, dragon roll, and the body roll. We were delightfully surprised at how good each sushi roll was and could not decide our favorite. The flavors were on point. We are excited to find a delicious sushi restaurant so close to home. We will definitely be returning.
name: Fuji Sushi

text:
I've seen this place a few times when jumping on I-55.  It's right by the entrance ramp of the Imperial to 55 north. 

Inside the place is new but a little tacky.   Oh well.  I didn't come here based on the decor.  It is in a Jefferson County strip mall.

I tried the seaweed salad, the New Orleans roll, and Rocky II roll.  The salad was fresh.  The rolls were packed with flavor and very large and everything seemed to be made with care. Based on the location and decor, I didn't think the food was going to be this good.

For sushi lovers, this place is a gem.  There are many other items on the menu other than sushi so don't feel like you can't bring your sushi-intimidated friends.  Prices are reasonable, service was average.

One odd complaint... the table must have had a bow in it... the plates all rocked and spun around.
name: Fuji Sushi

text:
It's been a couple years at least, but I have been here twice with my husband & on a third occasion for take-out.

It has always been pretty good!  The only time the food wasn't perfect was when we got it to go.  We got all the way out to my mother-in-law's & my husband said something was wrong with his order, but it was still edible.  I think it was a wrong item & a missing item if I remember right.  We were hungry & he didn't want to drive back out there.

I know I have usually gotten the avocado roll.  I have also tried the dragon roll, I believe it was called.  Avocado & tempura, etc. in the roll.  I have also had the vegetable tempura.  I must admit I am not certain if the batter is vegan, but it does taste pretty good, especially if you're lucky enough to get a mushroom.  =)  I have always been surprisingly full when dining here & order too much.  I wouldn't mind getting extra to take home if we ever get to return.

We have enjoyed going here to get out of the house.  It has nice decor & a decent atmosphere.  Could be a little more lively perhaps.  Take a sweater when the a/c is on, but that is true of most restaurants in summertime.  Fuji is definitely a gem that I didn't expect to find in a mini mall in Imperial, Missouri.  

I would definitely go back anytime for some more food & Japanese beer.  They also have sake if you're into that like my husband.  I have yet to acquire a taste for it.  We did take pictures of our food on our last visit dining in, if that tells you anything.
name: Fuji Sushi

We were driving through town and came here on a whim based on Yelp reviews. What a great neighborhood bar/restaurant. We sat at the bar and the bartenders were great! 

Lucky for us it was steak night so the ribeye was on special. It was served sizzling on a plate. The food was great. We shared a couple sides and the beets were awesome. We also ordered the toasted ravioli which was done wonderfully. 

This place is tucked away but I can't recommend it enough. I'd probably visit frequently if I lived nearby.

text:
The Pine Room. It's small and quaint and dark. It's one of those bar restaurants that kind of reminds you of Cheers. 
Okay so here's the DL on The Pine Room. The fam and I decided to stop by here for a Friday night dinner. While the fam ordered burgers, I stepped out on the wild side and ordered the liver and onions. 
It comes with two side, so I opted for vegetable beef soup and home fries. 
The soup wasn't anything special. I'm going to assume that it was beef stock, some canned carrots, and potatoes. The down side to the soup was that is only had one piece of beef. I just happened to have pictured it. 
I was more impressed with the liver and onions and home fries. 
Perfectly cooked and full of flavor. It have a great crust on it that tasted of pepper. The onions were perfectly cooked which complemented the liver perfectly. To top off the liver and onions, was a perfectly flavored brown gravy. I could have drank it by the cup full. But I held back for fear of embarrassing the fam (I've been known to do that in the past). 
The home fries were large cubed potatoes which were deep fried ( and we know everything tastes better fried) and seasoned perfectly with what seemed like pepper and salt and some other hidden spice
Really there were two downsides to this place, one was the vegetable beef soup, the other was it was way too dark in the place. While I understand you want to set the ambience, the lack of light made me feel like were eating in a cave. 
Overall I found this place to be really nice and am willing to try it again and update my review. I would recommend trying it out but it's not high on my list.
name: Pine Room

text:
So, this place is a bar. I don't think Yelp makes that super clear. It's a loud, smokey, dark, video game filled bar with uneven tables and questionable cleaning practices. That being said, they served me the best drink I've ever had- a pineapple upside down cake martini. Girly, yes, but even my beer drinking husband liked it. His only complaint was their lack of beer selection. 

The food was REALLY good. Unexpectedly so. Burgers tasted homemade. Fries and onion rings were crispy and delicious. Stuffed jalapeÃ±os were awesome. The food could easily stand at a more typical restaurant. 

While I wouldn't recommend this place to just anyone, I enjoyed it. It was a great value for some good food.
name: D's Place

text: D's Place is a good little bar to drink cheap. They recently remodeled and it's now a no smoking establishment. They have excellent food and their ranch and blue cheese dressing is the bees knees. However, the service is usually pretty bad. It seems like every time I come into D's, the bartenders are busy chatting up the 'regulars' at the bar. Actually walked out of here on a Friday night after sitting at a table for 35 minutes without being served or acknowledged by any of the staff. My fiance got a drink from the bar and asked for a menu after about 15 minutes of waiting. We finished our drinks, waited a few more minutes, paid our tab at the bar then left. I've been in here a bunch of times and the service is always pretty slow, but someone eventually comes to take your order. Usually. It's a cool bar, but I feel like if the bartenders don't know you, they aren't really concerned with taking your order or acknowledging your existence. Great wings though.
name: D's Place

text:
D's has been open for a while now, but I've always been scared to go into the place because I heard it was filled with ho's--or is it hoes? Regardless, I don't like ho's/hoes; they annoy me because they think I'm really that shallow to tip them more than normal because of their big boobs/ exposed thong/ pierced belly button. Show me a place with ho's, and I'll show you a place without me (I know--its inversely related to "College Me."). 

Anyway, so I finally take the step, literally, into D's Place, and what do you know? No ho's/hoes! In fact, there were no servers at all!

When we walked in three guys said hi to us--and not like, "what's up, fellow bar patron," but more like "hello, and welcome to D's." I thought the first two were employees, so I was going to ask if there were servers, or if we simply went up to the bar--but then they left. When the third came by our table and saluted us in the same manner, I simply ignored him, thinking he too was just another customer, but then he asked us if we'd been helped. 

Jesus, I suck at this game. 

So the waitress/bartender finally comes over for our order--which takes forever to get, and when we asked for menus, she brought them over and didn't come back for 15 minutes. Redonkulous. 

Anyway, the most important thing: drinks here--that is, domestic beer and well drinks--are ALWAYS $2. And these aren't served in rocks glasses (for the drinks), they're served in PINT glasses. Also, for you bartenders/drunks out there, its not a tall, its an actual double pour pint glass. 

So, to recap: crappy service (at least on a Wednesday evening), $2 Big Boy cocktails. WINNER!

This place is a serious dive bar. Its the place where you go after playing pick up basketball with your friends because you don't care what you look like. Just make certain to go to the bar instead of waiting for it to come to you.

Oh, but don't eat here--the food is crap. 

NO HO'S!
name: D's Place

text:
I only regret that I waited so long to step foot into this place. The other reviews are right- a lot of regulars hang out here, but every time we go here, we feel welcome by everyone. This should not be seen as a negative thing.

Their wings are fantastic, and they have a really good side salad. The chicken strips are not your standard strips- they are seasoned very well and very crispy. Burgers, buffalo chicken sandwich, and potato skins are also great! One thing that shocked us is that they have some of the best crab Rangoon we have had in St Louis. We ordered it one night after a few too many beers, and it is now something we crave on a regular basis. You really can't go wrong here, folks!
name: D's Place

text:

Check the large sign above the bar for nightly drink specials and the smaller menu board underneath it for food specials.  If you can stand smoking, give them a try. 

Oh... and there are no waiters.  You have to order at the bar.

text: My husband and I tried this restaurant because it is right by our house. I wish I could recommend it since it is a local establishment, but the sushi was absolutely terrible. I have been to dozens of other sushi restaurants in St. Louis that were better than this - even Dierbergs take home sushi is better! The rolls were small and were loosely held together. The salad had a very watery dressing with pineapple chunks in it. My husband had steak teriyaki which may as well have been boiled because it had no flavor, with some teriyaki sauce poured over it. Not a great dinner experience, especially for the price.

text:
D's Place in Soulard... oh how I miss thee.  Let me count the ways...
1) Tuesday night trivia... debauchery and drinking with relatively easy questions.  
2) Bingo night.  Come in with your pants pulled over your belly button and white socks with loafers... everyone is doing it.
3) Half price pizzas during all the home team games... Plus happy hour is 11-7.  I've never been happy for 8 hours in a row in my life... except for that one time in Mexico... but let's not go there.
4) Sunday brunch with $15 bottomless mimosas from 11-3.  My record is 27... can you beat me?
5) Food better than it should be... try the hand-made buffalo chicken wontons.
6) Some of the best bartenders around.  Jess is a true gem.  Ask for her shot specialty... it's called a chicken-bomb.  It'll get you effed up and feeling like Donald Trump imitating Richard Simmons.
name: D's Place

text:
Fantastic Place! Just discovered this hidden gem upon recommendation from my friends. The atmosphere is nice, clean and modern. The food is probably the best sushi I've had in the area, although admittedly, I haven't eaten at too many sushi places in the Midwest.
This was my first visit, and I ordered the sushi lunch platter which included four sushi pieces, a California roll and small cup of miso soup - all for less than 10 dollars. The sushi I ordered, two Tuna and two Salmon, came out looking and tasting very fresh. I also hear great things about the Yaki Soba here.
With the quality of the food, extensive selection on the menu and great prices, this is definitely a place I'll be returning to and recommend it for anyone looking for good Sushi in the area.
name: Fuji Sushi

text:
Fuji sushi is located in a small strip mall just off of the Imperial exit on Highway 55 on the way to Kimmswick.  I ordered a large to go order.  I ordered the pineapple fried rice that came with good quality and large shrimp and scallops.  Very pleased.  I ordered the Philadelphia roll and asked for fresh salmon instead of smoke salmon.  They complied and the generous portion of salmon was very fresh.  Unfortunately, the volcano roll, asparagus roll and eel roll were drenched in a sweet sauce and so rich that they were inedible.  Epic fail on the overall sushi quality, which stinks since that is primarily what they serve.  The tempura we ordered was just okay, as well, but it was carry out, which is never a good idea for fried food.  

Overall, I would say that it wouldn't be m first choice of sushi bars in the area, but I would order some of the other items  If you do order sushi, ask them to avoid or go light on the sauces.
name: Fuji Sushi

text:
Another fun Soulard Dive bar, I returned to D's Place on Saturday night after the Blues game to catch up with my friend's bachelor party.  I hadn't been here since I moved out of Soulard and the place hasn't changed.  

Plenty of games to play in the place, just watch your step moving from the bar area to the game room, especially if you've had a bit too much to drink and aren't paying attention.  Golden Tee, Big Buck Hunter, and Silver Strike were all still there with a dart board as well.  

Drinks aren't that expensive and they do have some interesting shots.  They have a sign above the entrance to the game room that has the special shots for that day.  Since I don't do shots (that often) I couldn't tell you what the featured shot was for Saturday night.  The Bartenders were great, especially when dealing with the rowdy crowd of the party I was with but a good time was had by all.  

Definitely one of the places I miss since moving out of Soulard.  Hope to come back again soon.
name: D's Place

text:
D's Place is a dive bar located in Soulard just blocks from the brewery. Since it is a dive bar, I am rating it accordingly. It's smoky, has lots of video games, a big domestic beer list, and it could do with a good cleaning. 

On the plus side, it is a combo neighborhood bar and brewery employee fave. So, there is a good cross section of people. They have karaoke on Mondays with a small, but fun group and the staff is nice. 

Another plus is that they actually serve good pub grub. Meaning the food is homemade, not over the top with breading on every item and not freezer to fryer. The pizza's, fried pickles, and burgers are homemade and yum. They also have a large variety of wings/sauces.
name: D's Place

text: I was craving sushi and decided to stop by on my way home for take out. I had seen this sushi restaurant before and did not have high expectations. For some reason sushi from Imperial Missouri does not sound the most appetizing. The place does not look so great from the outside but I was quite impressed with how authentic the restaurant looked on the inside. I ordered the rainbow roll and sake nigiri sushi to go. It only took the chef about 5 minutes to make. The fish tasted very fresh and I was pleasantly surprised. I will definitely come back.
name: Fuji Sushi

text:
This is the kind of place where literally everyone knows your name or at least tries to. I went there on an offer from my future father in law and was not disappointed. If this place tried to be anything other than a neighborhood bar, then it would fail, but tucked away in the quiet streets of St. Charles, this place has found a home.

When we walked in there was nobody else there but you wouldn't know it. Greeted and introduced and had our drinks before I even got warm from the walk. I'm a stranger there but the talk quickly turned to regulars and what they had been up to lately. We weren't doing food so the very modestly priced drinks shook off the cold and made for a great, albeit short visit.

I can't say that this is gonna be a regular stop for me because I'm coming from the city, but I know that if I'm ever in the mood for a good drink and good company when I'm in St. Charles then I'll just head to the Pine Room.
name: Pine Room

text:
This is about as close to "your neighborhood watering hole" as it can get. It can go from quiet to party in a matter of minutes, so just be aware of that - it is Soulard after all. 

Biggest surprise about this place: the food! Their wings, spicy chicken sandwich, burgers, and pizza are all great. All homemade salad dressings. 

Service is typically one bartender and no servers, so be prepared to wait a bit. If you're not in a hurry, which you shouldn't be here, it's not a big deal.

Overall surprisingly good food for a neighborhood pub. Definitely worth stopping in.
name: D's Place

text:
I love Mike's advice... "It's a dive.  Know it, expect it, embrace it."

If you go there with that knowledge, D's won't let you down.  Simply put, people come here to get drunk.  And by people, I'm not excluding the bartenders or servers.  They're good at what they do and are up for coaxing you into a shot or two.  Julie, Jess, Michelle and Barbie have all successed in getting me loopy and I'm sure the whole lot of them could drink me under the table.

The service is much better at the bar than at the tables.  Many times the bartender is also the server so the closer to the bar you are the better your service may be.

The food here is average, but you're usually too drunk to tell.  I actually like their nachos.  It's not a pile of mess, they individually lay out and dress each chip.  

Don't come here on a first date.  Don't come here dressed to impress.  Don't come here expecting white glove service.  There are many other places in Soulard for those type of nights.  Come here to blow $40 on booze, food, and a juke box and be prepared to take a cab home.
name: D's Place

Spinach was cooked perfectly and mushrooms were sautÃ©ed - really adding a lot of flavor to the omelette . Husband had the cornbeef hash which was quite good, but serving was a little smaller than expected. Service was great, prices reasonable. We'll be back!

text: We were incredibly disappointed. It took our waitress about 5-7 minutes to greet us. Over hearing other waitresses and other tables, none of them had a lot of knowledge about the menu. We end up ordering right away and it took about 20 minutes to get a loaded hash brown and a stuffed biscuit and gravy. Seemed like an odd wait time for such simple items. The sausage gravy had no sausage in it and had no flavor, just looked like glue. The hash browns weren't cooked very much and in the middle they were raw. The stuffed biscuit was hard and the peppers and onions were raw. Overall, disappointed.
name: Sunny Street Cafe

text:
Wife ordered Eggs Benedict and I ordered Low Country Benedict. Hollandaise sauce on my wife's dish had a very thick consistency and was much darker yellow. Could benefited from adding a little lemon juice or water to thin it down. Flavor of sauce was ok. 

Low Country Benedict was ok, chicken was a little overcooked and dry but the biscuit was delicious.  (Pictured)

Took a little while to be helped after being sat then waitress forgot about the coffee we ordered. 

Not sure it was worth the $26.xx but we will give it another try in a few months and see if things smooth out. Always nice to see new establishments and definitely want to give money back to local business owners whenever possible.

text:
I have to be honest when i say that i have never really had much sushi, even thought i knew i would like it. With that said, myself and my faithful restaurant companion decided to take the VERY long hike (down the street literally!) to this place to try it out.

What did i think? AWESOME! I was super happy with both the service and the food and the prices! I decided to try one of their Bento Special. That had some tasty osumashi soup, salad and i tried the shrimp tempura - which then had some rice, california rolls and some shumai. Each part of the bento was delicious, and there was ALOT in it. I was suprised at how much was in the box. Excellent!


I will definitely have to come back and taste some more of their deliciousness! Yum!
name: Fuji Sushi

text:
Ate breakfast with a party of four and we were all underwhelmed. One person ordered the entree with eggs, pancakes and bacon.  The eggs and bacon were ok, nothing noteworthy. The pancakes were a short order and were very heavy to the point of rejecting half the order.  Another oder was just the pancakes.  Same complaint. Very thick and heavy.  I had the Denver omelet which I have mixed reviews. It was fully loaded with the incredients, however the veggies were cut into huge chunks that were not sautÃ©ed making them too crunchy to enjoy. Another big disappointment were the grits that had a bad under taste .  

The place also suffered from a new staff being unfamiliar with their jobs (slow server and the cashier not knowing how to operate the cash drawer).

We may be back in a few months and hopefully, by then, they will have gotten it on track.
name: Sunny Street Cafe

text: I love brunch, and cute brunch places. This was a good option for brunch and lunch with a friendly environment. The ground and tables were clean, the servers were very pleasant, and speed was decent (to be greeted, seated, and served). My party ordered the cinnamon crunch pancakes, which were EXCELLENT in taste and portion, and the classic eggs benedict, which was underwhelming and not worth the $10, but I didn't have to cook it and the server really was delightful, so I'm considering it a wash and will focus on the huge omelettes I saw or another of the enticing pancake selection. There's also a large space for private parties.

text:
When looking to visit a bar in Soulard that I hadn't been to before D's place was the winner! I don't know why I never visited before, shame on me! 

We arrived on a Sunday night and it wasn't very packed at all. We managed to grab some seats at the bar and our server/bartender was quick to offer us drinks! The group I was with was ecstatic since they were able to play their hunting arcade game...but I just chose to watch and enjoy my beer. 

D's place had a nice menu, but I wasn't hungry. After seeing the food I can agree that I will go back and probably try some bar food-nothing beats some good bar food! 

Overall, this is a nice place in Soulard and I will go for another visit soon. Our server was great and the drinks were cold.
name: D's Place

text: This bar has gone downhill hardcore in the past couple of years.  Unless you go during drink specials, it is fair expensive to drink at this bar, especially considering it is a half of an old house attached to a laundry mat (which someone got shot at about a year ago).  The building has a lot of character and is very different.  It is is a nice looking place inside and it is relatively clean, with the exception of the bathrooms (not doing any cleaning of facilities until bar closes, from what I've gathered.)  My gf and I have been coming here for about 4-5 years and are very sad to see how downhill the place has gone.  The staff is somewhat rude and very slow.  The food is overpriced, especially for microwaved baked potatoes.  Steaks are decent, but no better than any other random place.  It seems like a lot of the afternoon regulars have stopped going here.  I really can't blame them.  The only reason I can make myself go to this dump is because it is directly up the street and I keep HOPING they will get rid of the rude female bartender and bring back some of the old charm.
name: Pine Room

text: I recently had lunch here and my dining companions agree the food was very good! We had excellent service and this restaurant  is bright and very inviting. Personally I ordered the 1/2 grilled  pimento cheese with the soup of the day. Today's soup was very veggie and you could tell this is a homemade soup. The seasoning was wonderful and there were so many vegetables in the soup my only regret was that I didn't order  a bowl. We all agreed we  will be eating here  again. I can't wait  to see what other wonderful soup will come out of the kitchen on my next visit.

text: I had the Country omelette, though I wouldn't call it that. All the ingredients were just plopped on a plate. It didn't taste great, it was overpowered by a pile of onions. The egg wasn't fluffy (though there was hardly any egg). It wasn't cheap either. It was like a sad attempt to be First Watch, except maybe the chefs were just rejected at all the other jobs. I think I'll stick with IHOP.

text: If you can stand places that allow smoking, and enjoy good food and a good value, you should check D's Place out.  This is the neighborhood bar for many in Soulard.  First of all, drinks are much cheaper than anyplace else in the area (save Cat's Meow).  Just look around.  There are boards advertising early and late night happy hour.... shot specials for the night... 1/2 price deals during sporting events.  If you take some time to check out the specials before you order, you can save some cash.  Also, take time to read the food special board at the end of the bar.  It usually has some kind of item that is not on the regular menu.  Last night they offered a fish wrap.  It sounds kind of boring, but it was really good.  My wife loved her Ruben sandwich.
name: D's Place

text:
And now it's for sale!!!  Who would have thgt with rude bartenders and baaad service. Read review below. 
Rudest bartender EVER!!  Went here with another couple on Saturday afternoon. (2:15pm). The reason I know the time because the rude bartender told a couple who just sat at the bar "lunch is over". Like she was talking to two 5 yr olds. In the meantime a table of 4 were served burgers. She had a total of one table (burgers) and a couple at bar and she told us she would be with us in a minute. Well a minute turned into 5 and she finally got around to us. We ordered and waited and waited while she got a beer for a guy who just walked in and sat at bar. Then she checked on table and checked them out including give them change before she brought 2 millers and a bucket of beer. She disappeared into kitchen and we were done with all drinks and we were waiting again. Well we had planned on hanging out for awhile but after the bad service we decided to go. We asked dor a bill and she came back with a total of $24 for 2 millers and a bucket of buds... domestic beer. R u kidding me!!!  This was pricier than Ameristar casino. So not only did we put up with her being rude and bad service I'm pretty sure she purposely overcharged is to make up for lack of patrons. They need to fire her and get some who wants to work and be pleasant. NEVER will we go back. Beware of the brown haired bartender..she's awful!!
name: Pine Room

attributes.Ambience: {u'divey': True, u'hipster': False, u'casual': None, u'touristy': False, u'trendy': False, u'intimate': False, u'romantic': False, u'classy': False, u'upscale': False}

categories: Nightlife, Restaurants, American (New)

text:
Mushroom and SwIss burger was very large, cooked perfectly and had some tasty seasoning salt. For $6, I wasn't expecting it to be so good, but was happily surprised.

Boyfriend had crappie (the fish crappie, not crappy) dinner with 2 sides for under $15. Portions were large.  He liked the fish. I've never had that kind before so it wasn't my  favorite, but I think I don't like freshwater fish too much. The seasoning was really good and it was cooked well. The cole slaw was creamy and slightly tart just how I like it. Mashed potatoes and gravy were fine. I thought maybe they'd be more chunky and possibly cheesy because this was a hometown type of bar / restaurant. They were creamy and smooth.

Atmosphere was corner bar dive, no windows, TVs with blues game on. Was over half full but not too loud. I liked that a lot. Felt relaxed.

Waitress said she was new but she came back by many times and was nice so I thought she was good.

I would definitely try it again if I was in the area.
name: Pine Room

Where I was really disappointed was the food itself. Twice now my eggs have been cold, so I ordered cheesy grits at my last visit and it was also cold. I don't know if they have an issue with cooking things and leaving them not even under a heat lamp but cold food when you have so many other amazing brunch options is just not where I want to go. text: Quite honestly, this is about the worst place I've been to for sushi.  The miso soup was horrible!  It simply didn't taste right.  My salad had pineapples in it, which I found to be quite unusual.  The steak teriyaki was bland & absolutely tasteless.  The price & quality of the food was not on par with other sushi places.  But, it's close to my house.  I would even be reluctant to try the sushi here.  The price here just doesn't justify the quality of the food.  It's a bit expensive (about $20 per person).  The tea is merely served with a lone tea bag in a cup.  I had expected a tea pot of some sort.  Nope!  Service was great.  The next time I want sushi or Japanese food, I think I'll drive the 30 minutes into the city.

attributes.Ambience: {u'divey': True, u'hipster': False, u'casual': None, u'touristy': False, u'trendy': False, u'intimate': False, u'romantic': False, u'classy': False, u'upscale': False}

categories: Nightlife, Restaurants, American (New)

text:
I found out about D's Place when it was featured as the ROTD here on Yelp. When I arrived, I could tell from the outside it was a dive. Then when I entered, I smiled even more. I was a true dive bar. Or as Eric N.  said, in his ROTD, it is as close to "your neighborhood watering hole" as it can get. The proof was as I sat at the bar enjoying my lunch, all the other patrons greeted each other by name. That's a true neighborhood bar. 

My biggest dilemma was should I order wings or a burger. After getting recommendation from the bartender, I choose to go wings. Especially after I found out, I could choose two different flavors in one order. I went with my favorite, Lemon & Pepper and a bar favorite, Garlic Parmesan.

When ordering wings, I am a stickler for my order having the same amount of flats and drums. D's impressed me, they not only gave me the same amount of flats and drums in my order, they also made sure each flavor had the same amount. 

My wing pieces were good in size and fried to a crispy crunch. Being a true fan of Lemon & Pepper, it was my favorite. I love the tang of lemon and kick of pepper. I can see why their Garlic & Parmesan is a bar favorite. However, I would not recommend them on a date night. I say that with a smile, because they're garlic flavor as good as it was, it was strong. I guess if you share the order, with your date all would be good. (smile)

I was not impressed with the fries that I had as a side with my wings. I'm super picky about my fries and don't care for the type that are seasonally coated. I heard their onion rings are good, so when I come back to experience the, Hell Fire Burger that has fried jalapeÃ±os on it (another favorite of mine) I'll order onion rings as my side. 

Service was dive bar friendly. The bartender called all the other guest by their name. Not knowing mine, she just called me, "Babe" when she checked on me frequently. With only a single bartender covering the entire bar and tables, the service was attentive. 

I'll be back? - Hell Fire Burger is calling my name. 

When: September 11, 2019
Why: 9-4-19 ROTD on Yelp
name: D's Place

categories: Nightlife, Restaurants, American (New)

text:
In warmer months, I often walked my dog, Clyde, past D's Place in Soulard in the early evenings. Everytime we would pass, the aroma emanating from inside was far superior to what this neighborhood watering hole looks like on the outside.  I guess like they say, never judge a book by its cover! 

We are trying our best to support the local bars and restaurants in our new neighborhood as the lucrative summer months wane. Picking up a to go meal is such an easy way to help businesses in the area survive. Since we didn't have plans for dinner, I suggested trying D's. 

I'm giving D's a four star rating because of customer service. When I called in to place my order, the employee was very grumpy and not helpful. I simply asked how many slices were in a 10-inch pizza. (We were having a friend over for dinner as well, so I wanted to make sure we had plenty.) Because this was my first ever time trying D's food, I had no context of size or slice count. The person on the other side of the telephone threw me a little attitude saying "it's square cut. I don't know how many pieces it makes." Well then. Just the info about it being square cut slices was enough to give me an idea of how much I needed to offer. I would give D's a three because of the worker's curtness with me, but actually in these type of situations, it makes the Soulard bar feel more authentic. So hey. Great work creating a real dive bar vibe! (But maybe be a little nicer.)

The menu is pretty on par for what you'd expect for a local bar. Standard items like salads, wings, and sandwiches. I did appreciate the interesting specialty pizzas. When you have thin crust pizza, you might as well dress it up with something exotic! We took the gamble on the Spicy Special, described as Hot sauce, bacon, hamburger & cheddar jack cheese. I impulse bought the Cheesesteak pizza because it just sounded interesting with Pizza sauce topped with sautÃ©ed roast beef, onion, green pepper and pizza cheese. Both pizzas had a lot of flavor. The crust was crunchy with an every so slight doughy texture. And they were even better cold the next day. I would consider going back soon just to put a pie in the fridge overnight for breakfast!
name: D's Place

attributes.Ambience: {'touristy': False, 'hipster': None, 'romantic': None, 'divey': False, 'intimate': None, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': None, 'classy': None, 'casual': True}

categories: American (New), Breakfast & Brunch, Coffee & Tea, Food, Tex-Mex, Cafes, Restaurants

text: How have I never heard of D's before I started looking for new bars to try during my 2021 re-enlightenment.  My first time there the waitress I believe her name was Jessica super nice to us gave some great suggestions for food and always followed up during a busy happy hour time. Everything we had was super fresh and tasted well. The buffalo chicken wontons are a must and if you're in a crowd you might want to order more than one appetizer! The white pizza actually comes with chicken on it see if you can substitute chicken for sausage. I added sausage to it but I think it would've liked it better without chicken either way it was good. Fried pickle chips are perfect and the crust stays on them pretty good unlike other places. The burger we ordered was a little dry so maybe next time order a medium to make sure they don't over cook it. However this would not stop me from returning.  I do look forward to enjoying their patio during the war months because the only downside is the dining room side is extremely loud and it's hard to talk/hear even when you're next to someone. I'm hoping to also try the bar side of the pub next time hoping it's not as loud. It definitely has a local vibe but like I said the waitress was very welcoming and everybody seem like they were just having a great time without any snobbery ... that's what makes Sue lard so great. I honestly don't want to share this because it's a great little secret.
name: D's Place

attributes.Ambience: {u'divey': True, u'hipster': False, u'casual': None, u'touristy': False, u'trendy': False, u'intimate': False, u'romantic': False, u'classy': False, u'upscale': False}

categories: Nightlife, Restaurants, American (New)

text:
It's easy to appreciate D's Place.

Not too many bars understand value around Soulard, but D's Place knows how to bring in patrons, good specials!  I love the specials at D's because it makes me want to spend more money there time and time again.

Yesterday I wanted to catch the Cards game since Chris Carpenter was making his season debut after missing most of the season.  It seemed like a good time to celebrate, despite the final outcome of the game.  D's Place offers half price pizzas, any pizza, during Cardinal games.  I ordered a large specialty pizza for $7.50.  I ate what I wanted while washing it down with two dollar domestics and took the rest home to share with my wife when she got home.

I had the D's Spicy Special: hamburger, bacon, jack cheese, and hot sauce, coupled with a side of ranch for dipping.  I'm not big on hot sauce, but with ranch, it makes for a nice pub snack.  Really I had my wife in mind; otherwise, I would have ordered a meat or chicken pizza.  Either way, I was pretty content.

D's has its few drawback.  First, it draws a lot of middle-aged men. I think the bartender appreciated me for not being an old creeper!  I was there for the game, not to be flirty and gross.  Also, it allows smoking, which, despite the new law, I think is completely okay.  Owners should not be forced to be non-smoking.  However, non-smokers should beware.

Great deals and good service, D's is an ideal place to relax after a long Friday or to catch a Cardinal game!
name: D's Place

text:
We came in on a Friday evening as it was starting to fill up. Mostly for a quick bite to eat. We had heard the pizza was good. We started with the toasted ravioli. It was pretty standard and delicious. We got three small sized bar pizzas. They were Buffalo chicken, chicken bacon ranch and pepperoni. The two chicken pizzas were delicious! Had great flavors. Good ingredients and a thinner, crispy crust. The pepperoni pizza was good, but the crust didn't get as crunchy as the other two. Would have liked to see it cooked another minute or two. 

Drinks were good. The bartenders were nice. Would definitely go back if I were in the area again. Had been drinking several hours. Forgot pictures. I'll do better next time.
name: D's Place

text: Disappointing from the time we arrived.  Initial waitress seated us then grabbed her coat and purse and left. Our new Waitress seemed disinterested in us. After waiting I got up from my seat and went into the waitress station to get our own.  Bland BLT sandwich a vinegar dominant chili I found non-edible.  Restaurant not busy. I guess we weren't worthy of respectful service.

categories: American (New), Breakfast & Brunch, Coffee & Tea, Food, Tex-Mex, Cafes, Restaurants

text:
After coming here for a Yelp Elite event, I knew I had to bring Hubby back. We came nearing the end of November because I HAD TO HAVE those pumpkin pancakes before they weren't on the menu anymore. 

When we arrived we waited more than 5 minutes for an employee to acknowledge us or the couple of people waiting to pay. This did not start the visit off well - especially since multiple employees had come by the area but none of them acknowledged us or the others waiting to pay. If I had not already been here before with amazing service, I would have left before they did acknowledge us and seat us. 

Our server was nice and let me know they did still have the pumpkin pancakes (they were not on the menu). She made some recommendations to Hubby as he was undecided. When the pancakes came out, they did not taste like the last time I had them and I was disappointed - they were very thick and heavy. I ate them and just went with it. Overall none of the food was hot - even the coffee was only warm. That was unusual. 

After getting the bill and going to pay I noticed that it said pancake full order on my receipt. I would have preferred knowing there were options when I ordered as I did not need the large size I received. 

Overall the visit was disappointing and not the same service, food or experience I had during the Elite event.
name: Sunny Street Cafe

text: I suppose it is my fault that I have continued to return to this place.  The service somehow finds a way to get worse and worse.  There are some really nice and great servers that become less memorable as they are overwhelmed by the surly and incompetent servers.  They are still not at full capacity and be prepared to wait to be seated and then wait an inordinate amount of time to see a server and then longer again to receive your meal.  It seems they have a hiring problem and are short staffed in the kitchen.  This is likely our last time here.  It has gotten progressively worse, the orders come out wrong for simple things it has know become ridiculous.  I am out!

text: Looking for a new place to try in Soulard before a show at "Off Broadway" and had heard great things about the wings here. Called up and the bartender (Barbie) answered the call. text: New to the area - we are looking for our go-to Sushi restaurant. I must say - this DEFINITELY will not be it. We tried this first because it's so close to our house. I would rather drive a distance than order anything else from here. Anywhere I've ever been-  $25 gets you two decent sized rolls. Just look at the picture I attached.  It was absolutely pitiful. There was nothing wrong with the taste of what we were served, but the fact that my husband and I had to make dinner after our $25 sushi was absolutely ridiculous. I am utterly disappointed and will never give this place another dollar.

text:
First of all, the Eggs Benedict with hash browns were very good. The sauce had a unusual look, more of a thick splat than a sauce, but still very good. The rest of the experience  not so good.
Upon being seated, my friend and I ordered coffee and iced tea.  It was well over 10 minutes before the drinks were brought to us. This with the restaurant  1/4 full.  What looked to be the manager was at the register  looking at his phone. My friend ordered  a tea refill and a water, after 6 minutes the tea arrived, never saw the water.
Perhaps the staff was short handed in the kitchen but the manager needs to step up and run the show. I will try it again but I'm wary of the number of stumbles.
name: Sunny Street Cafe

Amazing, out of the box breakfast food w familiar yet above average home style pancakes are what gives this place 5 stars.

text:
I understand there is some businesses with diminished staff through this crisis. However if you advertise to be open for curbside service I would expect the food to be actually cooked. It's breakfast. It shouldn't take 1/2 hour to bring to the car. Especially when you say it will be 14 minutes. Plus they forgot napkins and utensils. 
The quality of cuisine was horrible. It's like they just asked anyone who wanted to work that shift. Cooking experience or not. $30 for bad service and crappy, unhealthy, undercooked eggs and potatoes??!!!  Stay away and save your money. Just stay closed until you get your game together. I feel fleeced.
name: Sunny Street Cafe

text: We eat chick fil a at least once a week. This is by far the worst location I've been to. I am an A-List member and I handed it to the young guy and he swiped it and threw it on the counter at me. The counter was all sticky with soda. I picked up my sticky card, getting my hand and other cards sticky, and told him next time he should hand the customer back their card and they need to clean their counters. I think he said sorry but he did not wipe the counter. The next lady sat her purse on it. What a mess. The staff is not of top of things. The chesterfield location is the standard of how chick fil a's should operate. Courteous staff, friendly, and clean. The food was hot and fresh, and for that 2 stars instead of 1.

text:
I first experienced Chick-fil-A while attending college at SEMO (I will NOT tell you how long ago...), and it has been a favorite since then. It's on the more costly end of fast food restaurants, but the taste of the chicken far outstrips other fast food places, and even most sit-down restaurants! Their chicken is not over processed chicken product, but great cuts of real chicken breast, lightly but flavorfully breaded & juicy (Now I'm hungry). They also have some of the BEST lemonade and when I used to work nearby, I would often take home a gallon jug to keep at home (just be on the lookout for seeds, this is the real deal). Also, (a college friend turned me on to this), mix the honey mustard with a packet of mayo to dip the waffle fries in...it's life affirmingly good. They also serve breakfast, but I have yet to try it as they don't have one close to my home (almost a reason to move).

They are closed on Sunday so their workers can have the day to devote to their families and the Lord. While this can be disappointing when I'm out on a Sunday, I respect that they're not only standing by their beliefs, but also making sure their employees can have a decent family life. It just makes me like them more.

Recommended Items:
Chicken Sandwich (breaded chicken breast+toasted bun+pickles = delish)
Nuggets (also dip in Honey Mustard/Mayo mixture!)
Grilled Chicken Sandwich (I prefer grilled everywhere but here, but it's still good!)
Chicken Salad Sandwich
Grilled Chicken Cool Wrap
Hearty Breast of Chicken Soup (almost like homemade, FANTASTIC when you're ill)
Waffle Potato Fries (mmmm)
Fruit Cup (it's fresh fruit, not some junk in syrup, so yummy)
LEMONADE!!!
name: Chick-fil-A

text: I normally avoid fast food but Chick-fil-A is the exception. There are three reasons why. The food is fresh and tastes great, the food is ready lightning fast and the service is fantastic. Today was no exception. We arrived just ahead of the lunch rush. I had a spicy chicken sandwich with waffle fries and a lemonade while my wife had the chicken sandwich, waffle fries and sweet tea. The food arrived promptly, check, tasted great, check, and the service was spot on from placing the order to the free refills served at the table, check.  Consistently good.
name: Chick-fil-A

text:
It's fast food, yes. It's not very refined, yes. It's fried, yes. It's a company whose core values I completely disagree with, yes. I really like Chick-fil-A though. I always have. I ate the nuggets when I was a kid at Chesterfield Mall and they still taste the same. They are crispy and fresh and taste like real chicken instead of a mystery. Their sauces are great. Today I ordered nuggets for breakfast! Their employees are friendly. I'll pass on their politics but the food is always good.

*I'd hate for someone to swab the play area and test what they find in there. I avoid that area like the plague when I go in.
name: Chick-fil-A

VERY friendly staff. FAST service even when completely full on Black Friday lunch. Haven't been to one of these places in many years. Food is high quality but not quite what I remembered from years ago.

text: Wow that is some great chicken! I had the chicken sandwich with lettuce and tomato and cheese and it was great. The employees are very polite and courteous . Their standard fries are waffle fries, mine weren't very crisp but they were good and there was a good amount. I will go back again, even if it's 1145 lunch rush  . I was very impressed because the restaurant was very busy but the employees still took time to courteously stop and help patrons with small children , offering to sit with children so parents could get napkins or ketchup or go get a highchair . The employees were very kind courteous and helpful. And you won't find that kind of service at any other fast food restaurant!

text:
Gotta say I never was interested in Chickfila until my daughter in law brought lunch to our house. The chicken and waffle fries were very good.  And once I tried the cobb salad with avocado lime ranch dressing, I became hooked.

Since then we have become regular customers.   Not only is the quality of the food good,  the service is incredible.  As a staffing recruiter I commend Chick-fil-a on their hiring standards.   The level of customer service we receive each and every time is top notch and what brings us back time and time again.  I would love to snag some of your employees for customer service jobs I have,  but fortunately for you they are not local positions.   
Keep up the great job!
name: Chick-fil-A

text: Remember when you used to go to your grandma's house and she would desperately do everything in her power to make sure you were happy, comfortable, and most importantly WELL FED?? Well, if you go to this Chick-fil-A, get ready to experience that all over again. Because the people in this Chick-fil-A are absolutely desperate to make sure you are happy, comfortable, and well fed. Seriously, I have been to restaurants in Germany, France, Italy, Mexico, you name it. I have been to 5 star restaurants, and restaurants that require a reservation a month in advance and I HAVE NEVER BEEN ANYWHERE WITH CUSTOMER SERVICE THAT IS NEARLY AS GOOD AS THE ONE THEY HAVE HERE.
name: Chick-fil-A

text:
Chick-fil-a is one of my favorite fast food places to hit up! This location is particularly great -- new-ish, free-standing (unlike the mall counterparts...though there are lots of free standing stores popping up), and convenient location for me.

When I make the great decision to go to CFA, I am pleased. It is very clean inside the restaurant, even the bathrooms (one of the few fast food bathrooms I visit -- I'm bathroom weird!). Staff are friendly and courteous (though the 'my pleasure' phrase can get tired). They are thoughtful with extras -- I love those ketchup containers! The food is hot, fresh, and delicious -- and man, can they make a good chicken breast! If I'm craving a good chicken sandwich, CFA is where you will find me!

My beefs (ha!): sometimes when I order no pickles, they are on there. And by then the juice has saturated the bun and my chicken. It's a whole thing.

WHY closed on Sunday? I inevitably find myself craving some CFA on a random Sunday only to find myself disappointed with the closed sign when I cruise past :'( True heartbreak.

In closing: Keep opening more CFAs! Keep up the good work! Political issues aside, you are the bomb!
name: Chick-fil-A

text:
When it comes to reviewing fast food, you have to compare it to fast food. Obviously I'd eat a whole list of other places before Chick-fil-A but sometimes there is a time and a place for these kinds of eats. 

Chick-fil-A is pretty much a top tier fast-food joint when you ask me. Clean restaurants, nice staff and a great menu. I could probably eat like 50 chicken nuggets in one sitting. And their waffle fries are bomb. While nothing beats McDonald's fries, these are pretty great. 

While I'm sure nothing here is fresh, it doesn't taste as greasy as most other fast food joints. I'll take one of their chicken sandwiches any day. Also, their breakfast ain't bad either.
name: Chick-fil-A

text:
Awesome atmosphere -- can't deny that. Southwest Tacos were great. The reason for my low review is the service. It was incredibly disappointing to have such a cool place be paired with bad service. 

Sat solo at the bar while traveling through the area. I was ordering food but not drinking any alcohol -- maybe that's the reason for the inattentiveness. It took an abnormally long amount of time for someone to acknowledge me & then a while to get my food order placed, especially when the bar area didn't have many people seated. 

I'd give it another shot, but am disappointed in the lack of service I had while I was there.

text: Outstanding food and amazingly efficient service!  The rewards program is good and during COVID 19 having the ability to pay within the app makes visits even safer.  This seems like the safest drive-through because everything looks clean and the employees seem to behave as safe as possible.  Best things on menu are bacon, egg and cheese bagel (warm, toasty and will fill you up till lunch), Cobb salad (huge portion, great avocado lime ranch dressing), chocolate shakes (best shake anywhere), and the original chicken sandwich (perfect temperature, moist, thick, high quality chicken).  Employees seem happy and every visit are professional, pleasant and super organized which makes you sad they are closed on Sundays.

text: We are always searching for great tacos and were thrilled when we found this place.  My boyfriend is from Mexico City and a chef and is very picky about where he eats.  This place was a huge hit.   The three salsas we tried were all great, spicy and still tasty.  The avacado salsa was my favorite.  The store is great too lots of things that brought him back to his childhood (40+ years ago) they had which He was excited about.  Will be back soon!!
name: El Jarocho Mexican Store And Taqueria
categories: Restaurants, International Grocery, Food, Mexican

text:
Something STL really has lacked for awhile are good street tacos. That's why I am so glad this place opened up in the Twin Oaks area. This is a Mexican grocery store and resturant combined. I only got the street tacos but I'm excited to try the rest of their menu. You walk in and order your food at the register. Service is extremely friendly as it is family owned. There's hightop seating and regular tables for you to sit down and wait for your food but you could also shop around in the grocery store section. The food is picked up fresh from the kitchen. 

Now the tacos: pollo asada used chicken thigh it seemed and it was delicious. Good choice using dark meat as it was very juicy!Al pastor was phenomenal and the lengua was sooo good. They can provide salsa with your order. 100% recommend the avacado salsa!!
name: El Jarocho Mexican Store And Taqueria
categories: Restaurants, International Grocery, Food, Mexican

text: Absolutely delicious tacos and tamales. Enjoyed them both tonight. You can preorder tamales and they only have them available on Friday. Love the market .... so clean and neat.
name: El Jarocho Mexican Store And Taqueria
categories: Restaurants, International Grocery, Food, Mexican

text: Food was good but the cost vs portions are not a great deal. I could eat 10 taco s. At 2.99 the mini tacos are overpriced. But food is good and quality is good. 3 stars because of portion size

categories: Restaurants, International Grocery, Food, Mexican

text: I'm only giving 2 stars because our food was good. However, service was terrible. We were there a total of two and a half hours. Our drinks were only refilled one time. At one point, we flagged down who we believed to be the manager to ask for more water. Instead of bringing everyone a refill, he brought us one glass (for a table of 9) and told us our waiter would be around soon. It seemed as though he was only interested in meeting the needs of the young ladies in the restaurant.  I also wouldn't waste your money trying to play any of the games.  We lost money on almost everything we put money into.

text: We didn't shop here for groceries but we did get some fantastic street tacos from very friendly folks. They have a little kitchen in the back of the store. They really only 2 types of food: street tacos and tortas. I love that they ask for each order if you want cilantro and onions so I didn't have to make a special request to omit onion. We picked up a large order and it ready right on time. The tacos and the tortas were great. I will say all their salsas are spicy which was bummer for me but my family loved them. At the front of store They sell baked goods from Chico's bakery too. We tried a couple of things. The pumpkin roll was kinda dry but the pasty that looks like 2 buns together was pretty good.

categories: Restaurants, International Grocery, Food, Mexican

text:
After circling around this crazy lot, we decided to dine in at this busy location. It was very busy on a Saturday afternoon, but we were able to find a table, and it was clean! Despite how packed it was, servers called loudly to make sure you heard your order come up. There are free refills, but the machine resides behind the counter, and I was bummed to have to wait in line-- but the second I walked up with my cup, I was noticed, and my drink order was taken, just like that! I was impressed I didn't have to wait, and grateful. The staff also made rounds checking on everyone if they needed anything. They definitely went above and beyond here to make it an enjoyable fast food experience.

I ordered the asian style salad- crispy chicken and other delicious toppings. It was pretty good, but nothing life changing. Overall, I enjoyed my experience way more than I thought possible for fast food. Keep up the great work!
name: Chick-fil-A

text: Love this place. The lady up at the front is super nice to us whenever we go. They sell various products and food items, plus there's a small eatery inside and I usually get their street tacos or soup of the day. Relatively fast service so we never wait long for food. They also serve a special drink like melon water, horchata, different flavor depending on the day. My kiddo usually gets chicken quesadilla followed by a popsicle. Casual and friendly ambience, highly recommended
name: El Jarocho Mexican Store And Taqueria
categories: Restaurants, International Grocery, Food, Mexican

text:
I have been coming to this place almost weekly for about 6 months. .  And for a reason.  They serve authentic Mexican food.  Having spent my college years in San Antonio, Texas, I learned what real Mexican food was, and what it tasted like.  It's hard to find that same authentic Mexican flavor once you leave Texas.  Especially in Missouri.  But once you spend any amount of time in El Jarocho, you realize it's the real deal.  Authentic Mexican food that rivals any US border town.  

I've been in this store several times during lunch hour to find that most of the people there are Mexicans.  If the Mexicans are going there for lunch, then that says something about the authenticity of their food!

The Barbacoa street tacos are to die for.  My wife loves the Pescado (fish) tacos. And my favorite salsa is the Avocado salsa.  Just the right blend of avocados and spice.  Tons of flavor, but not so hot you can't taste it.  

And while you are waiting for your freshly cooked food, you can browse through their Mexican store, which is complete with authentic Mexican items.   It feels like you are shopping in a store in Mexico!  

If you are looking for an authentic piece of Mexico in Missouri, look no further!
name: El Jarocho Mexican Store And Taqueria
categories: Restaurants, International Grocery, Food, Mexican

text: Every now and then my mom and I come here, the workers are very very friendly and the place is always clean and the food is so good!!! We always ask for sauce each visit!!

text:
I have been looking for good, authentic, street tacos for the better part  of my life spent here in the STL (18 years).   Looked thru Yelp, read these reviews, and within 5 minutes of that, took off to search for the place.  

In a small shopping strip, hides this jewel in Valley Park - Stone Gate Strip Mall - off of Big Bend, near Fritz's Custard.  

I have finally found GREAT STREET TACOS!

Located within the store, the food counter is near the back, but you have to order at the cashier station.  I ordered 2-Carne Asada and 1-Pollo Street Tacos.  Nikki (who is very welcoming and friendly) suggested I try the Verde, Roja and Avocado salsa to go w/the tacos and I'm glad she did!  All 3 were delicious, which made my tacos even better (although the meat was very flavorful - it honestly didn't need the enhancement of the salsa.  But what are tacos without salsa??  It's like PB&J without the J.....but I digress......)

The picture and my review really don't give these tacos justice.   Just go and eat here.  Place is the bomb.......
name: El Jarocho Mexican Store And Taqueria
categories: Restaurants, International Grocery, Food, Mexican

text:
They offer outdoor seating that is located in the heart of the Together Plaza. I can see the entrance to the Busch stadium from here.  There was a DJ playing loud dance music during my visit.

Food and drinks are pricey in this area.  We sat outside where there was no table service and went inside to order drinks.  The view is great and there were lots of people watching to do.

text:
Tis the seasoning!  Not a typo...but a little like Christmas in July.  
Just open for 2 1/2 months, this little gem should be on your list for street tacos.  Amazing!  
Wife works the register at the front (where you place your order or call it in for pick up or curbside service), husband works in the back making street tacos and sandwiches.  There are four tables, seat yourself, so that's an option too. Service was outstanding...friendly, helpful, order ready in record time. I can only comment here on the tacos and will probably never make a change in the future to their sandwiches because tacos are just that good.  
So back to my opening comment...without the proper seasoning, most food never makes it to that next level of flavor.  Well it sure does here.  Everything from the cebollitas (fried green onions - be sure to try) to the tacos (carne asada, al pastor and daily special when I went...champechanos) were truly delicious.  There were many more taco options, some of which I will be trying soon...maybe not the cow tongue but hey, there is something for everyone.  Onions and cilantro are options on all tacos which are all made with corn tortillas...tortillas that didn't break even by the time we got our carry out home.  
You might be thinking...where are the mouth watering pictures?  Well, that was my plan until I saw my neighbor eating here who had to return after eating here just yesterday.  It's that good!
name: El Jarocho Mexican Store And Taqueria
categories: Restaurants, International Grocery, Food, Mexican

text:
THE SERVICE HERE SUCKS! the managers are ridiculous. I placed a breakfast mobile order at 10:25am and got to the drive thru just minutes from the 10:30am cut off time for breakfast and my order was not made and it would not go through. They said this  independentLy owned location and thats how it works. When i was able to do this a few times before and no problems. 

 I walked in and talked to the managers myself and they are just rude and unprofessional. I am definitely not going back here anymore. Sadly this is one of my favorite locations due to close to home, PLEASE HIRE EMPLOYEES  one of them name is cierra (unsure of spelling) WITH MANNERS who can solve a situation professionally.
name: Chick-fil-A

text:
We popped in here prior to a game to wait out the lines to get in. We started at the outdoor bar window, and service was phenomenal. The bartender chatted us up, didn't rush us, and made really great drinks. Prices were WAY cheaper than in the stadium, so we gladly paid the $8/drink out there.

Once we finished that drink, we moved inside for a second. Again, quick service, great drinks.

Considering the game was starting, we were surprised that this spot wasn't packed, it was really easy to maneuver and get around. We even got a game of Ski Ball in, which was awesome.

We didn't eat here, so I can't speak on that, but I'd you're looking for good drinks, cheaper prices than the stadium, and food service before the game, this is the spot!
name: Sports & Social STL

First time at this new place and it was really good! Had the barbacoa, Al pastor, carnitas and pescado street tacos. All were very good, my favorites were the barbacoa and carnitas. Will be going back again for sure!

P.S. Would've taken a photo but I was so hungry and the food looked so good, it was all gone before I even thought about a photo!

text: This is a weekly stop for me. Since I discovered this on the Nextdoor app, I have been hooked. The avocado salsa is so good and every taco I have tried is delicious.
name: El Jarocho Mexican Store And Taqueria
categories: Restaurants, International Grocery, Food, Mexican

text: Terrific, traditional street Tacos and Tortas. The corn shells they use are great, they stuff it with protein and their avocado based salsa is a great accent. Family ran and you can taste their attention to detail in the fresh product they are putting out.
name: El Jarocho Mexican Store And Taqueria
categories: Restaurants, International Grocery, Food, Mexican

text:
The fish tacos are outstanding! I also enjoyed the carnitas and the carne asada. You must get the avocado salsa. It is sooooo good. The woman at the register that takes your order is such a sweetheart. 
So glad to have this in the neighborhood. Will definitely try the breakfast menu!
name: El Jarocho Mexican Store And Taqueria
categories: Restaurants, International Grocery, Food, Mexican

text: I happened upon this new business in the Stonegate shopping center after I got my hair cut. I needed a quick lunch and saw their banner that said "street tacos" so I decided to try it. These were the BEST tacos I have had!  They were so full of flavor and their salsas were great too. I had 2 carne asada (steak) tacos and 2 El Pastor (pork and pineapple) tacos. Since my first visit less than 2 weeks ago I have been back three times!
name: El Jarocho Mexican Store And Taqueria
categories: Restaurants, International Grocery, Food, Mexican

text: I usually go to this location but I'm not happy . I work down the street and didn't have time to turn around on my lunch to talk to a manger my deluxe chicken sandwich had a fly on it and my sweet tea had a fly in too. I'm 9 months pregnant so it ruined my appetite and probably the nastiest thing that's ever happened to me when eating. A waste of $9 and my time.

text: Sports & Social STL is a great place to eat before a Cardinals game. You are able to get amazing food for about the same as bad food in the ballpark. The service was nice and helpful at answering questions. I ordered the Avocado Ranch Burger and it was really good. The combination of Ranch and Avocado really played off each other and created a nice relaxing burger. It came with fries, which I wasn't very happy about, but they were surprisingly good. They were and nice texture with lots of salt so they had lots of taste. This is the second great experience my family has had at Sports and Social and they have earned themselves 5 stars.
name: Sports & Social STL

text: The street tacos are so good, I had them for lunch 3 days in a row. Melt in your mouth. Side of beans and rice are authentic and so flavorful. Can't wait to try more of their food. It is a limited menu, but that only means specialized excellent food. You won't get the heavy carb plain Americanized food here. Store items are great as well!
